loans.name: Uuganchimeg

texts.en:
Uuganchimeg is 27 years old and lives with her husband and son in the Dornogobi province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in an apartment. They have been living in their current home for five years. During the day, she operates a food-trading business in her hometown. Uuganchimeg started trading meal and semi-finished meat products, such as sausage, with her husband out of a rental counter at a local trading center in May 2009. They have expanded their business and started to sell a variety of food products such as bakery, milk and milk products and dumplings at a local market. 

Uuganchimeg purchased a freezer and a refrigerator to keep her products fresh. Originally, she had operated a bistro at the rental place between 2004-2009. Over the years, she has gained great experience and her food-trading business has became well-known in her home province. With her business profit, she purchased a LCD television and a washing machine for her family. 

Uuganchimeg is an open-minded person. She says, “I would like to purchase a more convenient workplace to save money for the rent. In addition, I would like to expand my business and to sell a variety (of) types of food products. I have been planning to conduct a buffet based on the semi-finished meat products in the future.” 

Uuganchimeg is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrugs loan to purchase the refrigerators to keep the milk and milk products fresh.

loans.use: To purchase refrigerators for her business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda M. is from the village of Pilpila, Santa Ignacia, Tarlac. She is 48 years old and single. To make a living, Yolanda has been running a general store for over 5 years and she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.  Yolanda joined ASKI in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from ASKI and she is now requesting her fourth loan of 12000 PHP in order to purchase new items and expand her product offering.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the product offering in her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Josephine C. believes that one day, her dream of making her backyard poultry-raising business stable will come true through the loans she can access through ASHI. Presently, she is requesting another loan, which she will be using as additional capital for her business. Her husband supports her desire for this because they both want their three children, whose ages range from 6 to 11 years old, to go to college in the future through her business profits in addition to the small income her husband is earning through his small fishing business.

After 45 days of raising, Josephine’s chickens will be sold to be slaughtered or sold alive to people around their village or sold to meat vendors in the public market.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks for raising

The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Esterlita S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Esterlita S. is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Esterlita S. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Song's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for four borrowers. They all live in the province of Siem Reap. The leader, Mrs. S., is 29 years old, married, and has two kids. Both of her children are students and are dependent on her. Her husband, Savuth, 33, owns a boat that he uses to provide a transportation service and he is able to earn around $5 a day.

Mrs. S. owns and runs a small enterprise selling souvenirs to tourists who come to visit the temples. Recently, S. sold nearly all her items and she wants to acquire more for her shop. Because S. doesn’t have money, she decided to request a loan as capital to buy extra souvenirs to sell.

The three other borrowers are:

Mrs. K., 31, a fish seller, who needs a loan to increase her business capital.

Mrs. C. works as a laborer in a night club and requests a loan to add to her savings in order to buy a new motor to meet her travelling needs. 

Mrs. S. is an internal staff member in an entertainment club and needs a loan to replace her old motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy extra souvenirs to sell.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Development Group, Jinja

texts.en:
At the top left in the small photo is K. Stephen, as he also appears in the big group photo. He is a 30-year-old married man with two kindergarten children aged 5 and 2. He also has one dependent he takes care of.

To shoulder his responsibility of taking care of these kids well, Stephen sells farm produce, operating his modest business in Jinja’s central market. He started off his business with capital of 400,000 Ugandan shillings in 2008, under the auspices of the Kamu Kamu Development Group.

Currently, Stephen says he makes profits to the tune of 80,000 shillings per week although he is constantly accosted by customers who want to take goods on credit and the destructive rainy seasons are just some of the challenges he has faced. Despite all this, he says he remains an individual with huge reserves of optimism and good relationship skills. This has played in his favor most of the times and his future plans are to own a shop and to build his permanent residence.

With a loan of 300,000 shillings, Stephen envisages a bright business future for himself on the horizon, as he will use the loan to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Armando Jorge

texts.pt:
Armando Jorge Xirinda nasceu no Distrito da Manhiça, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 41 anos de idade casado e pai de 4 filhos de 10, 07 e dois de 14 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 10ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 1 sobrinho que vive com ele.
Saiu do Distrito da Manhaça para o Distrito de Boane ainda na Província de Maputo com a sua família, refugiando se da guerra de desestabilizava que assolou o pais durante a década 80. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 4 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e vende mais mantas, micro-ondas, arcondicionados, geleiras e outros. Consegue um rendimento mensal de cerca de 20.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (banheira, geleira, micro onda e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para expandir o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Armando Jorge Xirinda was born in the district of Manhiça, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. He is 41 years old and married. He is the father of a 17-year-old, two 14-year-olds, and a 10-year-old, all of whom attend school. He only went to school through the 10th grade, and wasn't able to continue because of his family's difficult financial circumstances. He lives in his own house with his family, and also supports a nephew who lives with them. He and his family left Manhiça for Boane, also in Maputo Province, fleeing the war that devastated the country during the '80s. He's had his own business for more than four years. He doesn't have any employees, and sells blankets, microwaves, air conditioners, refrigerators, etc. He earns about 20,000 meticals a month, which is enough to cover household expenses with a little left over to keep in his savings account. He's never received loans from other banks. He learned about Hvuluku through friends who are also Hvuluku clients. This is his second loan, in the amount of 25,000 meticals, which he will use to buy products (bathtubs, refrigerators, microwaves, etc.) to increase the amount of merchandise he carries. He's committed to paying this loan off on time so that in the future he'll be eligible for others. He'd like to request additional loans to expand his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling refrigerators, microwaves, etc.

loans.name: Virgilio Augusto

texts.pt:
Virgílio Augusto C. nasceu no Distrito de Macanga, Província de Tete, norte de Moçambique tem 42 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos de 14, 10, e 7 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 9ą classe parou porque na altura foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu da província de Tete para Maputo cumprindo o serviço militar, mais tarde fixou sua residência em Boane. Depois da sua desmobilização, integrou se como funcionário e agente da segurança do estado (SISE), onde opera há mais de 10 anos neste ramo. Tem um salário mensal de 4.250.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas do serviço que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (pintos para criação, vitaminas, ração e outros) para fortificar ainda mais o seu negócio.
Compromete se apagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais créditos para construir uma mini-mercearia e expandir o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Virgílio Augusto C. was born in Macanga district in Tete province, northern Mozambique. He 42 years old and a married father of 3 children, 14, 10 and 7 years old. All attend school. He completed the ninth grade but had to stop because at that point he was drafted into obligatory military service. He lives with his family in his own home. He has no other dependents. He left Tete province for Maputo when he started military service, and later established residence in Boane district. After completing his military service, he joined the state security service (SISE) where he has worked for the past ten years. He earns a monthly salary of 4,250 MZN that goes towards his household expenses, and he still manages to save some to his bank account. He has never taken out loans through other banks, and he learned about Hluvuku through work colleagues who are already clients of the organization. This is his second loan for 25,000 MZN, with which he plans to purchase products (chicks for raising, vitamins, feed, and others) to strengthen his business. He promises to pay off this loan on time in order to take out others. In the future he would like apply for further loans to build a mini-market and expand his business.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising chickens (chicks, vitamins, feed and others)

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 22 year old single man living with his parents and 7 brothers and sisters. Starting 7 years ago, when he was young, he started going with his father and learning the fishing business. He became a talented fisherman and in 2004 he started working on his own. He sells the fish in a large fish market very well known in the whole region. Mohamad is thankful for his work as it allows him to assist with his family's income. 

Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase fishing supplies such as fishing nets and other items before the summer season, which is  considered the high season for the fishers where he could make a good income for the whole year.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith A. is 54 years old, a widow, and has three children. She is also a happy grandmother.
Judith owns a grocery store where she sells various kinds of groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She started this grocery business four years ago. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket. Judith hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Abilio Assane

texts.pt:
Abílio Assane M. nasceu na Província de Zambézia, centro de Moçambique tem 47 anos de idade casado e pai de 6 filhos de 26, 24, 18, 10, 6, e 3 anos de idade, todos vão a escola menos o de 3 anos. Fez 9ą classe parou porque na altura foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ele.
Saiu da província de Zambézia para Maputo cumprindo o serviço militar em 1980, mais tarde resolvei não voltar a terra natal. Fixou sua residência em Boane no bairro 2 depois da sua desmobilização e começou a trabalhar numa agência de informação (jornal Noticias) como recepcionista. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 9.028.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus vizinhos que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 22.100.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, chapas de zinco e outros) para continuar com construção da sua residência.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e oferecer o melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Abílio Assane M. was born in Zambézia province in central Mozambique. He is 47 years old, married, and the father of six children: 26, 24, 18.10, 6 and 3 years old. All go to school apart from the three year old. He completed ninth grad, but stopped when he did his national military service. He lives with his family in his own home, and supports two grandchildren who live with him. He left Zambézia for Maputo when he finished his military service in 1980, and later decided not to return to his birthplace. He established residence in Boane after he was discharged and began to work as a receptionist at an information agency (Jornal Noticias). He does not supervise other employees, and earns a monthly salary of 9,028 MZN that he uses to pay his household expenses, still managing to save some in his bank account. He has never taken out loans with other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through his neighbors who are already clients. This is his fourth loan, for 22,100 MZN, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, galvanized roofing sheets, etc.) to continue constructing his house. In the future he would like to apply for additional loans to complete his home and provide more comfort for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, galvanized roofing sheets and others)

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli R. is from the village of Pilpila, Sta. Ignacia, Tarlac. He is 41 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Noli owns and operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport in the local community. Noli has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Noli joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase equipment to improve his business. Noli is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be his fourth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 50 years old, married to a civil servant, and is blessed with four children. She is a hardworking and friendly woman. Florence is determined to lift her business and family above poverty, and has a good relationship with Kiva partner, LAPO.
Florence sells sarongs, shoes and jewelry of various colors and shapes. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs, shoes and jewelry to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, shoes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Siem's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers contains five members.

Mr. Siem S., 36, has been selected to be group leader by the members. He has two children who are studying at the secondary school. He earns a living by driving a motorcycle taxi and also works as a requirement laborer. He is married to Kean Sam, 35, who works selling a few groceries from home.

Recently Siem S. feels upset; he can’t earn much income because his motor taxi often is broken and is not attractive to the customers. To resolve the problem, Siem S. decided to seek a loan to replace his broken taxi.

The other four members of the group are:

Mr. H. is a taxi (Tuk Tuk) driver who requests a loan to replace his old taxi.

Mrs. S. is a single lady selling groceries to earn a living. She needs a loan to accumulate more grocery items.

Mrs. S. sells cooking ingredients from home and she requests a loan to accrue her business capital.

Mrs. Y. is a head chef for other parties. She is asking for a loan to buy an old motorcycle to ride to work. (Mrs. Y. was not available for photographing so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To replace a broken taxi.

loans.name: Nosa

texts.en:
Nosa E. is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She owns a grocery store where she sells various kinds of groceries, foodstuffs and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She has been in the grocery business for a long time and uses her experience in business to attract and retain customers.
Nosa is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket. She hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. Nosa says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo D. C. is from the village of Pilpila, Sta. Ignacia, Tarlac. He is 49 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Bernardo owns and operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport in the local community. Bernardo has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Bernardo joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Bernardo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his fourth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Kakira Women's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
A. Mariane appears at the top left in a small photo and also in the big photo seated on a chair at the far right.

Mariane is a 27 year-old diligent and married mother of three. She also looks after two orphans.

Mariane operates her brewing business in Kakira, Jinja, which she has been doing for the last seven years. Despite problems like the scarcity of firewood and a lack of transport, she has been able to make the best out of these bad bargains. As a result, she has been able to send her children and the orphan under her care, to primary school, notwithstanding the fact that she earns only 20,000 shillings a week.

To all appearances, Mariane’s customers have come to like her on the basis of her work ethic and her hospitality. Her future reckoning is to be able to deliver her supplies on a bigger scale to her customers. She anticipates that a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings will be her tower of support for her planned future endeavors.

loans.use: To buy bananas, jerrycans (plastic containers) and sorghum for her local brewing business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is 37 years old, married, and has three children, the eldest of whom is 12 years old. Her children all attend school and this makes her happy. Victoria's husband is a laundry man and he also supports their home.
Victoria owns a beauty salon where she creates lovely hairstyles for her customers. She also sells hair and beauty accessories, shoes and bags. She has a good relationship with Kiva partner, LAPO, and is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more beauty accessories, bags and shoes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty accessories, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is the leader of three members of a group. She is married with two children. Both of her children go to school. She resides in and rents a one-room house where she is staying with four people. Rehema takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area. She incurs little transport costs to and from buying chickens from Bwaise. She does her shopping twice a week and buys from Bwaise market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city.  She sells to 10 customers a day. Rehema sells to all categories of people at retail and works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include daily market dues, rent for her residence and medication. She has been in this business for eight years. Rehema has been with MCDT for two weeks, servicing her first loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more chickens for resale. Rehema hopes to see her business grow bigger and to start raising chickens herself.

Rehema is wearing a brown skirt in the middle of the photo with her three group mates.  
 

.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for reasle

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a single 28-year-old woman who lives with her mother. She learned her hairdressing and beauty trade in an academic school in her town. In 2000, she opened her beauty shop and started to make a profit. She helps her mother, who owns a small lingerie shop, to make a good income and meet the heavy expenses of life. Malak caters to a wide range of clientele in her village and its neighborhoods, and a good number of clients visit her shop because of the good service she offers.
Today, Malak plans to offer a new beauty service to her customers and so she wants to buy a tattoo machine. She needs to borrow $1,200 USD, and is certain that her business productivity and income will both increase as a result of this loan.

loans.use: To buy a tattoo machine

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita L. is from the village of Zone II, Tariji, Tarlac. She is 45 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing beauty salon services in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Conchita joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline O. is 45 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the home.
Roseline sells jewelry, traditional beads, clothes, shoes and hats. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Roseline has been in this business for a long time and hopes that her business will grow bigger and stronger. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more jewelry, traditional beads, clothes and shoes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes, traditional beads and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina A., 43 years old, lives on farming. She is married and a mother of seven children. Her rice farm is the only source of income her family has. She helps her husband maintain their farm so they can have food to eat and clothes to wear. One of the challenges they face is their children’s education.

Aquilina has been a member of CEVI for almost two years now. She said that her previous loans were really helpful to her business and family. She is now applying for a loan of 14,000 PHP. She will use it to acquire farm requirements such as seeds, fertilizers and other items.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Charish

texts.en:
“I am thankful for my farm because it helps my family a lot,” Charish L. shares about her business.

Only 22 years old, Charish knows how to maintain her farm. She is married and has a 2-year-old child. Her husband also works at their farm, making sure it is free of pests and weeds.

Charish joined CEVI in 2008 because she was in need of financial support for her business. She hopes for its program to grow to be able to help more entrepreneurs like her.

Charish would like to ask for a loan of 14,000 PHP. She tells CEVI that she will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farming inputs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira C. spends most of her time working at her farm. She helps her husband maintain their rice farm, which is located in their hometown in Agusan Del Sur. She has nine children and the oldest is age 27. She said that with a big family like hers, she has to double her effort to be able to earn. Despite all the challenges, Elvira is determined to succeed in her ventures.

Elvira is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She is applying for a loan of 14,000 PHP. With this amount, she will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs she needs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Ernanie

texts.en: Ernanie is a hard-working father of two children. He is 34 years old and involved in rice farming. He joined CEVI in 2008 hoping to gain access to its program. He said that he is still thankful for the MFI’s program. He particularly likes the low interest rate. He is now requesting a loan because he needs inputs for his farm. He will buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs that his rice farm lacks.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Jecebel

texts.en: Jecebel is a mother of seven children. She is 36 years old and married. She has been involved in farming for more than a few years now. She cultivates her land for her rice crop, which is a main necessity among Filipinos. She has financial struggles so she joined a microfinance institution. She said that CEVI’s program is very helpful to farmers like her. She is now applying for a loan amounting to PHP14,000. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Marycil

texts.en: Marycil is married to Jeffrey and they now have four children. The oldest is 12. She does farming for a living. She and her husband cultivate their land for rice crops. She said she wants all her children to have a proper education and a bright future so she also works hard to achieve it. She spends her whole day at the farm to be sure it will be productive. She currently needs farm inputs for it so she applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of PHP6,000. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Gemelita's Group

texts.en:
Gemelita G. is from the village of Buenavista. She is 40 years old. Gemelita is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gemelita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemelita sells dried foods in the local community. Gemelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Gemelita joined PMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemelita successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Gemelita is requesting her sixth loan from PMPC, for 7000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed for her products. She will use the additional revenue to improve her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for products to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
In ten years of farming, Rosalie C. has experienced a lot of difficulties especially financially. But she worked very hard to be able to maintain her farm and earn a living.

Having 5 children, she and her husband double their efforts to keep up with the increasing needs of their family. Now that it is planting season, Rosalie is seeking financial assistance to be able to acquire the inputs her farm needs.

She has applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI, which she will use to buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and other items.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Seng M., a 34 year old married man, is the leader of a small four-member group loan. All the borrowers live in Siem Reap Province.

Since 1995, Seng M. has been a fisherman along the river. The river is full of fish in this great season. He also receives help from his wife to fish. The couple has three children who are students and also help their parent’s business when they are not studying.

Seng M. lacks some materials for fishing. So he decided to seek a loan of $300 to buy nets and traps for his fishing operation.

Mr. T., age 40, is requesting a loan to purchase more tools for his fishing business.

Mrs. C., age 31, is requesting a loan to decorate her house.

Mrs. C., 50 years old, is asking for a loan to repair her old house. (Mrs. C. was not available that day so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To buy nets and traps.

loans.name: Symphorienne

texts.fr: Née en 1958, Z. Symphorienne vit depuis 24 ans à Fidjrossè, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Benin. Mariée à LOKO Gustave, agent au Ministère des Finances, Symphorienne est mère de 6 enfants qui sont scolarisés et dont un seul est encore à sa charge. Symphorienne vit avec son mari et son enfant à charge. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Symphorienne exerce comme activité la vente de divers produits (savons, gobelets et bassines en plastique, sucre, piles etc.). C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Symphorienne achète ses produits. Mais Symphorienne vend ses produits dans sa boutique à Fidjrossè. Symphorienne a fréquenté jusqu'au primaire mais a commencé tôt son commerce. Symphorienne est une bonne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Symphorienne désire diversifier ses produits mais ne dispose pas d'assez de moyens financiers pour y arriver. C'est la raison pour laquelle Symphorienne souhaite obtenir un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour mieux faire face à sa clientèle sans cesse croissante.
texts.en:
Born in 1958, Symphorienne Z. has been living for the past 24 years in the Fidjrossè neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Gustave Loko, an agent in the Ministry of Finance, she is the mother of six children, all having attended school, and only one still living under her care. Symphorienne lives with her husband and her remaining child, and shares with her husband responsibility for family expenses. To assist her husband, Symphorienne retails a range of products (soap, plastic cups and basins, sugar, batteries, etc.). She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and sells her products in her shop in Fidjrossé. She attended school at primary level, but very soon began commercial activities. Symphorienne is a regular client of ALIDé, and reimburses well her loans. She wants to extend the range of products she sells but lacks the financial means to do so. That is why she is now requesting another loan from ALIDé, which will help her respond to an ever-increasing number of customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soap, plastic cups and basins, sugar, batteries

loans.name: Ma. Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa J. is from the village of Mabini, Baggao, Cagayan. She is the leader of a six-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Ma. Teresa is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fish balls and other dim sum to the local community. Ma. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
Ma. Teresa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 45-year-old widow with four children — two boys and two girls. Life as a widow in Nigeria is very challenging but she is trying her best to meet that challenge. Mercy is a Bini by tribe. She sells clothes, shoes, baby things, and bags. She has been in this business for a long time and hopes to expand it in order to make more profit and provide the basic necessities of life for her children. Mercy is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more inventory. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy grain cereals

loans.name: Nouhad

texts.en: Nouhad is 42 and married with three children. With the heavy expenses of raising a family she decided, in 2000, to help her husband by running a small business as a home-based beauty-products vendor in addition to offering beauty services to her clients. Nouhad is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more cosmetics and hair products to increase her sales and her income. Nouhad is like the majority of the woman in Lebanon who try to help their families as best they can by having a business in their homes.

loans.use: buy more cosmetic products

loans.name: Ana Inguane

texts.pt:
Ana Inguane T. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 50 anos de idade casada e sem filhos, apenas 4 sobrinhos de 15, 13, 09 e 07 anos de idade e todos vão a escola. Não estudou porque os pais não permitiram a ela e suas irmãs a ir a escola alegando que iria aprender a prostituição. Vive na casa própria com o marido e seus sobrinhos, para alem destes naõ sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu da Matola para o Distrito de Boane ainda muito nova, depois do casamento continuou a viver neste Distrito. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 6 anos, possui um empregado que lhe auxilia no seu negocio. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua casa, porque não conhece melhor o sistema bancário.
Já teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA e não continuou devido a vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas do negócio que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 22.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, vinho, refrescos, batata e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Tem um sonho de um dia poder ter uma residência condigna, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais créditos para aplicar ainda no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Ana InguaneT. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique. She is 50 years old, married and childless though she has 4 nephews and nieces 15,13, 9 and 7 years old. They are all in school. She never studied, since her parents didn't allow her or her sisters to go to school saying she would learn prostitution. She lives in her own house with her husband, nephews and nieces. Apart from these, she has no other dependents. She left Matola for the district of Boane when she was still very young. She continued to live there after she was married. She has had her own shop for more than 6 years, and has an employee to help her with the business. She earns around 6500 MZN a month, and uses it to cover her household expenses while saving some at home, since she's unfamiliar with the banking system. In the past she took out loans through the TCHUMA credit union but didn't continue for various reasons. She learned about Hluvuku through business partners who are already clients. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku, for 22,000 MZN. She plans to buy products (beer, wine, soft drinks, potatoes and others) to increase her stock. She dreams of one day owning a suitable home, and in the future would like to take out additional loans for her business.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of stock (beer, wine, soft drinks, potatoes and others)

loans.name: Bufumbe Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
M. Bena belongs to the Bufumbe Group. She appears at the top right in the small photo as well as in the group photo.

Bena, a 30-year-old married female, has been operating a small hotel (restaurant) business in Bufumbe, Lugazi, for the last seven years. During this time she has been able to send all her eight children, plus three dependents, to school. Her success to some extent has come from her customer’s appreciation of her clean, well organized and hygienic operating environment.

With more operating capital, which in essence has been one of her major problems, Bena foresees a rosier future for her business. In her estimation, she needs a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings to be able to bring her plans to fruition. She plans on building a permanent structure for her business and paying for all her children’s education until they reach the university.

Bena needs the loan to be able to buy more foodstuffs for her hotel.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Temirchon

texts.ru: Хайдаров Темирчон проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Более 12 лет занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Темирчон хочет посеить и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Temirchon H. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 38 years old, married and has 5 children. He has a secondary education and has been been involved in agriculture for over 12 years. He primarily grows vegetables. His wife helps him with this business. Temirchon is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers. He wants to sow and get a good harvest for sale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: A. Pascaline est née en 1949 à Comé et s'est installée depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Minontchou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Pascaline est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Pascaline vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les charges familiales. Pascaline n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Pascaline mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (lait, savons, conserves de tomate et de sardine, bombons, biscuits, huile de palme et d'arachide, etc.) à son domicile. Pascaline s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Pascaline exerce cette activité depuis trente ans et a déjà obtenu cinq crédits auprès de ALIDé. Tous ces crédits ont tous été bien remboursés. Pascaline sollicite un autre prêt en vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Pascaline A. was born in 1949 in Comé and settled some ten years ago in the Minontchou neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Pascaline is a widow and mother of three children, of which some have attended school. She lives alone with her children and is their sole provider. She has not been to school herself. To meet her needs Pascaline retails a range of products (milk, soap, canned tomatoes and sardines, candies, cookies, palm and peanut oil, etc.) from her home. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Pascaline has been in this line of business for the past 30 years and has already been granted five loans from ALIDé, all fully reimbursed. She is now requesting another loan to increase her stock of supplies and improve her response to numerous customer demands.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products (canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, soap, palm and peanut oil)

loans.name: King Of Kings Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
The lady in the small photo at the top left of the group photo is N. Daisy as she also appears in the big group photo. 

Daisy is a youthful, energetic and cheerful married mother of one. Like most other Ugandan women, she is blazing her own business trails in Nyenga Buziika in Lugazi.

Daisy’s one-year-old video library business earns her roughly 190,000 Ugandan shillings a month. She, however, has to bear the increasingly competitive nature of her business as more people take root. Her business, she contends, drives a good bargain in a way because of the low prices she charges her clients.

To get a competitive edge in this increasingly competitive cutthroat business, Daisy is seeking a loan of 500,000 shillings to be able to develop her business even further. She hopes to buy more CDs, DVDs, and a computer to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more CDs, DVDs and a computer for her business

loans.name: Eslyn

texts.en:
Eslyn N. is from the village of Maddurulug Norte, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 57 years old and married with seven adult children To make a living, Eslyn has a store selling a variety of products such as vegetables. She has been in the business for over three years earning approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eslyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eslyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Eslyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Eslyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bit

texts.en:
Bit R. is 41 years old and married. She lives in Kompong Tom Province where she earns a living by cultivating various crops on her land in the village. She has been running her business for more than four years and currently earns approximately $2 each day.

She has five teenage childR., two of whom are employed: one is a garment worker and one is a fisherman. Her husband assists her in planting crops. Bit R. is applying for a loan as capital to buy more materials for her farming business.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her farming business.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 50-year-old married woman with two children. In 1980, she started running a tailoring business from her home to help her husband, having had their two children, to help raise them. She offers all types of sewing services. She makes all kind of clothes as well as doing repairs. All her clients say that she is very hardworking and active in her work. She has a lot of experience in this occupation and her business is well kept. 

Today, Sabah is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase a newly developed sewing machine in order to expand her business activity and to be able to deliver her services faster to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
To have enough savings to build a house made of stone for her “sari-sari” (variety) store is one of the greatest dreams of Jennelyn O. for her business.

She also hopes for one day when she can afford to purchase a motorcycle for a transport business to provide an additional source of income. The said motorcycle will be managed by her husband who has no regular job at the moment aside from being a hired laborer who is paid with a small amount of money.

While Jennelyn’s visions for the success of her family and business are clear, since she and her husband have one child to spend for, she wants to request a loan which she will invest in growing her current business, which is a small “sari-sari” store.

Proceeds from this store will be used to support the needs of her family and some will be used to pay back the loan she is requesting. Through the hard work of her and her husband, Jennelyn believes that someday their family will rise above poverty.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell and increase store inventories.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 45 years old and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living Gemma raises pigs to sell. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Gemma joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to expand her business. About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her pig business.

loans.name: Edna's Group

texts.en: Edna A.'s main source of income comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She is a 54-year-old single woman from the village of Centro Sur, Alcala, Cagayan. Edna has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to save as a reserve for future emergencies. Edna is the leader of a six member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Абдуллоева Мадина проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 26 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Домохозяйка но основным видом деятельности и основным источником дохода её семьи является растениеводство. При доме она имеет земельный участок, где сажает пшеницу и лук. Собрав урожай вывозит на рынок. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Это поможет ей получить хороший урожай, что привлечет новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Madina A. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 26 years old, married and has 3 children. Madina is a homemaker, but agriculture is her primarily business and the source of income for her family. She has a plot of land by her house, where she plants wheat and onions. Having gathered the harvest, she takes it to the market. Madina is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers. This will help her get a good harvest and attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne O. O. is 46 years old and married with three children who are still in school. Her husband is a teacher who really supports Carolyne in her business. Her business is located at the busy town centre of Kakamega. She has a salon which has been providing hair and beauty services to women in white collar jobs and university students. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are many people in the area doing the same kind of business; hence, customers are spoilt by the choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Carolyne is using her loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more hair weaves and chemicals to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to open her own hair and beauty college. She is a very hardworking, focused and determined lady.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals, hair weaves, etc.

loans.name: Bilha Isaac

texts.pt:
Não foi possível tirar a fotografia no local do seu negócio, devido as dificuldades que caracterizam esta actividade.
 
Bilha Isaac M. nasceu na Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 47 anos de idade casada e maê de 7 filhos de 27, 25, 25, 18, 15, 11, e 09 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 10ą classe parou devido ao casamento pre- maturo. Vive na casa própria com a sua família, onde sustenta apenas 4 dos filhos porque os restantes já casaram.
Saiu da província de Gaza para a Província do Niassa, onde viveu cerca de 27 anos, local onde teve todos os filhos. No ano de 2000 saiu para Maputo com a sua família, onde conseguiu um emprego como servente num projecto de remoção de minas (TIC TAC). Tem também negócio próprio de venda de carne há mais de 3 anos, onde consegue um rendimento mensal de cerca de 6.500.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária. 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua cunhada que ja é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (carne de vaca, chouriços e outras variedades de carne) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Compromete se apagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais créditos para construir uma mini-mercearia.
texts.en:
(It wasn't possible to take a photo at the business location, given the nature of the business) Bilha Isaac M. was born in Gaza province, in southern Mozambique. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of seven children from 27 to 9 years old. All of them attend school. She completed tenth grade, but ended her studies since she married young. She lives with her family in her own house, where she supports only four of her children since the others have already married. She left Gaza for Niassa province where she lived for around 27 years, and where her children were born. In 2000 she left with her family for Maputo where she found work as a helper in a mine removal project (TIC TAC). For over three years she has also owned her own butcher shop, where she has a monthly income of around 6500 MZN that she uses for household expenses in addition to saving some in her bank account. She has never taken out loans with other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through her sister-in-law who is already a client. This is her second loan for 20,000 MZN that she plans to use to purchase products (beef, sausages and other kinds of meat) to increase her stock of products. She agrees to pay off the loan in a timely manner in order to be able to take out others. In the future she would like to apply for additional loans to build a mini-market.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell products (beef, sausages, and other types of meat)

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a merchant who sells groceries and drinks at retail prices in the city of Benin, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. Betty, 54, is married to a retired civil servant and has 4 children. She says her only challenge is lack of funds and she hopes to overcome this difficulty. She needs a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria P. is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Prk.Crutons, Brgy Abuanan, Bago City, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Gloria owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale.  She buys the piglets, feeds them for several months, and then sells them at the market.  Gloria has been involved in her pig-fattening business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2003, Gloria joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from NWTF. Gloria is now requesting a new loan, her 12th, for 19,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  Gloria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon."

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is a merchant who she sells groceries and drinks at retail prices in the city of Benin, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. Patience is 39 years old and married, with 6 children. Her husband also works to support their family. Patience is a friendly and happy woman. She says her only challenge is lack of funds and she hopes to overcome this difficulty. She needs a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn O. is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Prk. Kabatahan, Brgy. Tabunan, Bago City, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children. Jocelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Jocelyn has been involved in this business for over 14 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Jocelyn joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from NWTF. Jocelyn is now requesting a new loan, her 5th, for 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Jocelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay her children's tuition fees.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn L. is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Prk. Kabatohan, Brgy. Tabunan, Bago City Negros Occidental . She is married and has 4 adult-aged children. Marilyn owns and operates a small sari sari store, otherwise known as a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marilyn has been involved in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Marilyn joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from NWTF. Marilyn is now requesting a new loan, her 5th, for 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 50 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Caroline sells foodstuffs, like tubers of yam and plantain, during the day. In the evenings, she has a bar where she sells drinks. She loves this business because she is able to support her husband in meeting their family's basic needs.
Caroline is requesting a loan of 120,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. Her hope is to grow her business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Mrs. Kosal Penh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Chheu Teal village in Kandal province are 19 people who make up a village bank loan. The members will use their loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Kosal P. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a mother of 4 children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, and the other attends the local public school

She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice that she sells to support her family’s living. Her husband, Mr. Loch Khut, is a construction worker and aside from this he is also a fisherM.. Although they try to work hard with their careers, they earn little income and do not have enough to buy supplies for fishing.

Thus Mrs. Kosal P. decided to apply for a loan to buy fish nets and a boat to find fish.

loans.use: To buy fishnets and a boat to find fish.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 45 years old, married to a commercial driver, and blessed with seven children. Her children attend school, and this gives her joy. She is a friendly, happy woman who is determined to excel in her business and family life.
Patience is a trader who makes a living by selling iced fish in Benin City. She also sells foodstuffs, such as tomatoes, peppers and onions. The biggest challenge in her business is a lack of funds and she hopes to overcome the challenge. Patience is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more iced fish to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more iced fish to sell

loans.name: Margareth

texts.en:
Margareth is 45 years old, married, and has six children – three boys and three girls. Her children are doing well in business and school. Margareth's husband is a farmer and he also supports their home.
Margareth sells groceries and drinks to make a living. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to make her business more sustainable by working hard. Margareth is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 33-year-old married man and father of three school-aged children. Since 1992, he has owned a car cleaning shop where he services cars from his town and its surroundings. His job involves cleaning, sewing and making car furniture. His business has become well developed over the years because he is the only provider of such service in the whole region. In addition, he is able to work on all type of cars.
Elias plans to expand and reinforce his business in the coming months, and wishes to purchase a furniture sewing machine. He has already saved some money for this, but he still needs to borrow $1,000 USD from Kiva partner, Ameen, to be able to buy it.

loans.use: To purchase a furniture sewing machine

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is 35 years old and married with seven children – two boys and five girls. Her children attend school and they are excelling. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports their home.
Magdalene sells drinks at wholesale and retail prices. She has been in this business since 2003 and hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She loves this business because she does not sell on credit and does not want to incur debts in her business. Magdalene is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Finance his farming business

loans.name: Ma. Selda

texts.en:
Along with her husband who is a fisherman and their daughter (19 years old), 44 year- old Ma. Selda S. lives near the seashore of Barangay (village) Tubog in the municipality of Hamtic, province of Antique.

A fishing business is Selda’s main source of income for the cash flow of her family especially for supporting the college education of their child. She hopes that this business will grow further to be able to support the growing financial needs of her child until she graduates.

Two of her children have their own families now and Selda is happy for that despite the fact that they were not able to graduate from college. She was financially incapacitated at that time to support their education; that’s why she can’t blame her children for their educational achievement. Nevertheless, they can manage their own lives now with their loving and supportive spouses.

Presently, Selda’s business is growing and she has been able to acquire more customers. However, she oftentimes encounters a problem in meeting their demands. With that, she and her husband agreed to request a much larger loan which they will use to purchase their own motor fishing boat.

The boat will be managed by her husband; therefore, aside from buying fish to sell from other fishermen in their village, she will have more fish to sell every time her husband goes fishing. They will also be in control of their business because her husband can go fishing as many time as he wants in a week.

loans.use: To purchase a motor fishing boat.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 48 years old, married, and has five children – three boys and two girls. Her children attend school and they are excelling. Her husband is a retired civil servant.
Eunice sells drinks at wholesale and retail prices. She has been in this business for a long time and hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She loves this business because she does not sell on credit and does not want to incur debts in her business. Eunice is requesting a loan of 120,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix O. is a 32 year-old businessman who sells bicycle spares in Nyamasaria Kisumu Kenya. He started his business in 2001, after ditching welding as a source for generating income, and he buys his stock in Kisumu town on a weekly basis.

Felix is a father of three children and also takes care of two orphans. His dream is to see all of these children get a good education that will guarantee them a better future but this will only come to pass with him having a solid financial base.

This is why he wants to boost his business by increasing his stock that will see him generating enough income. It is for this reason that he wishes to get a loan of 20000 KES.

loans.use: To increase stock to boost his business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy planks

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She is a friendly and hardworking woman. Her husband also works to support their home.
Victoria sells used clothes, bags and shoes at retail prices to her customers. The demand for her goods is high in her community from those who cannot afford new goods. Victoria hopes to see her business grow and attract more customers. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 NGN to purchase more used clothes, bags and shoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to own a boutique. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Baren Akinyi

texts.en:
Baren Akinyi M. is 42 years old, and married with three children. She stays and does her business in Nyalenda Kisumu Kenya. She started her nursery school business in 1992 after leaving her former job where she was employed as a subordinate staff.

As this business is her source of income, Baren needs to improve it so as to increase her income to be able to provide for her children. It is on this backdrop that she requires 20000 KES to help buy enough seats (plastic chairs) and also to renovate her classrooms by painting so that they will look neat and appealing.

In the future she wishes to buy a land/plot where she will be able to build the school to exonerate her from paying rent. This will ensure that she have sufficient savings.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs and renovate the classrooms.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alfina

texts.ru: Джураева Алфина проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 24 года. Замужем, имеет одного ребёнка. Муж зарабатывает строительными работами по найму. Сама Алфина занимается растениеводством. Имеет земельный участок, где сажает пшеницу. Кредит берет для закупа саженцев и минеральных удобрений. Она хочет посадить фруктовые деревья.
texts.en:
Alfina D. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 24 years old, married and has one child. Her husband does construction work for-hire. Alfina is involved in agriculture. She has a plot of land, where she grows wheat. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of tree seedlings and mineral fertilizers. Alfina wants to plant fruit trees.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tree seedlings and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She is a friendly and happy woman. Her husband also works to support their home.
Rose is a trader who makes a living selling groceries and foodstuffs at retail prices in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She says her only challenge is a lack of funds. Rose hopes to overcome this challenge, and is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Catharine

texts.en:
Catharine is 58 years old, a widow, and has seven children. She is a friendly and hardworking mother who hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. Widowhood is very challenging to her and she hopes to overcome this challenge.
Catharine produces and sells wooden combs at retail and wholesale prices. Wooden combs in Nigeria are used to weave lovely hairstyles. She is making really progress in her business and hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. Catharine is requesting a loan of 160,000 NGN to purchase more materials to produce more wooden combs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to produce more wooden combs to sell

loans.name: Suyun

texts.ru: Хучамкулов Суюн проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 42 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Образование средне- специональное "Зоотехник". По профессии работал 2 года. Сейчас занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет небольшой земельный участок, где сажает пшеницу и овощи. Вся семья помогают ему в этом. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Suyun K. lives in the region of Shahrituz. He is 42 years old. He is married and has six children. He has specialized secondary education as a zoo technician. He has worked in his profession for two years. At this time he does agriculture. At his home he has a small plot of land where he grows wheat and vegetables. His entire family helps him in it. He is taking out a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertlizer

loans.name: Becky

texts.en:
Becky A. sells second-hand clothes in Nyamasaria Kisumu, a business she started in 2009 as a source of income since she was tired of just staying idle at home.

Due to her limited stock compared to the high demand, Becky wishes to expand her business by increasing her stock -- something she believes she will be able to achieve once she gets some financial boost.

Becky wishes to own rental houses as her business grows and be able to provide her children with better education. She is married and a mother of two children.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Komil

texts.en:
G. Komil is a successful father and dedicated husband. He has three children.

Komil began a small grocery store five years ago with a small capital of savings. He was assisted by his wife who helps him with serving his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery become more popular.

He is asking for a loan of 3000 USD so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Komil is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve successes in his business with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and increase the range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Kodir

texts.en:
M. Kodir has been running a grocery sales business for more than 10 years. He has plans to grow his business. Kodir aims to improve his business and establish a strong reputation in his neighborhood. His dream is to someday grow from a mini grocery store to a big one. Kodir says, "My objective is to progress in the business and in the future, transform this grocery store into something greater." He is asking for a loan of $2,600 USD to buy merchandise in bulk. Kodir is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve success in his business with this loan.      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
