Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Jane Fransis

texts.en:
Jane Fransis is a single mother of five children. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a one-room house where she is staying with two people. Jane Fransis takes care of additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area. She incurs transport costs to and from buying second hand clothes from Owino market. She does her shopping twice a week and buys from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city.  She sells to five customers a day. Jane Fransis sells to all categories of people at retail and works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her residence plus medication.  Jane Fransis moves door to door while selling her clothes. She has been in this business for five years. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and start buying a full bale of used clothes.

Jane Fransis is the one wearing a yellow tunic with her group mates.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothing

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es:
El señor Viviano, tiene 46 años de edad, está casado hace 27 años con la señora Sixta , tienen 4 hijos, 1 varón llamado Aldo el cual tiene 26 años edad, y tres hijas, Blasida de 25, Vivian de 24 y Luana de 9 años de edad, todos ellos aun viven en casa de sus padres. 
El señor Viviano es carpintero, posee una carpintería en su domicilio hace mas de 18 años, fabrica todo tipo de muebles como roperos, mesas, sillas, placares, cómodas, muebles para cocina, muebles para equipo de sonidos, camas de diversas formas y tamaños.  
Sus mercaderías las vende en el Chaco donde tiene su mayor venta, ya que también fabrica muebles sobre pedido a particulares de la ciudad de Itá, Yaguarón y alrededores, también realiza la compra-venta de colchones y almohadas el cual consigue de una empresa renombrada del país. 
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de madera, ya que tiene buena cantidad de pedidos y no quiere a fallar con sus clientes.
texts.en:
46-year old Señor Viviano has been married for 27 years to his wife Sixta. They live together with their four children, a son Aldo who is 26, and three daughters Blasida (25), Vivian (24), and Luana (9). Señor Viviano is a carpenter and has had a workshop in his home for more than 18 years. He makes all kinds of furniture like closets, tables, chairs, built-in furniture, chests, kitchen furniture, entertainment centres, and various types and sizes of beds. Most of his sales are in El Chaco. Viviano also takes individual orders from customers from the towns of Itá, Yaguarón, and the areas around them. As well he buys and sells mattresses and pillows obtained from a business that is well-known in the country. With the loan he wishes to buy wood as he has many orders and does not want to lose his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en:
Adesuwa is 45 years old, married, and has four children. She is a friendly and happy woman who loves her business and family dearly, and hopes to excel in life. Her husband also works to support their home.
Adesuwa is a trader who makes a living by selling groceries, foodstuffs and drinks at retail prices in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She says her only challenge is a lack of funds. She hopes to overcome this challenge, and is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La Señora Zulma, soltera  de 41 años de edad, es comerciante y  tiene un hijo de 7 años  llamado Lucas quien se encuentra cursando   el segundo grado de la  Educación Básica.
 Comenta que empezó trabajando  hace más de 5 años, y que con la venta de animales   consiguió  el capital para la compra de sus mercaderías (ropas de todo tipo). 
Actualmente cuenta con variedad de mercaderías y con más de 300 clientes con quien trabaja día a día  para sacar adelante a toda su familia.  
Vende todo tipo de prendas de vestir como ser: pantalones, remeras, polleras, jeans, etc. y sus ventas las realiza en forma ambulante, casa por casa.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías (prendas de vestir en Gral.) ya que actualmente cuenta con un gran número de pedidos y desea cumplir con toda su clientela.
texts.en:
Señora Zulma is a 41 year old, single merchant with one seven year old son named Lucas who is moving through second grade in his basic education. She tells us that she started working more than 5 years ago by selling animals. Then she got enough capital to purchase clothing of all kinds. Now, she sells a variety of products to more than 300 clients. She works daily to help her family move ahead. She sells all types of outfits and clothing which can include pants, t-shirts, skirts, jeans, etc. She pedals her products from door to door. She is asking for a loan so that she can buy more clothes since she has many orders outstanding and she would like to fill them all.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, t-shirts, skirts, jeans etc.

loans.name: Kamolidin

texts.en:
S. Kamolidin has owned a convenience store for three years. With this business, he is able to care for his wife and their three children who are still in kindergarten. The market is called “Dehkon”, is situated in a good location and services a good amount of clientele. Kamolidin continues to work to increase his number of customers. His business is becoming popular in the neighborhood, and through good references and personal relationships, the word is spreading about the great quality of his store. With a loan, Kamolidin will continue to help the business grow by improving the facilities, and buying a greater variety of goods to sell in his store.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ameenullah

texts.en: Ameenullah, son of M. G., an educated and married man, has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years. With plenty of land available for cultivation, this hard-working man is requesting a loan to complete his stock, buy more seeds and prepare his land for cultivation. Ameenullah is striving for success as a farmer to support his family and help build a better future for his children. He would like to thank everybody supporting him. He hopes to continue his partnership with both Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Serves Joint Stock Company) in the coming years.

loans.use: To buy seeds and prepare his land

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Мирзоева Инобат проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 24 года. Замужем, имеет одного ребёнка. Муж, сварщик. Сама Инобат имеет средне- специальное образование "Мед. сестра". Кроме того занимается растениеводством. У неё небольшой земельный участок, где она выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Inobat M. lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 24 years old. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a welder. Inobat has specialized secondary education as a nurse. Besides that she does agriculture. She has a small plot of land where she grows vegetables. She is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 49 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband is an athlete. Faith is an honest and friendly woman. She sells baby items, clothes and jewellery at retail prices to her customers. She has been in business for a long time. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her husband in meeting the family's basic needs. Faith is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more baby items, clothes and jewellery to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items, clothes and jewellery to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Financing agriculture

loans.name: Bawejdan Group

texts.en:
Bargy Gull, the daughter of G. M., is the leader of Bawejdan Group. She is married with five children and lives with her own family in Kabul, Afghanistan.
Bargy Gull wants to take a loan for her husband, a hardworking man who has a small car part shop where he also repair cars. He has a good number of clients and wants to expand his business. Therefore, Bargy Gull has requested a loan for her husband to purchase some more stock. He hopes to make a good income to help his family and create a better future.

loans.use: To buy some stock for her husband's shop

loans.name: Rahmatillo

texts.ru: Холматов Рахматилло проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 54 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Рахматилло занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Рахматилло хочет посеить и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Rahmatillo K. lives in the region of Shahrituz. He is 54 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker. Rahmatillo does agriculture. He grows mainly vegetables. He is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer. Rahmatillo wants to sow and collect a good harvest for reselling.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Yakubkhan

texts.en:
T. Yakubkhan is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of cultivated vegetables. This means that he can be around his family, helping to improve their quality of life and educate his three children.
Yakubkhan has been characterized as hardworking, and he has been working in agriculture since he was very young. This kind of work requires effort, dedication and above all, strength, as it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. In spite of this, Yakubkhan is determined to raise his family's standard of living and improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help in order to receive more credit from Kiva partner, IMON International.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 44 years old and married with 5 children. She is an Esan by tribe. Her husband works as a security man in a private firm and he also supports their family. Patricia sells bags of charcoal at retail prices to her customers in Benin City. Charcoal is obtained from excessive heating of firewood. Patricia has a good relationship with LAPO. She is requesting a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts

loans.name: Ugul

texts.en:
A. Ugul is 45 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Ugul's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an ecologist left insufficient money to pay for the family's expenses. This was the reason that Ugul decided to start her own business nine years ago selling fabric for national dresses. 
Little by little, she has grown her business. By offering her customers the opportunity to pay in installments, her orders are growing. Now her business is running normally, but she would like to continue bettering herself and her business so that her situation will be stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of $2,500 USD to buy seasonal fabrics for national dresses. The power to help her business grow is in your hands. 

More about Tajikistan

It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fabrics for national dresses

loans.name: Hamrokul

texts.ru: Пошокулов Хамрокул проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хамрокул имеет средне- специальное образование "Бухгалтер". Более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет небольшой участок земли, где сажает пшеницу. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
P. Hamrokul lives in the Shahrituz region. He’s fifty-six years old, married and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Hamrokul has an education as an accountant. For more than fifteen years he has worked as a farmer, growing wheat on a small plot of land that he owns. He’s asking for a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sohibjon

texts.en:
M. Sohibjon is 41 years old, married, and has two children. He sells cattle and, as a rule, purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds them, and than resells them at higher prices in the local market. Having been in this business for ten years, Sohibjon knows very well how to choose the animals, breed them and look after them. He gets up early every morning in order to feed the animals and look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable and considerable income for his large family. Sohibjon has a large and friendly family who are always trying to help each other.
Today, knowing that prices for animals are not so high now, but will increase for sure, Sohibjon is planning to enlarge his stock and purchase cattle. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting $1000 USD. You could become an important part of Sohibjon's family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of condiments and corn

loans.name: Osaretin

texts.en: Osaretin is 55 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is a mechanical engineer. Osaretin is an LAPO client. She sells foodstuffs such as onions, tomatoes, peppers and crayfish, in the market in Benin City. She hopes to expand her business. She has been in this business for a long time. Osaretin is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: San Antonio Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité San Antonio Poty se conformó gracias a las ganas de salir adelante de todas las integrante quienes se acercaron a una de las asesoras de la Fundación cuando se enteraron de Programa, logró juntar a 18 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy satifechas  ya en el 4° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.

Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Es un grupo muy activo y el trabajo solidario se nota en cada una de sus integrantes, ya todas ellas a parte de ser compañeras en el Comité son muy buenas amigas.
Una de ellas  es la señora Lourdes M. quien se dedica a la venta de ropas en su domicilio y también en forma ambulante, ella se sacrifica mucho para salir adelante con su familia, trabaja de muchas forma ya que su deseo es que sus hijos salgan adelante con una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de prendas de vestir en general y especialmente para la compra de uniformes escolares ya comienzan la época escolar y hay mucha demanda de uniformes para los estudiante, y ella desea aprovechar esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
The committee San Antonio Poty was formed thanks to the the members' desire to get ahead in life. They approached one of the Paraguya Foundation's advisers when they found out about the program. The group includes 18 women, who are very satisfied with their work. The group is now in its fourth loan cycle and works as a whole and supportive team within the program. All of the women work to make money. They help each other to achieve the common goals they share as a group and with the Paraguaya Foundation. This is a very active group and their supportive work is evident in each and every one of its members. Aside from being members of the same committee, all the women are very good friends. One of the members is Lourdes Marciel. She sells clothes from her home and on the street. She has sacrificed a lot to help her family get ahead in life. She works a lot because her dream is that her children move forward with a good education and a better quality of life. The requested loan is for buying general clothing as well school uniforms. Since the school year has already started and there is high demand for uniforms, Lourdes wants to take advantage of this timely opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes and school uniforms to sell

loans.name: Zikusooka Women's Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Zalia , shown in the small photo at the top left, also appears in the group photo. She is the leader of her group in Lugazi.

Zalia is a married mother of five kids who all go to school. She is a seamstress by profession and she operates in Nkonkonjeru trading center, Lugazi.

Zalia has been plying her trade for the last fifteen years and says her main strong point in her business operations has been her high quality service delivery which she has offered her clientele. This however has not always come easy as she has had to come to terms with the fact that her competitors are also increasing in number.

Zalia needs this loan to be able to transform her small tailor shop into a fully equipped wholesale shop where she can sew and sell her clothes. She also sells clothing materials.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials like cloth and thread for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fruits

loans.name: Baudelia

texts.es:
La  Señora  Baudelia R., tiene 41 años de edad, es viuda y  tiene 2 hijos, ambos en edad escolar.
La Señora Baudelia se dedica a la venta de comidas tales como: empanadas, milanesas, croquetas, etc.
Para poder comenzar con esta actividad su difunto marido trabajaba como empleado y de las ganancias empezó a montar el pequeño copetín.
    Esta actividad ya lo realiza hace 15 años, tiene bastante éxito, ya que las comidas preparadas son de muy buena calidad y con muy buen precio, además se encuentra en un lugar estratégico, ya que es el de mayor movimiento en la zona.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de un congelador, para poder enfriar mayor cantidad de bebidas.
 El deseo de la Señora Baudelia es lograr que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
La Señora Baudelia R. is 41 years old and a widow. She has two school-age children. She sells food such as strips of breaded steak, small meat pastries, croquettes, etc. In order to start this business, her deceased husband worked as a clerk, and this small business of selling appetizers was initially funded by his earnings. She has been selling food for 15 years with much success. The quality of the food is very good, and the prices are very reasonable. In addition, her site is strategically located on one of the busiest routes in the area. The requested loan will be used to purchase a freezer, which will enable her to cool more beverages. La Señora Baudelia's wish is to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of freezer

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 23-year-old single man living with his family. Eleven years ago, he decided to leave school and learn an occupation to start a new career and earn income. He started working in gypsum board and after getting the needed experience, in 2007, he started working on a freelance basis taking on projects. He creates a variety of designs and decorations and is very talented in his work. 

Today, Alaa is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy additional products and tools to improve his work.

loans.use: buy additional products and tools

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en: Perpetual sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks at retail prices in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. Perpetual is 41 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband also works to support their family. Perpetual is a friendly and happy woman. She says her only challenge is lack of funds and she hopes to overcome this difficulty. She needs a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She loves her business and family dearly and hopes to excel in life. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory sells bags of garri (cassava flakes) at retail prices to make a living in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Garri is made from cassava and it is a staple food in Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She is 42 years old and married with two children. Her husband also works to support their home. She is a friendly and happy woman. She says her only challenge is lack of funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge. She needs a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more bags of garri (cassava flakes) to sell. She loves her business and family dearly and she hopes to excel in life. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri (cassava flakes) to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La  Señora  Carmen A., tiene 60 años de edad, está casado con el Evelino Noe, tienen 2 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
La actividad realizada por la Señora Carmen es la venta ambulante de prendas de vestir, por las zonas de Ybycuí y alrededores. 
Para poder comenzar con esta actividad  ella nos cuenta que su hija se fue a trabajar  a la Argentina y le enviaba las ropas y calzados.
    Esta actividad ya lo realiza hace 10 años, ya tiene bastantes clientes por los bajos precios y la calidad de las prendas de vestir.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de vitrinas de vidrio para exhibición.
 El deseo de la Señora Carmen es la de montar en su casa un pequeño local para la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
La Señora Carmen A. is 60 years old, is married to Evelino Noe, and has two adult children. She sells clothing in the Ybycuí and surrounding areas. She told us that her daughter went to work in Argentina and sent her clothing and shoes, and these items enabled her to begin work as a traveling saleswoman. She has been doing this work for 10 years; she now has many customers because of her low prices and the quality of her clothing. The requested loan will be used to purchase a glass showcase. La Señora Carmen's wish is to set up in her house a small area for the sale of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a glass showcase for her clothing

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 41-year-old married man with four dependent children. He has been working at home painting and decoration for the past 25 years and he has very good experience in this occupation. Due to the long period, he was able to earn a good work reputation and become known in this field. He works on a freelance basis upon request of the customers. 

Today, Marwan is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase new painting tools to replace his old ones. He is expecting to expand and fulfill his business objectives and is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming years.

loans.use: To purchase new painting tools

loans.name: Amenaghawon

texts.en: Amenaghawon sells planks. She has been in this business for eight years. She is a friendly and happy woman. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 49 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a businessman. Amenaghawon is requesting a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela A. is 24 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Nyamasaria, Kisumu, Kenya. Pamela is an entrepreneur who plants and sells vegetables, a business she began in 2007 after the collapse of her tailoring business. She gets her stock from around Kisumu and has it restocked every three months after harvesting.
She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy her own sewing machine as she plans to revive her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory sells clothes and bags of garri (cassava flakes) at retail prices to make a living in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Garri is made from cassava and it is a staple food in Nigeria. She is 30 years old and married with a child. Her husband also works to support their home. She is a friendly and happy woman. She says her only challenge is lack of funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge. She needs a loan amount NGN 150,000 to purchase more clothes and bags of garri (cassava flakes) to sell. She hopes to grow her business. She loves her business and family dearly and she hopes to excel in life. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and bags of garri to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a shamba of mairunji to sell

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam K. is 40 years old, married, and has a high school diploma from Ras AlEin, Nablus. She lives with her husband and seven children, three of whom are in school while the others have entered college. Salam also supports six other family members besides her children.
Salam started her own business back in 2007, working on her own. Later, she opened an advertising office and hired employees. She is hoping that with this loan she will be able to buy a new, hi-tech copy machine in order to develop her advertising office and meet her customer’s needs.

loans.use: To buy a new high-tech copy machine

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 36-year-old married man and father of one young child. He has owned a car repair shop since 2005 with a previous 20 years of experience. He learned this occupation when he was only 16 years old. He is the only provider for his family with his business income. He specializes in making and repairing all type of car motors. He manufactures cars motors and bodies. 

Today Ahmad is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new manufacturing machine in order to improve his business level and productivity and he’s certain that with the help of the loan he will make excellent growth.

loans.use: To purchase a new manufacturing machine

loans.name: Naranjaisy Group

texts.es:
El Comité Naranjaisy, es un excelente  comité conformado en fecha 10 de octubre del 2.008, integrado por 28 mujeres de la Ciudad de ITA, este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra. Dolores G. se acercó a la asesora en una reunión de renovación de crédito que la misma tenía en la zona para averiguar acerca del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
 La misma quedó muy entusiasmada y muy ansiosa de poder trabajar con este programa y ahora ya se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 6° ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
La señora DELMA es una de las integrantes que trabaja de una forma muy práctica y además muy novedoso ya que fabrica bandejas para uso domésticos, y para uso de restauranes, ella utiliza materiales reciclados y tambien comprados, y las fabrica con la ayuda de sus hijos de acuerdo a la cantidad de pedido que ella tiene.
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su trabajo ya que mediante el puede ayudar a su familia y desea sguir trabajando para progresar y en el futuro fabricar otras cosas también para vender.El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de materiales que ella utiliza para fabricar las bandejas como (cartones, plásticos, colas, colorantes y otrso )
texts.en:
The committee Naranjaisy is an excellent group that was formed on October 10, 2008. It is made up of 28 women from the city of Ita. It was formed thanks to Mrs. Dolores G., who approached the adviser at a meeting for renewing credit that the foundation held in the area to find out more about the programs for entrepreneurial groups of women. Dolores was very enthusiatic and anxious about the possibility to work with this program. The group is now happily working through its 6th cycle with the program. Mrs. Delma is one of the members of the group, who works in a practical--as well as novel--field. She makes flags for household and restaurant use. She uses recycled as well as purchased materials. She makes the flags with the help of her children based on the number of orders she has. She is very satisfied with her work, which has allowed her to help her family. She wants to continue working so that she her business can grow and hopes that in the future she can make other things to sell. The requested loan is for purchasing materials she uses to make the flags like cardboard, plastic, tails, dyes, and other materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying material for flag making

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift is 40 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Gift owns a salon where she creates lovely western and Nigerian hair styles for her customers. She also sells jewelry, bags and shoes. She has been in this business for 11 years. She hopes to own a world class salon in the future. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more jewelry, bags and shoes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Celina

texts.en: Celina has a good relationship with LAPO. She has a restaurant where she sells mouth watering Nigerian cooked foods. Celina is very popular in her neighborhood for her delicious food. She hopes to own a classic restaurant in the future. She has been in this business for a long time. Celina is 50 years old and a widow with 4 children. Widowhood is very challenging to Celina and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents and 4 dependent brothers and sisters. Six years ago, he started gaining experience in the gypsum board and concrete trades. And in 2006, he started working on his own, taking projects and customers’ freelance orders. He creates gypsum board designs and decorations and presents a variety of products to his clients. Fadel uses his savings to continue building his home and taking care of all the related preparation.

Fadel is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy new tools to always stay up-to-date and meet his customers' requirements. He is certain that the loan will help him in improving his business service and increasing his profit.

loans.use: buy new tools

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks at retail prices in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She is an Ibo by tribe. Her husband also works to support their family. Eunice is a friendly and happy woman. She says her only challenge is lack of funds and she hopes to overcome this difficulty. She needs a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She loves her business and family dearly and hopes to excel in life. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Villa La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Comité Villa La Amistad  se denomina el grupo conformado en fecha 18 de diciembre del 2.008,gracias a que la actual Directora General Candida Pérez, se contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona ,para  informarse de como funciona el Comité de Mujeres   Emprendedoras, una vez enterada ,logró juntar  a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando con el Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendoras ya en el 4º ciclo, todas las integrantes del grupo se encuentran muy contentas trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria.
Todas ellas están muy conformes trabajando con Kiva y la Fundación Paraguaya realizando actividades para recaudar fondos para el fin común del grupo.
Son todas muy activas y realmente saben trabajar en forma solidaria.
Una de la mujeres es la señora Gladys quien fabrica y vende productos de limpieza, ella compra los ingredientes de acuerdo a los pedidos que recibe y elabora sus productos con la ayuda de su familia, actualmente con el crédito que ella solicitó adquirirá mas ingredientes de manera a compra en mayor cantidad los ingredientes y preparar mas productos para ofrecer a otros mercados y así mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Villa La Amistad group was formed on December 18th, 2008, thanks to the current general director, Candida Pérez. She made contact with the advisor during a weekly meeting taking place in the area to gather information regarding the work of the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women. Once she was informed about the program, she managed to gather together 15 women who are now working in a fourth cycle with the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women. They are very happy working in a united and supportive way. All of them are very satisfied working with Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya. They are engaged in activities in order to raise funds for the common good of the group. They are all very active, and they truly know how to work in a supportive way. Gladys is one of the women. She makes and sells cleaning products. She buys the ingredients according to the orders she receives. She makes the products with help from her family. She will use the loan she requested to get more ingredients. She will buy a greater quantity of ingredients and make more products to sell at other markets. That way she will improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients like detergent, bleach, and soap to make cleaning products

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna O. is 30 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband also works to support their home. Edna has a good relationship with LAPO. She sells kerosene at retail prices and she also has a poultry farm where she rears poultry birds to sell. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her husband to meet the basic family needs. Edna has requested a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Kyosimba Onanya, Kibuga, Mpigi Group

texts.en:
N. Sarah is shown at the top right in the small photo and also appears in the group photo. She is a 45-year-old married mother of six who runs a retail shop business in Kibugga, Mpigi district.

This hardworking woman has been running her business for eleven years now and attributes her success to the return value chord she has struck with her customers. Her monthly cash inflow projections are at 100,000 shillings.

With this loan Sarah thinks she can increase what she earns in a month by almost 50%. Her mission is to expand her retail business in the short term by restocking her shop with more general merchandise.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more general merchandise

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El Sr. Nelson tiene 32 años de edad, vive en pareja con Sandra  con quien tiene 2 hijas que están en edad escolar.
 Él se dedica a la venta de pancho, hamburguesa y asadito en el cruce denominado Las Piedras, de la ciudad de Itá,  mientras que su esposa es la encargada de las ventas de frutas y verduras en un puesto también ubicado en el mismo lugar. En dicha zona son los únicos  que se dedican a tales actividades. 
Anteriormente Nelson trabajaba con su tío en la venta de frutas y verduras pero con el tiempo  fue ahorrando junto con su actual pareja, logró independizarse y creó su propia micro empresa y así fue creciendo.
En esta oportunidad solicita el crédito  para la compra de frutas, verduras y comestibles tales como: panchos, panes, bebidas, etc. para su panchería.
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson is 32 years old, lives with his partner Sandra and has 2 daughters who are in school.

He is dedicated to the sale of hot dogs, hamburgers and barbecue meat at the crossroads called Las Piedras, in the City of Ita, His wife is in charge of selling fruits and vegetables in a booth in the same location. In that area are the only ones engaged in such activities. Nelson previously worked with his uncle in the sale of fruits and vegetables but saved money along with his partner and achieved independence starting their own micro-business, which has grown.

He is asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of fruits, vegetables and groceries such as hot dogs, bread, drinks etc.. for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann sells tubers of yam at retail prices to make a living in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Yam is a staple food in Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She is 49 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband also works to support their home. She is a friendly and happy woman. She has requested a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She loves her business and family dearly and she hopes to excel in life. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Darlin Maria

texts.es: Darlin tiene 28 años, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo. Desde hace mas de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios son con esfuerzos propios, pues desde muy joven su Mama le enseño a ganarse la vida vendiendo refrescos, Darlin no tuvo la oportunidad de finalizar sus estudios, por lo que tenía que ayudar a su Mama a vender es por eso que lucha todos los días para darle esa oportunidad a sus hijos, a pesar de las difíciles situaciones que ha enfrentado sigue con esta actividad. Ella invertirá el financiamiento en materia prima pues así comprara azúcar, bolsas, pajillas y las frutas. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda, pues todavía no tiene ciertos servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Darlin is 28 years old and the mother of 3 children who are minors and in her care. She has been in the business of selling soft drinks for over 12 years and started with her own efforts, since her mother taught her how to make a living selling soft drinks.

Darlin didn't have a chance to finish school, since she had to help her mother to sell soft drinks. This is why she struggles every day to give that opportunity to her children, despite the difficult situations she has faced, she remains in this activity.

She will invest the money as working capital to buy sugar, bags, straws and fruit. She dreams with improving her house since it doesn’t have the basic services.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna sells iced fish at retail prices to make a living in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She is 32 years old, married with three children. Her husband is a farmer. She is a friendly and happy woman. She needs a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more iced fish to sell. She loves her business and family dearly and she hopes to excel in life. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more iced fish to sell

loans.name: Basajja Mivule Group, Mukono

texts.en:
At the top left in the small photo is S. Henry who also appears in the group photo.

On the face of it, Henry is an ambitious man. He is a 35-year-old married man with two children aged 8 and 6 years who both go to school. He sells charcoal as a business and his operating area is in Kazinga in Mukono district.

Henry has been operating this business for the last two years and reckons that since he began he probably makes a paltry 35,000 shillings per week. Henry is also an employee of Azam factories that make baking flour, hence earning a monthly salary.

Despite this, Henry has big plans to expand into a more lucrative business. For that reason, he says he needs a loan to be able to push through his plans by buying more sacks of charcoal to sell. In this business, he is mostly helped by his wife.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor  Juan A., tiene 41 años de edad, está casado con la Señora Maria Ramirez, tienen 4 hijos, todos en edad escolar.
Se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 8 años, para poder da inicio a la misma vendió ganados vacunos que poseía, y compró los implementos para el desarrollo de dicha actividad.
    La actividad que desarrolla es la producción de materiales de construcción para casas, a base de barro cocido, denominado ladrillos, y tiene bastante éxito, ya que los ladrillos que produce son los de mejor calidad en la zona.
El préstamo solicitado es para la reparación de una maquinaria utilizada en la actividad.
 El deseo del Señor Juan es la de llegar a producir una mayor cantidad de ladrillos, para así tener un mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
Mr. John A. is 41 years old and is married to Mrs. Maria Ramirez. They have 4 children, all of them go to school..

He is dedicated to the production of bricks that are used to build homes. He has been in the business for about 8 years and is quite successful since the bricks he produces are the best quality in the area. Before he started the brick’s business he sold beef cattle he owned, and bought the tools for the development of this activity.

The loan he is asking for will be used to repair a machine that he uses in his activity. Mr. Juan whish is to eventually produce a greater quantity of bricks, so he can have a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a machine that is used to make bricks

loans.name: Mujeres Creciendo En Fe Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Creciendo en Fe (Women Growing in Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the urban slums that surround Santo Domingo, a crime-ridden area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner.
Juana is excited to be taking her first loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, and having the opportunity to grow her business with low-cost capital. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small fried food stand, by purchasing ingredients such as dough, plantains, cheese, sugar and juice. She will use the profits to invest in her home by adding tiles to her floor, as well as saving towards constructing an additional house on her property to lease out to proviD. a steady income. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, plantains, sugar, juice and dough

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en: Haidar is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents and 2 brothers. He has worked in construction since 2008 and has 4 years of previous experience. He helps his father and mother who also work to provide the family with income. He works on a freelance basis, taking housing projects and other projects such as building shops. After gaining a good reputation in this occupation, Haidar plans to expand his business services. That is why he has now requested a loan of $800 to purchase scaffolding to facilitate the pickup of construction supplies and to improve the liquidity of his business.

loans.use: To purchase scaffolding

loans.name: Cythia

texts.en: Cythia is 30 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband is a farmer and he also supports their home. She is an honest and hard-working woman. She loves her business because of the profits that she makes. She sells plantain and beef to earn a living in Benin City. She has been in this business for 6 years. Cythia hopes to improve the living standard of her family. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more plantain and beef to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plantain and beef to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señora  Maria P.  tiene  45 años  de  edad  esta casada con el Señor  Sixto Reyes de 47 años,   tienen 4 hijos,  tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el menor  esta cursando la primaria.
    Doña Maria nos cuenta que decidieron  abrir una pequeña despensa en el año 2000, con el dinero que les enviaban sus hijos de la Argentina, aparte a esta  actividad se dedica a la venta de queso,  ya que tiene  muchas  vacas  lecheras,  con esta actividad, según nos cuenta  Doña Maria, lograron salir adelante.
   El crédito solicitado es para la compra de mercadeías varias, tales como: arroz, fideo, azúcar, panificados, yerba mate, productos enlatados y otros.
Sueña que los dos hijos menores puedan llegar a ser profesionales y no emigren a otro país para conseguir trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria P. is 45 years old and married to Sr. Sixto Reyes, who is 47. They have four children, three of whom are adults while the youngest is in elementary school.

Doña Maria says she decided to open a small store in 2000 using the money her children sent her from Argentina. In addition to this business, she sells cheese since she has several dairy cows. Doña Maria says she has managed to get ahead because of these activities.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a variety of merchandise such as rice, noodles, sugar, baked goods, “yerba mate” (a South American plant that produces leaves that are used for beverages, similar to tea leaves), canned goods, and other items. She dreams that her two youngest children will become professionals so that they do not have to migrate to another country to find work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Alitubeera Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Eron is a friendly single mother with one child aged 14 years. To support herself and her child plus the orphans in her care, Eron sells stationery in Kawuga, Mukono district.

With her persistence in the face of the many adversities that single mothers face, Eron has been able, against all the odds, to last in her business for eight years and fully support her dependents. In this period, she has been able to consolidate her business and she currently earns 100,000 shillings per week.

Eron needs this loan to expand her business by stocking her stationery shop with more books, reams of paper, pens and many other items as she also completes payment of her dependents’ school fees.

loans.use: To buy more books, reams of paper, pens and many other items as well as to pay school fees

loans.name: Miroslav

texts.en:
Miroslav is married with two children. For the last three years, he has run a business renting office space in a building that he co-owns. Affordable prices and good customer service attract clients and make his business a success. His net income is about 8,000 UAH per month.
Miroslav would like to borrow money to complete the remodeling that he started inside the building so that he is able to rent out all of his building space. He is requesting 16,500 UAH to complete the work.

loans.use: To complete remodeling of office space for rent

loans.name: Ngandu Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
G. Mary, shown at the top right in the small photo as well as in the group photo, is the leader of her lending group. She is 42 years old and the married mother of three children who are in high school.

Mary sells dairy products in Mbale, Mukono district. She has been doing this for the last twelve years and has had to remain strong in the face of challenges. However, her friendly nature has always been her strength, as her loyal customers have always been at her beck and call.

Mary’s future business plan of action is to buy more cows to increase her dairy sales and to be able to expand her business which is still small scale. Her hopes are high that with this loan, she will be able to see her dreams come to fruition.

loans.use: To pay the workers that look after her cows

loans.name: Fe En Dios 4,5 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Fe en Dios (Faith in God), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican  clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her husband and their three children.

Maria is excited to be taK. her first loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, and she is excited at the opportunity to grow her business and have access to low cost capital. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business' economic future by opening a second business in addition to her bakery. She will purchase skirts, shirts, pants, perfumes and make-up to sell alongside her baked goods. Maria will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing food, clothing and school supplies as well as a computer to assist their learning. Additionally, she will save towards constructing her own home. She also mentions that someday it would be nice to go on one of the cruises that brings all the tourists to Samana! She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase skirts, make-up, pants, perfumes and shirts for resale

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El Señor  Vicente M., tiene 51 años de edad, está casado con la Señora Maria Viveros, tienen 2 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Para poder comenzar con esta actividad trabajaba en forma dependiente como chofer de camiones, luego se retiró y con el pago de su liquidación comenzó su trabajo actual, cual es la producción de ladrillos.
    Esta actividad ya lo realiza hace aproximadamente 15 años, por lo que ya posee experiencia en la misma y una clientela formada por la buena calidad de sus productos.
El préstamo solicitado es para la ampliación del horno en donde realiza el quemado de los ladrillos.
 El deseo del Señor Juan es llegar a comprar un pequeño camión para poder llevar su producto y no pagar más por fletes.
texts.en:
Sr. Vicente M. is 51 years old and married to Sra. Maria Viveros. They have two adult children. Before he started this business, he was employed as a truck driver. He later quit and used his severance pay to start his current business of manufacturing bricks. Vicente has been in this business for approximately 15 years. He has the experience and has gained customers due to the good quality of his products.

The loan he is requesting will be used to enlarge the oven he uses for baking bricks. Vicente hopes to buy a small truck for transporting his products so that he does not have to pay extra for freight.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor to enlarge the oven he uses for baking bricks

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel tiene 74 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de cerdo. Esta actividad es muy popular en nuestro país, pues la mayoría de las personas tienen este medio de vida para sobrevivir. Hace más de 5 años, que se dedica a este negocio cuando dio inicio fue por su familia, pues anteriormente su mama se hacía cargo, fue así que Víctor aprendió de este negocio por tal razón él decide establecer su propio negocio en su vivienda. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de cerdos. Víctor desea construir 2 cuartos en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel is 74 years old. His business involves buying and selling pigs. This activity is very popular in Nicaragua since many people pursue this livelihood in order to survive. Victor has been in this family business for more than five years when he took it over from his mother. He learned everything about the business and decided to establish it from his home.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more pigs. Victor hopes to build two rooms to add to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy pigs

loans.name: Tweyombekye Women's Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
For the last sixteen years, 40-year-old K. Allen, who appears in the small photo at the top left as well as in the group photo, has been plying her small bar in Central ward in Ntungamo. What has endeared this divorced mother of four to her clientele all this while has been the good customer care skill card she has up her sleeve.

With this business, which currently generates her profits worth 40,000 shillings a week, Allen has been able to educate her children. The business has, however, had its own setbacks like the lack of steady inflowing capital to enable it to expand.

Allen hopes to open new horizons for her business and once she can obtain this loan, she plans to buy more beers, sodas, wines and other drinks for her stock.

loans.use: To buy more beers, sodas, wines and other drinks for her bar

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat is 31-year old lady. She lives in a city named Lahore in Pakistan for the back 25 years. Her husband name is M. T. who works in a factory on monthly wage. 

Mussarat is a vigorous and skillful lady.  She involves in a decorative embroider business. She learned this art from her mother. She never got education because she always paid attention on this work. Her mother teaches her about all the techniques used in this work, which means that today, she is getting quite good!

She does this work for two reasons first is she loves her work and second is she wants to share the financial burden of her husband. She is acquiring for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 25,000 with which she will purchase the material such as (beads, colored thread, sketches and clothes) to generate more income.

She has four other ladies in her loan group. Najma wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business. Zeenat and Azra each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk selling business.  Shazia wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business.

loans.use: To buy material for decorative embroider business

loans.name: Kira Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
S. Agnes appears in the small photo at the bottom left of the group photo just like in the group photo itself. She is 37 years old and is the mother of six school-going children.

Agnes’s business preoccupation for the last eight years has been rearing poultry and selling agricultural produce as well as being a farmer and selling what she grows. She operates in Kira, Mukono district.

Agnes envisages a situation where her weekly profit of 50,000 shillings will be increased if she gets this loan. With the profits, she plans on buying more poultry and buying more land to plant more crops.

Agnes says constant poultry diseases and fluctuating prices at the local markets of agricultural produce have been her major problems. She is grateful that she obtains loans that stand in for her in case of need.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and their feed and more produce to sell

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, tiene 44 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos (keithe, Luis Gabriel), él pertenece al banco comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa, él trabajó como docente en el colegio de la “Gran Unidad Inca Garcilazo de la Vega” pero no le volvieron a contratar entonces se dedico a ser albañil  de forma independiente y como albañil trabajó restaurando y haciendo investigaciones para el “Instituto Nacional del Cultura” de la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente esta esperando que lo vuelvan a contratar para todo este año. El socio y su esposa tienen un negocio familiar, su esposa compra queso de la ciudad de Puno para vender en la ciudad del Cusco. Ella lleva insumos como maíz, papas y queso para vender en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. Luis requiere el préstamo para invertir en el negocio familiar, él con una parte va comprar queso y con la otra parte es para pagar el transporte. Luis su  anhelo es comprar una casa y abrir un pequeño taller de artesanía de tipo platería.  

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. En la fotografía el socio esta acompañado de su esposa Ermiña.
texts.en:
Luis is 44 years old, married, and has two children (Keithe and Luis Gabriel). He belongs to the Communal Bank “Sacsayhuaman”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. Luis worked as a high school teacher at “Gran Unidad Inca Garcilazo de la Vega”, but his contract did not get renewed so he is working independently as a mason. As a mason, he is performing restoration work and conducting research for the National Institute of Culture of Cusco and waiting to be rehired for the entire year. Luis and his wife have a family business in which she buys cheese from the city of Puno to sell in Cusco. She needs supplies such as corn, potatoes, and cheese to sell in the city of Puerto Maldonado. Luis needs a loan to invest in the family business. He will use part of the loan to buy cheese and the remainder to pay for the transportation. Luis hopes to buy a house and open a small workshop for making silver handicrafts.

He is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making his payments on time. In the photograph, Luis is accompanied by his wife Ermiña.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese & pay for the transportation costs

loans.name: Pablo Cruz

texts.es: Pablo Cruz tiene 75 años.es una persona muy responsable pues ha sido un buen cliente. La actividad económica de Pablo es ofrecer los servicios de carpintería. El dio inicio hace más de 44 años, pues era su único  medio de ingreso ya que tenía que proporcionarle el pan de cada día. Y Logro salir adelante, Pablo es un hombre muy luchador y que le gusta el trabajo duro. Por lo que el financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materiales. Sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Pablo Cruz is 75 years old. He is a very responsible person and has been a good customer. Pablo has been offering carpentry services for more than 44 years. This is his only means of income to provide for his daily needs. Having achieved success, Pablo is a very determined man and enjoys hard work.

The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy materials. He dreams of making improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase carpentry materials

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a young 22-year, married with single son. She lives in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Her husband name is M. A. who runs a timbers selling business. He has been doing this work for the back 6 years. He earns approximately Pak Rs. 15,000 on monthly basis. 

Khalida is a seamstress. She handles her personal life and work with full obligation. She is known as responsible and hardworking lady in her community. She takes order from her neighbors. She can sew all types of women wearing such as (designer clothes and simple clothes). She is applying for a loan to buy timbers in bulk to expand her husbands’ business.

She has three other ladies in her loan group. Razia wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Safia wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. Saima wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy timbers in bulk

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a business man. He has a motorcycle that he uses to convey his passengers from one location of his city to another. He has been in this business for three years. He is doing well in his business and family. As a hard working man, he also sells motorcycle spare parts at retail prices. He hopes for a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell.  He is married with children and he hopes to lift his family and business above poverty. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Ibolya

texts.en:
Ibolya is a single mother who raises her daughter herself. She works hard to ensure a decent livelihood for her small family. Ibolya started her small business ten years ago when the used clothing sales business was only getting started in Ukraine. Even today, there is still little competition at the market where she sells her inventories. This business is her family's only income.
Ibolya has used business loans before and finds them very helpful. This time she is requesting a loan of 12,000 UAH to increase the variety of items she offers. She hopes to restock her kiosk and make more profit.

loans.use: To increase the variety of items she sells

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité inició  la señora Rosa Ruiz D., quien vive en el barrio Ciudad Nueva Km 7, ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “Rosa Mística”, está constituido  por 24  señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona.                        Ellas tienen actividades diferentes algunas  emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo.
La señora Rosa se dedica a la venta de Ropa, ella posee un puesto de venta en el mercado de Ciudad del Este ahí expone sus mercaderías para la venta, ella nos comenta que el trabajo que ella realiza lo hace con mucha esperanza, ya que quiere que sus hijos estudian y tengan un  mejor viD. como profesionales en el futuro, ella también desea, ampliar su negocio, anexando una zapatera a su ropería.
Actualmente solo vende ropas de todo tipo, y crédito que ella solicito  para la compra de uniformes escolares como pantalones, camisa, remeras, medias, polleras.
texts.en:
This committee was started by Sra. Rosa Ruiz D., who lives in the neighborhood of Ciudad Nueva Km 7. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form this committee from the area. The committee is named “Rosa Mística”, and consists of 24 active and supportive women who are all from the same area. They have different business activities, with some undertaking new ventures in order to earn a steady income. Sra. Rosa sells clothing. She has a vending post at the market of Ciudad del Este. There she displays the merchandise she has for sale. She says she performs her work with great hope because she wants her children to study and have a better life in the future as professionals. Rosa also wants to expand her business by adding a shoe store next to her clothing stand. She currently sells all types of clothing and, with this loan she is requesting, will buy school uniforms such as pants, shirts, T-shirts, socks, and skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Hamidan's Group

texts.en:
Hamidan has a hospitable nature. She loves to serve people as the way she serves her family. This is her quality which everybody admires. 

She belongs to a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. Her husband name is K. A. who is a driver and drives a local bus. Hamidan has given birth to a single son who is in 3rd standard. 

She is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine so she starts sewing clothes to pay for the education expenses of her son. 

She has three other ladies in her loan group. Hajran baji wants a loan to pay the remaining installments of her buffalo which she purchased for her milk selling business. Nawab wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a business man. He has a motorcycle that he uses to convey his passengers from one location of his city to another. He loves this because he renders services to his customers. He is doing well in his business and family. He is married with four children. As a hard working man, he works for long hours to enable him to meet the basic needs of his family. He hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase a motorcycle to boost his business. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to boost his business.

loans.name: Zeb-Un-Nisa's Group

texts.en:
Zeb-un-Nisa lives in a city named Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

She is a widow. After her husbands’ death she made herself very strong. She started keeping herself busy in preparing embroider dresses. Later she took it as a profession. Now she receives order from the market of Lahore named “Azam Market”. Her income is the only source to manage the financial expenses of her family. She knows that her life is full of responsibilities but she never shows others in her face, she always manages a big smile when around others. 

She is applying for a loan to buy embroider material such as (beads, colored thread and sketches) to expand her embroider business.

She has three other ladies in her loan group. Fatima wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Suraiya wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.  Safia wants a loan to buy a new donkey cart.

loans.use: To buy embroider material

loans.name: Lubugumu Twekembe Group, Mukono

texts.en:
K. Jane, shown at the bottom left in a small photo, is the leader of her lending group and is also shown in the group photo. The 55-year-old is a married woman with two children. Her children, plus the four orphans under her care, all attend school.

To cater for her children, Jane has for the last twelve years been selling local brew and agricultural produce in Namayuba village in Mukono district.

In her bid to provide a reliable source of livelihood to her family, Jane has had to come to terms with the hidden pitfalls that befall such businesses at unpredictable times. She, like many other customers of farm produce, found herself at the receiving end of the adverse weather spells which, for the most part, destroyed crops. This affected her suppliers, the farmers.

Local brew was soon outlawed too. That law was rescinded and currently she makes close to 200,000 shillings a week from her businesses. Her plan, after obtaining this loan, is to fully restock her business with more local gin and more produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more local gin and agricultural produce to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old and married with three children. Her husband also works to support their home. She is a hardworking woman who is so determined to lift her business and family above poverty. 

She sells used clothes at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for seven years. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more used clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 60 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports his home. She lives in Benin City, Edo state. She sells firewood at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. 

Julie hopes to expand her business by purchasing more firewood to sell and she is requesting a loan of 70,000 Nigerian naira to be able to do this. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Muniran's Group

texts.en:
Muniran is a widow. She serves her family with her clothes selling business. After her husbands’ death she never made herself dependent on her relatives. She recovered herself with the loss very soon. She never becomes hopeless because she is a realistic person. She takes care of her family as a mother and a father as well. Her five children feel proud on her. 

She requires of a loan of worth Pak Rs. 15000 because she wants to diversify her business with the embroidered dresses.  

She has four other ladies in her loan group. Sugran wants a loan to buy a horse cart. Munawar wants a loan to buy a milky cow for her dairy business. Naziran wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Razia sultana wants a loan to buy rice for her rice selling business.

loans.use: To diversify cloth selling business

loans.name: Kukola Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
K. Margaret, shown at the bottom left in the small photo, also appears in the group photo. She is the leader of her lending group. She is a 48-year-old married woman with four children and also has three orphans under her care.

Margaret is a focused and highly motivated entrepreneur who has been running her retail shop in Kirinya-Bombay in Mukono district for the last twenty years. Her long span in this business is, by her own account, a testament to her good relationship skills which have positively impacted her customer base.

Margaret’s profit estimates are in the range of 300,000 Ugandan shillings per week. With this loan, it’s her deduction that she will be able to substantially expand her retail business.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more goods like sugar, rice and maize flour in bulk

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy loves cooking and that is why she sells mouth-watering cooked foods and drinks. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a world-class restaurant in the future. She started this business eight months ago and she is making progress. As a hardworking woman with the determination to excel, she sells for long hours to make her business more sustainable. 

Dorothy hopes for a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a very enthusiastic lady. She has a quality of achieving its dreams. She deals with cloth selling business. With the earning she has able to purchase the bed set which is showing in this picture. 

Her husband name is G. H. who says that Nasreen is a lady who always prefers to do the things first for the betterment of her family than she thinks of herself. He has a leather selling business. He sells the leather in factories and generates earning. 

Presently, her husband needs of a loan of worth Pak Rs. 25,000 to complete the orders otherwise he might lose his customers. 

Nasreen has three other members in her loan group. Rukhsana wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes business. Sajida kosar wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sakina wants a loan to buy material (leather, glue and nails) for her shoe making business.

loans.use: To buy leather to complete the order

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith sells medicines and groceries at retail prices to make a living; she hopes to own a big pharmacy stall in the future. She is 32 years old and is married with three children. Her husband also works to support their home.

Faith is a LAPO client. She is very determined and hopes to expand her business. She hopes for a loan of N60,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says a very big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

LAPO, (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Fozia's Group

texts.en:
Fozia lives in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan for the back 20 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Fozia is a good cook. She has learned cooking in a very early age by seeing her mother. She prepares good quality food and serves to her children and husband. Her husband name is N. A. who has a vegetable selling business. He sells vegetables on cart. He attracts the customers by making loud voice about his products on various areas.  

He has a good number of customers because of his good quality and fresh vegetables. Fozia is asking for a loan to buy the seasonal vegetables in order to expand his business.

She has three other women in her loan group. Razia also wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to resell. Rani wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Sara wants a loan to buy leather to resell.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 36 years old and is married with five children, her youngest being 4 years old. Her children attend school and this gives her joy.

Rebecca sells drinks at wholesale and retail prices to her customers and loves this business because of the profits she makes. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.

Rebecca hopes that her business expands to be big and strong. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es: Guillermo De Jesús tiene 58 años, el es responsable de 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la compra y vente de caballos, además se dedica a la venta de cerdos, pues siempre está buscando la manera de salir adelante. El tiene más de 8 años de estar en este negocio, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar la condición económica de su familia, como padre responsable siempre le ha gustado trabajar. El financiamiento que actualmente está solicitando es para la compra de caballos y algunos cerdos, por lo que tiene una buena demanda hasta los momentos. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y además poder ofrecerles a sus hijos lo necesario.
texts.en:
Guillermo De Jesús is 58 years old and responsible for two dependent children. His business involves buying and selling horses, as well as selling pigs. He is always looking for ways to get ahead. Guillermo has been in this business for more than eight years since he is always concerned about improving his family’s financial condition. He is a responsible father who has always enjoyed working.

The loan he is currently requesting will be used to buy horses and a few pigs, since they are in high demand at the moment. He dreams of improving his business so that he can provide his children with the things they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase horses & pigs

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila is 50-year old, married with four children. All of them live in a city named Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods.

Her husband name is M. H. who has a construction supplies selling business. He has been in this profession for the back 20 years. His earning is a main source of his family. Jamila helps him by taking care of the house and kids so he can concentrate on his work. 

Jamila is asking for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 25,000 so that her husband can purchase the construction supplies (bricks, cement) and expand his business.
