She has two other ladies in her loan group. Raheela wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Naseem wants a loan to buy embroider material (beads, colored thread and clothes) for her embroider dresses making business.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Erminia

texts.es:
Erminia es casada y tiene dos hijos (keithe, Luis Gabriel), ella es una mujer trabajadora que alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta D. ropa, venta D. queso y cereales como por ejemplo cebada, trigo y maiz, ella lleva a la ciudad D. Puno sus productos y distribuye a los mercados D. la ciudad, ella compra D. la ciudad D. Puno queso y ropa para distribuir en los mercados D. la ciudad del Cusco. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar ropa y quesos. El anhelo D. la socia es tener su casa propia y que sus hijos se han profesionales. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Erminia is married and has two children (Keithe and Luis Gabriel). She is a hardworking woman who divides her time between her household activities and selling clothing, cheese, barley, wheat, and corn. Erminia leaves for the city of Puno to acquire her products and then distributes them to the markets of the city. She needs a loan to buy clothing and cheese. Erminia hopes to have her own house and for her children to become professionals. She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese & clothing

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a wife of M. H. and lives in a city named Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Her husband is a painter by profession. He paints buildings and windows on order. He has been in this profession since he was just 15 years old. Shamim has given birth to five children. All of them are getting an education from the local school. 

She is an uneducated lady but she knows the value of education and her husband also wants to raise their children with good education. She is applying for a loan to buy the required items such as (paint brushes and other tools) to expand her husband’s painting business.

She has two other ladies in her loan group. Sugran wants a loan to buy items (scissors, shampoos and shaving blades) for her barber shop. Niamat wants a loan to buy construction supplies (cement & bricks) to resell.

loans.use: To buy require tools

loans.name: Esther Migdael

texts.es: Esther Migdael tiene 30 años, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años  que se dedica a este negocio, pues han sido de gran ayuda por lo que le han otorgado mucha experiencia, ella tiene todo tipo de clientes y conoce muy bien el gusto de cada uno de ellos, por lo que le ofrece su mayor esfuerzo en este trabajo. Esther tiene un sueño que es tener su propia tienda en su vivienda ya que así le resultaría mucho más fácil ella no tendría que recorrer muchos lugares, por lo que su edad se lo impide. El motivo de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Esther Migdael is 30 years old and sells general merchandise. For eleven years she has been in this business, which has helped her gain much experience. Esther has all types of customers and knows very well what each one likes. She gives her best effort to her work and dreams of having her own store in her home. This will make it easier for her since she won’t have to travel to several places due to her age. The reason for requesting this loan is to acquire operating capital for buying raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de quatre femmes toutes mariées dans des ménages monogames avec en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent le quartier Bougoufiè de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les articles à vendre, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec  qui, elles sont à leur 5ème  prêt de groupe, après avoir bien remboursé les  quatre précédents. 
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 11 pièces de pagne wax, un rouleau de bazin, des produits de teinture et 6 douzaines de tasses de marque super. 
Les bazins sont d’abord teintés en fonction de la commande ou de la créativité de l’artiste pour pouvoir attirer les clients. 
Elles s’approvisionnent du Burkina Faso, au grand marché de Ségou  et parfois à Bamako. Les marchandises sont revendues au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 39 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les soins de santé et de scolarisation des enfants. 
Elles ont pour ambitions de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of four women, who are all married and living in monogomous households. They average 39 years old and have an average of five children each. They live in the Bougoufiè district of the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and met through neighbors and relatives. With a view to increasing their business and diversifying the items they sell, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and they are now on their fifth group loan with the institution, having repaid the four previous loans without problem. This new loan will be used to buy 11 pieces of "pagne-wax" (a West African term for highly decorative and colourful fabric), a roll of damask fabric, dying products and six dozen top brand cups. The damask fabric is firstly dyed in line with the order or according to the artist's creativity in order to attract clients. They get their supplies in Burkina Faso, at the large market in Ségou and sometimes in Bamako. The goods are retailed for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. They are counting on making an average monthly profit of 39,000 FCFA, which will be used to cover health costs and their childrens' schooling. Their ambition is to build a house to live in.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Aziz's Group

texts.en:
Aziz is a wife of B. A. and lives in a city named Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

She has a friendly nature and always tries to make others happy. Her husband, B. A., sells construction material. He started his business more than 15 years ago. Most of materials he sells are made of wood, but he also sells bricks. She is applying for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 20,000 in order to expand his business.

She has four other ladies in her loan group. Maqboolan wants a loan to buy constructions supplies (bricks & cement) to sell. Mumtaz wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) for her decorative embroider business. Nasreen wants a loan to buy paint boxes for her paint selling business. Sugran wants a loan to buy electric supplies (switches, tube lights and wires) to resell.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya comprend quatre femmes toutes mariées dans des ménages monogames. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 40ans, 5 enfants et habitent le quartier Bougoufiè de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les habits, les articles ménagers, la  restauration, la fabrication des jus de boissons etc.
Après quatre prêt tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur 5ème  prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 21 pièces de pagne wax et fancy,  un rouleau de bazins riche et moins riche, 2 douzaines de draps brodés, un colis de 200 balais, 200kg de tamarin, 300kg d’oseille de Guinée, 4 sacs de riz et des condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent du Burkina Faso et au marché de Ségou. La revente des marchandises se fait à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers et au marché Château de Ségou à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 36 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour l’achat de la nourriture et des frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of four married women, all of whom live in monogamous families. For the most part they live in large traditional households, are 40 years old, have 5 children and live in the Bougoufiè district of Ségou (the fourth largest administrative region of Mali). This group of women sell various products for a living, such as clothes, household appliances, food products, juices etc. Having already received and successfully repaid four loans, they are seeking their fifth in order to buy 21 pagne wax units (bright West-African cloth), a roll of damask bazin (for tie-dyeing fabric), 2 dozen embroidered sheets, a parcel containing 200 brooms, 200kg of tamarind, 300kg of hibiscus, 4 bags of rice and some condiments. They source their goods from Burkina Faso and from the Ségou market, and sell them from home, through mobile sales around the city's districts, and at the Château de Ségou market. Their customer base is both male and female. They aim to generate an average monthly profit of 36,000 FCFA which will be used to buy food and to pay for their children's healthcare.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various products

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida belongs to a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods.

She is known as a hardworking and responsible lady. She has a cloth selling business and her clientele base is women. She purchases the clothes from famous markets of Lahore named “Azam market & Ichra bazaar”. She has divided time for her personal and professional life and she never mixes the both with each other. This is the result that her family and her customers feel comfortable with her and appreciate her for her efforts. 

She is asking for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 25,000 in order to expand her business by buying the clothes in bulk.

She has two other ladies in her loan group. Azra wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Khalida wants a loan to pay the remaining installments of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Shakira's Group

texts.en:
Shakira is a wife of M. M. A. and lives in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods.

Shakira is a housewife but a very talented lady as well. She runs a beauty salon, and although she has no suitable place for her business, she still serves her customers with full dedication. She earns approximately Pak Rs. 15,000 on every month. This is a big financial support for her family. 

She has decided to arrange a place for her parlor so that she makes a renowned parlor for the outsiders because now her customers’ base is just her neighbors.  She is asking for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 20,000 to pay the advance of the place where she wants to starts her parlor.

She has four other ladies in her loan group. Shamim wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. Safia wants  a loan to buy electric supplies (switches, tube lights etc) for her electric shop. Zaitoon wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon. Another Safia wants a loan to buy construction supplies (cement & bricks) to resell.

loans.use: To pay the advance of a place for opening parlor

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alassane W. est un maître maçon depuis 1994. Agé de 39 ans, il est marié et père de 3 enfants.  Pour diversifier ses activités et augmenter ses revenus, Monsieur W. s’est lancé dans le transport.  Ainsi, il compte actuellement à  son actif deux taxis (jaune-noire). 
Ensuite, il s’est transformé en taximan et donne l’autre taxi à son proche. Cependant, il sollicite un prêt de 500 000 FCFA pour réfectionner une des voitures. Il compte changer le moteur et quelques pièces afin de mieux se profiter de la traite.
 Il pense enfin que ce crédit pourra  donner  plus de valeurs à sa voiture,  d’accroitre sa part de marché  et de satisfaire les clients qui sont de plus en plus exigeants quant à la qualité de taxi.
texts.en:
Mr. Alassane W. has been a professional mason since 1994. He is 39 years old and is a father of three. He decided to diversify his business activities and increase revenues by entering the transport business, and now he has two taxis in his fleet (yellow and black). Following their purchase he decided to become a taxi driver and lent the other taxi to a close friend. However, he is seeking a 500 000 FCFA loan in order to repair one of his cars; he wishes to change the engine and a few other parts in order to generate better profits from this trade. He believes that this loan would increase the value of his car, increase his market share and satisfy his customers' increasing demands for quality.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repairing a taxi

loans.name: Sheedan's Group

texts.en:
Sheedan is a 50-years old woman. She lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the back with her husband and five children. 

Her husband name is N. A. who works in a factory on monthly wage. Sheedan is a very hard-working lady. She deals with clothes. She has been doing this for over 30 years. It is an achievement that she married off her elder daughter with her own earnings. She feels proud when she thinks over it. She has crossed 50 years of her age but she never loses her stamina. When she held her grandson in her arms she has decided that she will sell the children garments as well. 

Her grandson has become one year old and the cloth he wears is the choice of Sheedan. To expand her children garments business she required a loan of worth Pak Rs. 20,000.

She has two other ladies in her loan group. Nusrat wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Parveen wants a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her sewing clothes business.

loans.use: To buy children garments to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa C. de 25 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo cuenta con luz, su esposo es maestro albañil ellos tienen 2 hijos de 3 y 1 año. 

Debido al poco ingreso económico que tenía en su casa y la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio decidió hace 4 años iniciar con la misma actividad que los padres tenían cuando ella era pequeña, con unos pocos ahorros compro víveres y puso una pequeña tienda en su casa. 

Incremento su tienda trabajando desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h30 todos los días, ahora ella la tiene muy surtida con arroz, azúcar, enlatados, bebidas, dulces etc. 

Quiere con el préstamo alquilar un local en el terminal de Guayaquil (lugar donde se estacionan los buses para ir a las ciudades y provincias deL Ecuador). En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su tienda.
texts.en:
Elsa C. is 25 years old and lives in the periurban area of Fortín in Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and receives electricity. Her husband is a master bricklayer. They have two children, ages 3 and 1.

Due to her limited household income, she came up with the idea out of desperation to have her own business. Four years ago, she started this business with her parents. She used some of her savings to buy groceries and open a small store in her home. Elsa increased her store by working from 7am until 10:30pm every day. She now has a well-stocked inventory of rice, sugar, canned goods, beverages, candy, and other items.

She wants a loan so that she can rent a location at the terminal in Guayaquil (where the buses park before they leave to the cities and provinces throughout Ecuador). In the future, she wants to branch out her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a vending location at the bus terminal

loans.name: Ramona Del Socorro

texts.es: Ramona Del Socorro tiene 65 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que su medio de vida es lo que le proporciona a su familia el pan de cada día. Este negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante por lo que obtiene mucho más clientes de esta Manera sus clientes la tratan con mucho cariño es conocida por Monchita pues ellos se sienten muy contentos. Anteriormente laboraba en la alcaldía pero debido a la necesidad de llevar más ingresos a su hogar. Su deseo es tener otra fuente de ingreso necesaria. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de talcos, cremas, colonias, perfumes y pinturas.
texts.en:
Ramona Del Socorro is 65 years old and makes a living selling cosmetics. She has worked in this business for more than 11 years, and her work is how she provides for her family each day. She sells her products as a street vendor and has managed to obtain many customers in this way. Her customers treat her with much affection—they call her Monchita, since she always makes them feel happy. She used to work in the mayor’s office, but left that job because she needed to bring in more income for her household. Her wish is to have another source of income. The loan is for working capital, which Ramona will use to purchase talcum powder, creams, colognes, perfumes, and makeup.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for purchasing cosmetics

loans.name: Tumenyane Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tumenyane (qui veut dire en Kirundi “Appuyons-nous”) est un Groupe Communautaire qui commence son 9e cycle de credit avec Turame.  Le plus grand portefeuille des credits Turame est constitue des credits communautaires.

La presidente du groupe,Fatuma M. est une commerçante dans le quartier Kanyosha, capitale Bujumbura.  Elle est propriétaire d’une petite boutique où elle vend  des produits divers, y compris les produits alimentaires et les pagnes portés par les femmes.  Elle a ouvert la boutique depuis 12 ans, et elle a pu économiser pour s’acheter une parcelle où elle espère y construire sa propre maison.

Elle est mère de sept enfants ; l’ainée a 18 ans et la cadette a 9 mois.  Six des sept enfants étudient, et elle prend en charge aussi deux orphelins et un autre enfants des familles proches.  Elle espère que ses enfants auront un avenir meilleur que les enfants eux-mêmes se choisiront.

Dans son business, elle fait face à deux grands défis : les prix d’achats des produits et la pauvreté au Burundi qui limite la demande.  Elle l’utilise surtout pour ses besoins quotidiens et augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The Tumenyane group (the word means "let's support each other" in Kirundi) is a Community Group which is on its ninth loan cycle with Turame. The biggest portfolio of Turame loans is made up of community loans. The president of the group, Fatuma M., is a merchant from the Kanyosha district of the capital, Bujumbura. She owns a little shop where she sells various items, including foodstuffs and women's "pagnes" (colorful African print cloth). She has had her shop for 12 years and she has been able to save up enough to buy a plot of land where she hopes to build her own house. Fatuma is the mother of seven children. The eldest is 18 and the youngest only 9 months old. Six of the seven children are enrolled in school, and Fatuma is also raising two orphans and another child of people close to her. She hopes that her children will have a brighter future that the children themselves will choose. In her business, she faces two big challenges: the cost of buying her goods and the poverty in Burundi which limits demand for the goods. She uses her profit mostly for daily necessities but also to add to her savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying foodstuffs and "pagnes" for women's clothing to resell

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed is 45-years old married woman. She belongs to a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Her husband name is J. A. who runs a beauty salon in the community. He specifically deals with men. He offers his services by cutting and facial treatments. He has two workers in his salon and he pays them on monthly basis. 

Nowadays he has short by some facial products and his services has become limited just on hair cutting. So She is applying for a loan to buy those items so that her husband able to start the work and earn good income.

She has two other ladies in her loan group. Shazia wants a loan to buy electric supplies (switches, tube lights) for her electric shop. Sakina wants a loan to buy cosmetics to resell.

loans.use: To buy the facial products

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma is a wife of S. N. who is a driver by profession. Both of them live in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Both of them are very hard-working. Asma prepares the embroider dresses and sells in the market of Lahore. She does this work to improve the standard of living. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband because currently he drives a rented rickshaw and receives the half of his struggle.

She is the group leader of four other ladies from her locality. Mumtaz wants a loan to buy a welding machine. Nasreen akhtar wants a loan to buy goats for her meat selling business. Bushra wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ruqaiya wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Marlene De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La Sra. Marlene J. C. es profesora de secundaria tiene 25 años de ser profesora, es casada tiene dos niños en edad escolar, su esposo trabaja es conductor  de vehículo, ya ha tenido doce crédito con nosotros le ha ayudado mucho con la terminación de su casa y a logrado resolver algunos problemas personal.
texts.en:
Sra. Marlene J. C. is a high school teacher who has 25 years of experience. She is married and has two children in school. Her husband drives a vehicle for his work. Marlene has taken twelve loans that have helped finish the construction of her house and resolve a few personal problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials such as sand, stone, blocks, and cement

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana, a married mother of a grown son and daughter, is a market entrepreneur from Kherson where she sells children’s clothing, merchandise and toys in one of the local marketplaces called “Nadezhda” (“Hope”). Svitlana is a very disciplined entrepreneur and borrower. She likes to have everything organized and thoroughly planned out which has helped her grow her business and make it a success. Presently, Svitlana has 18,000 Grivnyas invested in this business, with net monthly profits of at least 3,000 Grivnyas.

Energetic and motivated, Svitlana always moves forward with a drive to build something new which helps her reach new goals and make her business more lucrative. She is also very creative and knows how to run the financial end of the enterprise. Svitlana is now seeking a loan of 9,170 Grivnyas to diversify her merchandise and broaden her selection of children’s clothing items and toys that she offers for sale.

loans.use: To diversify her merchandise

loans.name: Narou

texts.fr: Madame  Narou S. est une femme de 60 ans qui habite dans la localité de Ouakam et qui a adhéré  a la caisse de Ouakam depuis 5 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle est bien connue dans la vente de chaussures, tissus, portables, encens.  Elle a démarré  son activité en voyageant sur la Gambie pour acheter des marchandises  , puis vers la Mauritanie pour s’approvisionner en khartoume et en portables. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs dans le but d’aller en Gambie  pour satisfaire une commande de chaussures provenant des amies de sa fille .Madame S. a déjà bénéficié  de 4 prêts  antérieurs  et le crédit va l’aider a satisfaire les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Madame Narou S. is a 60 year-old woman who lives in the Ouakam district and has belonged to the Ouakam credit association for five years. She has run her own business for the past 20 years and is well known for selling shoes, fabric, mobiles and incense. She began her business by travelling to Gambia in order to buy goods, then to Mauritania to source khartoume (fabric) and mobile phones. She is seeking a 200 000 F loan so that she may go to Gambia to fulfil an order for shoes from her daughter's friends. Madame S. has already received four loans, and this loan would enable her to see to her family's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her business funding

loans.name: Rozina's Group

texts.en:
Rozina is a very kind human being. Her husband has an electric shop where he sells electrical supplies such as wires, tube lights, and switches. His business is going well and he earns approximately Pak Rs. 15,000 every month. 

Rozina has a wish to open her own beauty salon where she will be able to prepare brides for their marriages and do party make-up, too. She is asking for a loan worth Pak Rs. 15,000 to pay an advance on a place and purchase cosmetics.

Another lady whose name is Nargis also needs a loan to buy a welding machine for her husband.

loans.use: To make a down-payment for rent and purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Erick Jarling

texts.es:
El señor Erick Jarling S. H., es un joven  de 26 años, casado y habita en el barrio San Ignacio, su esposa trabaja en una zona franca, aportando con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar y en los tiempos libres apoya a los trabajos de la finca.

Ellos son agricultores, desde los 18 años, y uno de los principales problemas que posee la producción es la falta de mantenimiento a las tierras, que están ocasionando la pérdida de las cosechas, es por esta razón que solicita de un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, que resguarden  el sembradillo, esto les permitirá un aumento en las ventas y el capital necesario para nuevos proyectos de vida y/o mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Erick Jarling S. H. is a young man of 26 years of age. He is married and lives in the San Ignacio neighbourhood. His wife works in a tax-free area, using her earnings to help with the household costs, and in her free time she helps with the farm work. Erick and his wife have been farmers since they were 18. One of the principle problems of production is the lack of maintenance of the land, which is causing them to lose crops. For this reason they are seeking a loan to buy fertiliser, which protects the seedlings. This will help them to increase sales and give them the necessary capital for new life projects and/or better economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser and fungicides

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.en:
Ivanna is married with a teenage son. She lives in Stryi, Western Ukraine. Ivanna travels to different small towns in her region to sell sportswear in the local marketplaces. She always has quite a variety to choose from. Moreover, all her items come at affordable prices. Ivanna has loyal customers who shop from her when she comes to their town. Ivanna started this venture 14 years ago. Currently, she has 25,000 Grivnyas of gross income. Her monthly net profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas.  

Ivanna is hoping to receive a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to increase her working capital and buy additional merchandise. She believes financial assistance will be a timely boost for her enterprise, promoting its further development and expansion.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: María Haydee

texts.es:
La Sra. María Haydee G. es comerciante ambulante vende ropa usada en el municipio de san Rafael, es el segundo crédito con nosotros, el dinero lo solicita para capital de trabajo compra de una paca de ropa variada, es madre de 3 hijas todas ya casada ella vive sola con su esposo, su esposo es jubilado.
Dice que los crédito con ceprodel le han ayudado ya que ella antes pasaba en su casa todo el día sin hacer nada y ahora tiene este pequeño negocio lo cual se siente muy bien estar trabajando y que ceprodel le este financiando para poder vender su ropa y mantener a su clientela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Haydee Gutierrez is a traveling merchant who sells used clothing in the town of San Rafael. This is her second credit with us, and she will use it to purchase a package of assorted clothing. She is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are already married, and she lives alone with her husband, who is retired. She says that the loans with Ceprodel have helped her, since she used to spend all day in her house without anything to do, and now she has this small business. She feels very well to be working and is grateful to Ceprodel for financing her, which enables her to sell her clothing and maintain her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase assorted used clothing, sheets, capri pants, among other things, to offer to her clients

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is married. He is a small-scale businessman from Novyi Rozdil in the Stryi region. Roman sells men’s clothing in the local market called Staryi Rinok (“Old Market”). He has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, he has 20,000 Grivnyas of gross income.  

Roman’s enthusiasm and the relationships he has built with his customers show that he is doing what he does best – cheerfully serving others. He has created a loyal base of customers who will always try to stop by and purchase from his kiosk. Roman is an energetic entrepreneur who looks forward to what the future holds with much optimism. 

Roman is requesting a loan of 10,200 Grivnyas to purchase a variety of men’s clothing items in bulk.

loans.use: To increase his turnover capital

loans.name: Hayde

texts.es:
Hayde, es casado, tiene 48 años y tiene tres hijos, ella es una mujer trabajadora que alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comida en el mercado de San Blas en la Ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad comercial empieza a las 6 a.m. hasta las 4  p.m., ella se levanta muy temprano para ir a su puesto de trabajo donde tiene que alistar los insumos para preparar la comida, ella de lunes a sábados prepara desayuno y almuerzo y los días domingos prepara ceviche. Hayde usará el crédito para comprar víveres como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, arroz, aceite, etc. La socia es una mujer responsable y por eso sus amigas no dudaron en invitarle a que forme parte del banco comunal “Sacsayhuaman”. Ya son varios años que forma parte del banco comunal “Sacsayhuaman” y le va muy bien. El sueño de la socia es que su hija Verioska se gradué de enfermera y sus demás hijas terminen sus carreras profesionales.       

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente
texts.en:
Hayde is married, 48 years old, and has three children. She is a hardworking woman who alternates her activities between her home and selling food in the San Blas market of the city of Cuzco. Her business activity begins at 6 a.m. and lasts until 4 p.m.. She gets up very early to go to her workplace where she has to to get the ingredients ready to prepare the food. From Monday through Saturday she prepares breakfast and lunch and on Sundays she prepares ceviche. Hayde will use the loan to buy supplies such as sugar, noodles, rice, oil, etc. This member is a responsible woman and this is why her friends didn't hesitate to invite her to join the communal bank “Sacsayhuaman”. She has been a member of the “Sacsayhuaman” bank for several years now and it is going very well for her. This member's dream is for her daughter Verioska to graduate as a nurse and for her other daughters to finish their professional studies. She is grateful for the opportunity offered in this way and she is committed to making the corresponding payment.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hayde will use the loan to purchase supplies such as sugar, noodles, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Maria tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 22 y 26 años de edad, que trabajan de manera independiente. La señora tiene un negocio de compra-venta de frutas y verduras. Cabe señalarse, ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 14 años, ella empezó en este negocio comprando pequeñas cosechas de limones, las cuales en ese tiempo vendía en el M. con su mama. Luego decide iniciar con su propio negocio. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Fundación León 2000 para ser invertido en la compra de naranjas de ½ manzana, las cuales ya les hace falta solamente unos dos meses para empezar a sacar cosecha. Su tiempo de sacar cosecha es de aproximadamente 4 meses y medio. Su sueño siempre ha sido contar con suficiente capital propio para no depender de los créditos para poder sufragar los gastos, sin embargo no se queja de los beneficios del financiamiento ya que le ha permitido diversificar sus inventarios.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Maria is 45 years old. She is married and has two children who are 22 and 26 years old. They work independently. She has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables. It is worth noting that she started this business 14 years ago. She began by buying small harvests of lemons, which at that time she sold in her mother's market. Later she decided to start her own business. At present, she is asking for a loan from Fundación León 2000 to be invested in purchasing oranges from a 3,500 sq. meter lot. These will be ready to start harvesting in about two months. The harvesting time is about 4 and a half months long. Her dream has always been to have enough of her own capital to not depend on loans to be able to pay for expenses. Nevertheless, she is not complaining about the benefits of financing since it has allowed her to diversify her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chepkemoi

texts.en:
Chepkemoi is a 32-year-old lady. She is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She has been running a chemist shop for six years. She also grows potatoes for sale to increase her earnings. She was previously selling beauty products before she diversified to this business. 

She hopes to expand her business to become a wholesaler in the future. She has requested a loan of 90,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, to buy more medicine. She describes herself as hardworking and social.

loans.use: To add stock of medicine

loans.name: Marjorie Argentina

texts.es:
Marjorie Gutiérrez de 37 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo cuenta con luz, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio ellos tienen 2 hijos de 16 y 11 años.  

Ella empezó como comerciante informal en todas las zonas de Guayaquil pero por la inseguridad que había y la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio la conllevo a poner un local en su casa. 

Ahora ella tiene una papelería muy surtida, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días, vende útiles escolares, láminas, fomix y ahora ha implementado vender ropa.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, ropa, laminas para surtir más su negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para llevar los artículos y venderlos por pedido.
texts.en:
Marjorie Gutiérrez is 37, and she lives in an area outlying the city in the Fortín de Guayaquil. Her house is made of concrete, and she only has electricity. Her husband helps her in the business. She has two children, 16 and 11. She started as an informal merchant in all the areas of Guayaquil. However, the lack of safety and the exasperating idea of having her own business led her to set up a place in her house. Now she has a very well stocked stationery store. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. everyday. She sells schools supplies, paper, and “fomix” (foam crafts). Now she has started selling clothes. With this loan she wants to buy notebooks, clothes, and paper to better stock her business. In the future she wants to buy a car to carry the items and sell them by order.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, clothes, and paper

loans.name: Vicente Ramon

texts.es: Vicente Ramón tiene 41 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 15 años, que se dedica a este negocio pues el ofrece diferentes productos como granos, golosinas, detergentes, pan, ropa y cosméticos. Pues a  le gusta ofrecer de todo un poco para llevar a cabo sus metas. Este negocio ha sido el sustento necesario para mantener a sus 2 hijos, anteriormente la ubicación de su pulpería era en un lugar donde no tenía muchos clientes, actualmente se encuentra en otro lugar en donde vive. Su deseo es incrementar su inventario para convertir su pulpería en un mini súper. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Vicente Ramón, age 41, has had a mini market for over 15 years. He sells different products like grains, sweets, detergents, bread, clothes, and cosmetics. He likes to offer a little of everything to reach his goals. This business has been the needed livelihood to support his two children. The mini market was previously located in a place where he did not have many customers. It is currently in another place where he lives. He wishes to increase his inventory in order to change his mini market into a super mini. The loan he is requesting is to buy raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es: La Sra. Evelyn C. G. es Trabajadora activa del inss. (Instituto de seguro social). Es el segundo crédito con ceprodel, el dinero los solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como piedra, cemento, pago de la mano de obra para construcción de un cuarto, es casada su esposo es trabajador de enacal, tiene dos niño uno en edad escolar y el otro tiene un mes de nacido y si los crédito con ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que ha logrado hacerle mejoras a su casas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evelyn C. Gutierrez is an active worker at the Institute of Social Security. This is her second loan with Ceprodel, which she will use to purchase construction materials such as stone and cement, and also to pay the manual laborers for the construction of a room. She is married, and her husband works for a company called Enacal. They have two children; one who is of school age and the other who is only a month old. The credit through Ceprodel has helped her a lot, since she has managed to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials for a room, such as sand, stone, and cement, and to pay for the manual labor

loans.name: Félix Rubén

texts.es: El Sr. Félix Rubén R. es profesor de secundaria del colegio san Rafael, es casado, el dinero lo solicita para mejora de vivienda aumento de un cuarto compra de arena, cemento, y bloque. Ya es el octavo crédito con Ceprodel lo cual se siente satisfecho de toda la ayuda que Ceprodel le ha brindado con estos crédito por que solo así ha podido salir adelanto con su casa y su familia. Le tienen tres hijos los tres en menores en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Mr. Felix Ruben Ramirez is a high school teacher at San Rafael School. He is married, and he is requesting this money to improve his home by adding another room. He will purchase sand, cement, and blocks. This is already his eighth credit with Ceprodel, and he feels very satisfied from all of the help that Ceprodel has provided to him. In this way, he has been able to move forward with his house and his family. He has three children, all of whom are of school age.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials such as cement, stone, and sand

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 43-year-old married lady. She has been rearing poultry for commercial purposes for nine years. Her main income comes from the sale of eggs to hotels and to other customers in her residential area. She also rents out her houses so as to earn extra income.  

She previously had taken out a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya, which she used to expand her business and she successfully repaid.  She hopes to stabilize her financial status in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy layers and growers feeds.  She says that she is focused, determined and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy layers, feed and growers

loans.name: Verioska

texts.es:
Verioska, es soltera, tiene 22 años, ella es una joven estudiosa,  responsable y trabajadora pues estudio enfermería en la Universidad particular Andina del Cusco y esta por graduarse, ella para solventar sus estudios tiene que trabajar como profesora en el colegio “Abraham Lincoln”, ella enseña el curso de ciencias biología. Verioska usará el crédito para apoyar a su mamá con el negocio de venta de comida y también para pagar los trámites documentarios para obtener su titulo profesional. El sueño de Verioska es graduarse y cuando trabaje desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes para su mamá.      

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Verioska is 22 and single. She is a studious, responsible, and hard-working young woman. She studied nursing at Andina University, a private university in Cusco. She is going to graduate. In order to complete her studies, she has to work as a teacher in the Abraham Lincoln School. She teaches a course in biological science. Verioska will use the loan to help her mother in her business of selling food. She will also pay to process the documents to get her professional title. Verioska’s dream is to graduate, and when she works she wishes to open a grocery store for her mother. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help her mother with her business of selling food and pay for processing the documents to get her professional title

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 51 years old and is married with two children who are above the age of school.

Hawa sells charcoal to earn a living and has been involved in this business for ten years. She also rears animals to earn extra income. She was previously running a retail shop before she ventured into these businesses.

Hawa has previously taken three loans from Faulu Kenya to expand her business and for household expenses. She hopes to expand her business and improve her living standard in the future.

Hawa has requested a loan of Kes 80,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sergio Jose

texts.es: Sergio José tiene 37 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Anteriormente ya había tenido la experiencia con los financiamientos. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de barbería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su negocio inicia por sugerencias de amigos porque desde la edad de 20 años Sergio sabía perfectamente cortar pelo y al ver que lo hacía muy bien decide establecer su propia barbería, el tiene pensado en futuro ampliar un poco mas su local para alojar a mas clientes y obtener más ganancias. Este financiamiento lo realiza con el fin de comprar ciertos productos necesarios en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sergio José is 37 and married. He has two dependent children. He has had previous experience with loans. He has been offering barber services for over seven years. He started his business because his friends suggested it. Sergio has know how to cut hair perfectly since he was 20. Upon seeing that he did it very well, he decided to establish his own barbershop. In the future he plans to expand his shop a little more in order to accommodate more customers and get more earnings. The loan is to buy certain products that he needs for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esther Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Esther Patricia M. es casada, el dinero lo necesita para mejora de vivienda ponerse el piso a su casa compra de cerámica. Es el cuarto credito con nosotros todos los crédito lo ha utilizado en las mejoras de su casa y si se siente muy agradecida con ceprodel por toda estos financiamiento por que siente como una ayuda para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esther Patricia Martinez is married and needs this loan in order to improve her home. She would like to have a ceramic floor put down in her house. This is her fourth loan with us, and they have all been used for improving her house. She feels very thankful that Ceprodel has financed her, because it has helped her get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a ceramic floor for her house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old and is married with three children who attend school. She is married to a man who is employed as a civil servant and together they support the family. She hopes to educate her children to the university level.

Mary runs a tailoring shop and also sells tailoring equipments and fabric in Machakos where her major customers are the area residents. She also practices farming as an economic activity to increase her revenue.

Mary has requested for a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy fabric for making clothes. She dreams of owning a cloth design firm in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for her tailoring business

loans.name: Rumaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Rumaldo L. García se dedica a la comercialización de refrescos y golosinas, esto por encontrarse cercano a un centro de estudio, recibe otros ingresos del seguro por ser una persona jubilada, es padre de dos hijos en edad escolar, sus ventas son mayores en el periodo escolar, este crédito lo solicito para la compra de productos tales como bolis, chocolates, leche, fresquito en bolsa, chocolitas y otros productos que encantan a los niños.
texts.en:
Mr. Rumaldo L. G. is the father of two school-age children and makes a living selling soft drinks and candy at a nearby school. Also, he receives social security income, since he is retired. His sales are greatest during the school year. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of products suchs as ballpoint pens, chocolate, milk, fresquito, chocolitas, and other products that children love.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, imitation jewelry, candy, and soft drinks

loans.name: Karla Sujey

texts.es: Karla Sugey tiene 34 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Ella tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, además de esto ella también tiene una pequeña pulpería ya que busca la forma de obtener ingresos para sus 3 hijos que son lo más importante. Ella se levanta muy temprano pues tiene que tomar diferentes autobuses para ofrecer sus productos, por que los distribuye de manera ambulante. Su deseo es mejorar su nivel de vida. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de sabanas, manteles, ropa, calzado y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Karla Sugey, 34, operates a business selling general merchandise. She has operated the business for more than 10 years. She also owns a small corner store, a business that she started because she needed an income to support her 3 children, who are dearer to her than anything. She gets up very early because she works as a street vendor and has to take several bus trips to sell her products. Her goal is to improve her standard of living. She will use the loan that she is applying for to buy sheets, blankets, clothing, footwear and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dishon

texts.en:
Dishon is a 33-year-old married man with three children, two of whom go to school.

Dishon runs a carpentry shop where he makes furniture such as chairs and tables to earn a living. He has been in this business for five years. He uses his revenue to support his family and pay school fees for his children. His wife is employed as a shop attendant and, with her earnings, she assists him with household expenses.

Dishon hopes to expand his business and build his family a house in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy wood for making more furniture.

loans.use: To buy wood for making more furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the gear box and general maintenance of his car

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Gladis Maria L. García, es madre de dos hijas en edad escolar, es de profesión secretaria, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de dos casas comercializadoras en el país, de estado civil casada y con mucha experiencia en la actividad que le ha permitido mantenerse en el mercado.   Este crédito lo solicito para la compra de estos productos en los cuales obtiene hasta un 35% de ganancia por cada producto colocado y para reparar un taxi, el cual lo trabaja su esposo en la comunidad de san rafael.-
texts.en:
Gladis Maria L. García is the mother of 2 school-aged daughters. She is a secretary, and also sells the cosmetics of two brands that are marketed in the country. She is married, and has a lot of experience that has allowed her to stay in the market. She requests this loan to buy these products, for which she gets a 35% profit for each product sold, and to repair a taxi, which her husband uses in his work in the community of San Rafael.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products such as perfume, body cream, lipstick and powder compacts

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 37-year-old married man with three children, two of whom attend school. He has been a mechanic for twelve years and has two employees who assist him in the business. He also runs a general store to add to his income. He is married to a businesswoman and together they support their family. He hopes to expand his business and open other outlets in the future. He has requested a loan of kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy a grinding machine, a spray gun and other equipment.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine, spray gun and other equipment

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is 43 years old and married with three children who go to school. She sells construction materials such as sand, ballast, and bricks to earn a living. She uses her money together with her husband’s earnings to provide for her  family and pay school fees for her children. She previously ran a green grocery. She hopes to build her family a house and to offer better education to her children in the future. She has requested a loan of kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of building materials.

loans.use: To purchase cement, ballast and bricks

loans.name: Keyla Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Keyla del Carmen S. V., se desempeña como maestra de educación secundaria, es de estado civil casada, sin hijos, tiene mas de once años de desempeñar esta ardua labor que es la de educar a niños y niñas para prepararlos para el futuro, este crédito lo solicito para gastos personales aunque en créditos anteriores los ha solicitado para mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Keyla del Carmen S. V. works as a teacher in a secondary school. She is married, without children, and has more than 11 years of experience carrying out the hard work of educating boys and girls to prepare them for the future. This loan she requests is for personal expenses, although she has used previous loans to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for expenses related to the registration of her professional/academic degree

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen N. W. is 27 years old, married with two children, ages four and two months.  One child attends school.  For two years Stephen has been running a retail shop where he sells mobile phone accessories, DVDs and movies. His business is located in Kawangware 46, a few kilometers away from Nairobi, the  capital city.  Stephen has previously taken out a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya which he used to expand his business.   He has requested for a loan of kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more movies, DVDs and mobile phone accessories for sale. He hopes to stabilize his income and improve his living standard in the future.

loans.use: To buy more movies, DVDs and mobile accessories

loans.name: Bertha Claudia

texts.es: Bertha Claudia tiene un negocio que es a venta de hot dog, gaseosas y otros. Por lo que tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio porque anteriormente se dedicaba a vender comida, por las noches su vivienda estaba muy llena de clientes, pero con el paso del tiempo las ventas fueron disminuyendo por lo que decide iniciar con otro negocio como es la venta de hot dog, hamburguesa entre otros productos a ella siempre le ha gustado su actividad. Es así que decide realizar un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es establecer otro negocio que sea mucho más amplio.
texts.en:
Bertha Claudia owns a business selling hot dogs and cold drinks, among other things. She has operated the business for more than 6 years. She used to sell prepared meals, her house full of customers night after night, but business gradually fell away so she decided to start this business selling hot dogs, hamburgers, etc., work that she has long enjoyed. It's for this business that she's applying for a loan. She needs working capital so that she can buy basic supplies. Her goal is to establish another, larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mente Positiva Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité inició  la señora Elvira M., quien vive en el barrio Santa Ana Ciudad Del Este, ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “Menta Positiva”, está constituido  por 20  señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona.                        Ellas tienen actividades diferentes algunas  emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo.
Una de las señoras quin comenzó una actividad comercial luego de integrarse al comité es la señora Elvira M.. 
Ella abrió una librería con el primer crédito que recibió, actualmente ha crecido mucho su negocio y ella esta muy contenta y satisfecha con el trabajo que realizan entre compañeras.
El crédito fue utilizado para la compra de mercaderías como cuaderno, cartucheras escolares, diversos útiles escolares y otros.
texts.en:
This committee was established by Sra. Elvira M., of the Santa Ana neighborhood in Ciudad del Este, who contacted neighbors and friends to help her start it. The committee, called Menta Positiva (Positive Mind), has 20 members, women from the neighborhood who are active and supportive partners for one another. The members make their living in different ways, some will start new businesses and they depend on fixed incomes. One of the members who started a business after joining the committee is Elvira. She opened an office/school supply store with her first loan. The business has grown a lot since she launched it and she is very happy with her progress. This loan will be used to buy products for resell: notebooks and other school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resell.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah N. S. is 30 years old, widowed with one child who attends school.   She has been practicing farming for five years. She gets her income by selling milk. She has one employee who assists her in the business. She is also employed as a social worker in her community.  Peninah has previously taken a loan of kes 20,000 to boost her business and she successfully repaid it. She has requested for a loan of kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy sheep. Peninah hopes to expand her business and improve her living standard in the future.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Eddit  Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Eddit José R. Gutiérrez, actualmente  estudia una carrera universitaria, su estado civil es casado, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, también cuenta con un servicio de bar y restaurante el cual maneja en sociedad con su mamá ofertando una gran variedad de platillos que se derivan de los  mariscos, tales como: ceviches, cóctel de conchas negras y camarón, el crédito lo solicito para la compra de estos productos por aproximación de la época veranera.
texts.en:
Eddit José R. Gutiérrez is currently studying for a university degree. He's married and has two school-aged children. He also has a bar and restaurant service which he manages along with his mother, offering a wide variety of seafood dishes like ceviches, and black clam and shrimp cocktail. He plans to use his loan to buy ingredients in preparation for the summer season.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients, green vegetables, soft-drinks, fresh produce, and meats

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis K. M. is a 61 year old married man who has five children who attend school.  In the past ten years, he has been operating a cafeteria.  He also does commercial farming to earn extra income.  Francis is the breadwinner in his family so he has to work hard to meet the needs of his family. Francis has requested a loan of Kes.30,000 from Faulu Kenya.  He will use the loan to buy utensils and ingredients for cooking in his cafeteria to improve his business and to increase his profit.

loans.use: To buy utensils and ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred N. N. is a 54 year old widow with four children.  She has been selling both used and new clothes for over ten years.  She also earns a living from farming.  Winifred hopes to educate her children to university level.  She works hard in her business since she is the breadwinner in the family. Winifred  wants to add to the stock of clothes she sells to raise her income.  Therefore, she has requested for a loan of Kes.30,000 from Faulu Kenya.  Winifred hopes to one day expand her business to be able to sell wholesale.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Rufus

texts.en: Rufus N. W. is a 30 year married man. His wife is employed and they are blessed with a two year old daughter.  Rufus has been involved in the building and construction business for ten years. He is a hardworking man who hopes to have more companies in the future. He wants to take out his first loan of Kes.30,000 from Faulu Kenya.  He plans to use this loan to buy an electric hand machine for construction.

loans.use: To purchase a hand machine for construction

loans.name: Muniran's Group

texts.en:
Anwari and Kaniz Fatima and Razia each want a loan to buy material (leather, glue and nails) for their shoe-making business.

Muniran is the group leader for the above-mentioned ladies. They all reside in a city named Arifwala, in Pakistan. Muniran's husband's name is M. R. and he runs a grocery shop in the community. He has been in this business for over 5 years. 

Muniran is a very hard-working lady. She makes thread rolls to order and earns income. She utilizes her income to pay the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a store.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: La Paloma Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité inicio  la señora Liz B., quien vive en el barrio María Auxiliadora de C.D.E., ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “La Paloma”, está constituido  por 17  señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona.
Cada una trabaja de manera independiente para contar con un ingreso propio pero además realizan otras actividades para recaudar fondos en para el comité y utilizarlo en caso de emergencia.
La señora Liz esta muy satisfecha con los trabajos que viene realizando para mejorar el nivel de vida de sus familias ayudándose entre todas  siempre con el fruto del trabajo.
Ella  específicamente se dedica a la venta de ropas, no solo vende ropas que  compra de otros mercados sino también vende ropas confeccionadas por las otras integrantes de la comisión, de esta manera se ayudad mutuamente.
La señora Liz desea contar con mayor cantidad de mercaderías para este fin solicito el préstamo y compro mercaderías como remeras, pantalones, camisas, vestidos y otras prendas.
texts.en:
In order to bring this group together, Liz B., a resident of the María Auxiliadora neighborhood of Ciudad del Este, contacted her neighbors and friends to start a committee in the area. The committee is called "La Paloma" and is made up of 17 very active, unified women who all live in the same area. They all work independently to earn their own income, but they also do other work to raise funds for the committee, to be used in case of an emergency. Liz is very satisfied with the work they're doing to raise their families' quality of life, all of them supporting each other with the fruits of their efforts. Liz sells clothing, not just garments bought from other vendors but also those made by members of the group. In this way, the members support each other mutually. Liz wants to increase her stock of merchandise, and so she's requested this loan to buy t-shirts, blouses, pants, dresses, and other clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase t-shirts, blouses, dresses, pants

loans.name: Mame F.cledor

texts.fr: Madame   Mame F. Cledor N. est une femme de 39 ans habitant a Ouakam et qui s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle est membre de la caisse de   Ouakam depuis 2 ans et a déjà bénéficié de 2 prêts  antérieurs. Elle est parente bénéficiaire  et a  2 enfants en charge. Elle a opte pour la vente de thiouraye, parfums, tissus et chaussures par le bais d’une de ses copines. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs dans l’objectif d’aller a Ndiassane  a l’occasion du Maouloud  pour acheter des thioubs  destines a la vente. C’est une activité  qu’elle renouvelle annuellement. Son crédit lui permet  d’avancer dans ses activités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame F. Cledor N. is a 39-year old woman living in Ouakam, and she has been active in business for more than 15 years. She has been a member of the Ouakam savings institution for two years and has already had two loans. She is a parent member and has two children in her care. She has opted for the sale of "thiouraye" (a type of incense), perfumes, fabrics and shoes through one of her friends. She is applying for a loan of 500,000 francs with the aim of going to Ndiassane on the occasion of Maouloud (a Muslim festival celebrating the birth of the prophet Mohamed) to buy "thioubs" (special tinted fabric) to sell. It is an activity which she renews on an annual basis. Her loan will allow her to advance her business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes and perfumes

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica O. is 37 years of age. She sells charcoal and textiles to earn a living.  She uses some of her business profits to support her family and pay wages to her one employee. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for the training they offered her, since she has acquired customer care skills. She believes that loyalty and commitment are what leads a person to a successful life. She has requested for a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy charcoal and fabric for sale.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal and fabric for sale

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen akhtar wants a loan to buy iron rods to sell. Nazia Sakhi wants a loan to buy plastic utensils for her utensil-selling business. Anwari begum wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business.

Haleema is the group leader of the above-mentioned ladies. They all are citizens of a city named Arifwala, in Pakistan.

Haleema is 40-year-old married woman. She is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighbors and charges them accordingly. She has fixed charges for designer and simple-stitch dresses. She charges Pak Rs. 150 for designer clothes and Pak Rs. 90 for simple stitching. Her earnings allow her to pay for utilities. 

Her husband's name is M. S. and he runs a cloth-selling business. He purchases the cloth from various cities such as “Multan and Lahore” because of their good quality stuff and cheap rates. He has been doing this work for over 8 years. He earns approximately Pak Rs. 18,000 every month. Currently, he is in need of increased stocks in large quantity to complete the orders of his customers. Therefore, Haleema is asking for a loan worth Pak Rs. 20,000 which would be a great help for his business.

loans.use: Purchase cloth to complete orders

loans.name: Mburucuja Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Felicita S.  del km 7 Barrio Mubucuja de _C.D.E. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su comunidad. 
El comité se Denomina”Mburucuja  “ están en el Sexto  Ciclo   con 16  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas , las mismas poseen un ahorro de gas 4.692.309 gs, también realizan actividades para la recaudación de un pequeño fondo para el comité, en caso de que alguna de las compañeras este con dificultades.
La señora Cluadelina es una integrante del comite y se dedica principalmente a la venta de ropas especificamente de uniformaes escolares que las demás integrantes confeccionan, esta una forma de trabajo de este comite, todas de ayudadn unas a otras para lograr mejoras resultados.
El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de uniformes escolares como pantalones, camisas, polleras.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Sra. Felicita S., who lives at Km 7 of Mburucuja neighborhood in Ciudad del Este. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form this committee in their community.

The committee named “Mburucuja” is in its sixth loan cycle with 16 members. This neighborhood group is known for being united, supportive, and responsible. They have saved 4,692,309 PYG for gas and also engage in fundraising activities for a small account maintained by the committee in case any members run into difficulties.

Sra. Claudelina is one of the committee members who engages in the sale of clothing, specifically school uniforms produced by the other members. This is one type of business that is represented by this committee. All of the members help one another with achieving improved results. The loan being requested will be used to buy school uniforms such as pants, shirts, and skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias O. N. is 34 years old, married with four children who attend school.  He is a mechanic. He repairs vehicles and has two employees who assist him in running of the business.  Elias has been running this business for four years. His business is located in Ngong a few kilometers away from the capital city.  He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching him to keep proper records and management skills.  Elias has requested  a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy paint and grinders. He hopes to open other outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy paints and grinders

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes L. T. is a 33 year old single woman.  She runs a clinic where she offers medical services to her community. She saw the need to start this business six years ago because people in her community use herbal medicines since there are inadequate hospital facilities.   Agnes was previously employed as a community nurse before she opened her own clinic.  She also rears animals for commercial purposes, a trend which she inherited from her grandparents who were pastoralists. Agnes hopes to open a maternity hospital to assist the people of her community in the future.  She has requested for a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add a stock of medicines, medical gloves and injections.

loans.use: To add stock of medicines, medical gloves and injections

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Ghafooran wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nasreen wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business. 

Ramzana is an active group leader. She resides in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. Her family consists of five persons: four children and her husband. Her husband's name is M. M. and he has a cycle repair shop. He has been doing this work for over 5 years. Their kids are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 

Ramzana sees to her responsibilities of all kinds very efficiently. She takes care of her family and does domestic chores. She is applying for a loan to buy repair tools for her husband’s cycle repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase repair tools

loans.name: Coumba Samba

texts.fr: Madame Coumba samba T. est une femme commerçante  de 48 ans qui vit dans la localité de Ouakam. Elle s’active dans la vente de chaussures, parfums, d’habits  et de bracelets depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle a choisi cette activité génératrice  de revenus dans le but d’aider son mari à gérer le quotidien. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour renouveler  son stock de chaussures.  Le crédit consenti au sein de la mutuelle lui permet de participer dans la maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Coumba Samba T. is a 48-year-old shopkeeper who lives in Ouakam. For the past 20 years she has been active in the retail business of shoes, perfume, clothes and bracelets. She chose this revenue-generating activity with the intention of helping her husband deal with daily expenditures. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to renew her stock of shoes. The loan she is granted by the credit institution allows her to share household expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: La señora Maria José tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con nosotros, ya que se encuentra en una fecha de bastantes pedidos. La señora aduce que algo que le ha ayudado a mantener sus pagos en tiempo y forma, es la administración que ella le brinda a su negocio. Por lo que su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Para un futuro le gustaría mejorar las condiciones económicas de su vivienda. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de de calzado, ropa, pinturas, sabanas y adornos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria José has been working with us for a long time and has made several requests to date. She claims the discipline required to manage her business also helps her to keep her payments on time. Maria José sells general merchandise. In the future, she would like to improve her financial condition at home.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoes, clothing, paintings, linens, and decorations.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi  H. is 33 years old.  She sells charcoal and used clothes.  Her business is just one year old.  She has learned how to manage her business through Faulu Kenya.  Mwanaidi uses her profit to support her family and pay wages to her employee.  She wants to add stock of charcoal and clothes for sale so she has requested for a loan of Kes.15,000 from Faulu Kenya. In the future Mwanaidi hopes to expand her charcoal business into a wholesale business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and more used clothes for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice N. M. is a 21 year old single woman.  She has been running a retail shop for two years in Kajiado.  She also earns extra income from poultry farming.  Eunice invests the income she gets from her business to raise her college fees.  She has requested for a loan of Kes.10,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stock of household items such as toothpaste, soap and utensils. Eunice hopes to succeed in her business and to open up other shops.

loans.use: To add stock of toothpaste, soaps and utensils

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bakhtawar's Group

texts.en: Bakhtawar is a very hard-working lady. She works as a seamstress to generate income. Her income helps her husband to meet their expenses. Presently, she has a manual machine which takes a lot of time to complete a dress therefore she has decided to buy an automatic machine so she can complete more dresses and obtain good orders.

loans.use: To buy a new automatic sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a 25-year-old single lady. She has been running a salon for three years and has one employee who assists her in the business. She does hairdressing for her home area residents in Kajiado. She also runs a retail shop. She uses her earnings to support her family. She dreams of owning a classic salon and improving her living standards in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy hair products.

loans.use: To purchase hair products

loans.name: Adela Maria

texts.es: La señora Adela Maria tiene su negocio que es la venta de rosquillas, cacao, semilla de jícaro. La ubicación de su negocio es  a orillas de la carretera, por lo que es aquí donde vienen muchas desde hace 20 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que se ha esforzado mucho por mejorar sus ingresos. Esta solicitando un financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, ya que se acerca la semana santa y ella requiere de más producto para el negocio. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y al crédito. Su deseo es tener más ingresos para sufragar todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Sra. Adela Maria has a business selling donuts, cacao, and the seeds of the calabash gourd. Her business is located on the edge of the road. Adela has been managing her business for twenty years and has worked hard to improve her earnings.

Her loan will be invested in her business since Holy Week is approaching, thereby needing to acquire more products. Her sales are made for cash or on credit. She hopes to have more income so that she can cover all of her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Balisiima Women's Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Robinah, shown at the top left in the small photo, also appears in the group photo. She relies on selling agricultural produce in the central market of Lugazi to take care of her family of four children. With the support of her husband, all their children, plus dependents, have been able to go to school.

Robinah has been running this business’s trivial round for seven years and credits her longevity to the trust her customers have in her and in the good quality of the produce that she sells. She cites the unpredictable nature of her clients and the dry weather seasons as some of her major setback factors. The dry seasons means low food supplies from farmers. This means she has to make do with selling other commodities which are not in high demand with her established customers.

Robinah calculates she makes 120,000 shillings each week and plans to expand into a more wholesale setting in her business. She needs a loan to be able to take these plans in her stride by buying more produce for resale.

loans.use: To buy more farm produce to sell

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Madame Seynabou N. est une femme de mariée  38 ans qui habite dans la localité de Camberene.
Elle évolue dans le commerce et la vente de matériels  électroménagers.  Son magasin se situe non loin de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Camberene. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour renforcer son stock de matériels  électroménagers. Son crédit va lui permettre d’augmenter ses bénéfices  et de faire face a ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mrs. Seynabou N. is a 38-year-old married woman, who lives in Camberene. Her commercial activity focuses on the retail sales of household appliances. Her store is located not far from the Camberene branch of U-IMCEC. She is requesting a 150,000 francs loan to bolster her stock of household appliances. The credit loan will enable her to increase her profits and meet her personal needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster working capital

loans.name: Lucerito Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité inicio la Señora Olga V. del km 8 Monday de Ciudad del Este. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se denomina Lucerito  están en el Quinto  Ciclo   con 17  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables entre ellas, las mismas peseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan labores para la recaudación de un fondo para el comité.
Una de las señoras muy emprendedoras es la Romana A. quien se dedica a la venta de frutas de época, las frutas de sus vecinas y socias del comité y los expone frente a su casa en un puesto que ella misma hizo, así la señora trabaja y ayuda constantemente a su familia especialmente con los gastos de la casa (alimentación diaria). El solicitado fue para la compra de frutas como naranja, mandarinas, banana y piñas.
texts.en:
This current committee was started by Sra. Olga V., who lives at Km 8 Monday in Ciudad del Este. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form this committee in her area.

The committee is named “Lucerito” and started its fifth loan cycle with 17 members. This group stands out in the neighborhood for being close-knit, supportive, and responsible. The members possess a great entrepreneurial spirit and already work to collect money for the committee fund.

One of these enterprising women is Ramona A., who sells seasonal fruit grown by her neighbors and members of the committee. She displays her products at a stand in front of her house. Ramona works and constantly helps with the household expenses (daily meals). The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fruits such as oranges, tangerines, bananas, and pineapples.
