Desde hace dos ciclos el señor Enrique forma parte del Banco Comunal María Monserrate perteneciente a la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí.

El señor Enrique es casado tiene cuatro hijos el es comerciante dedicado a la compra y venta de mariscos, las negociaciones las realiza en el puerto de Manta y luego las distribuye a Quito y Guayaquil con este negocio el lleva 35 años trabajando el ingresó a la Fundación Espoir porque la mamá le motivo, alquila un carro para vender sus mariscos,  ya lleva 35 años en el negocio su mayor anhelo es  seguir trabajando de una manera exitosa para obtener buenas ganancias.

 El dinero que esta solicitando es para seguir incrementando su trabajo, Enrique trabaja de lunes a domingo  a veces trabaja 4 o 5 días cuando hay mas mariscos solo se trabaja 2 días, porque el mismo viaja a entregar y se toma  dos días en viajar, con este crédito invertirá todo el dinero en mariscos.

A veces cuando esta escaso el pescado tiene que salir desde muy temprano para alcanzar a comprar en alta mar, y si  hay bastante pescado solo compra en la orilla del puerto es menos difícil.
texts.en:
Mr. Enrique has had loans twice, and he is part of the María Monserrate Communal Bank in the city of Montecristi in the province of Manabí.

Mr. Enrique is married and has 4 children, he is a merchant and sells and buys seafood. He does his business in the Manta port and later sells them in Quito and Guayaquil. Mr. Enrique has been in this business for 35 years, he became a part of Espoir Foundation (Kiva’s field partner) because his mother motivated him to rent a car to sell his seafood. Since being in business for 35 years, his biggest dream is to keep working and to be successful so that he can have good earnings.

The money that he is seeking will be used to increase his work; Enrique works Monday through Sunday and sometimes works 4 or 5 days when there is more seafood. He only works 2 days because he travels to deliver the seafood and it takes 2 days to travel. With this loan, he will invest all the money in buying seafood.

Sometimes when fish is scarce, he has to leave his home very early to be able to buy on the high seas and if there is plenty of fish he only buys it in the shore of the port since it is less difficult.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and seafood in general.

loans.name: Esther Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín.
Rebeca es casada, tiene 46 años y 7 hijos, Rebeca vive en el distrito D. Chiara y tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, además Rebeca se dedica a la agricultura D. papa, producto que venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Rebeca necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, harina.
Los sueños D. Rebeca son mejorar su casa y comprar un terreno en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a member of the Dolphin Communal Bank.

Rebeca is married, is 46 years old and has 7 children. She lives in the district of Chiara and has a grocery store. Rebeca also grows potatoes and sells it in the supply market in the city of Ayacucho.

Rebeca needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be used to buy sugar and flour.

Rebeca’s dreams incluD., improving her home and to buy some land in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and flour.

loans.name: Francisca Margarita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne en la ciudad de Montecristi ubicada a 20 minutos de la capital manabita Portoviejo, viajamos para poder conversar con varias socias de la Fundación Espoir  y la señora Francisca L.  nos comentó de su trabajo.

La señora Francisca es madre soltera con dos hijos ella se dedica al comercio informal vende gafas, sombreros en diferentes playas del país con este negocio ya tiene 6 años, sus compra las realiza en la misma ciudad donde vive  para abastecerse, muy temprano en la mañana ella se dedica a su trabajo trasladándose de una ciudad a otra para poder obtener algo de ventas, los fines de semana es cuando mas viaja a las playas ya que es en esos días que hay mas turistas.

Con el préstamo que esta invertirá en su negocio  en ocasiones ha tenido que invertir 1.000 dólares porque hay épocas del año que mas se vende y tiene que surtir su stock, también cuenta que la época mas baja para vender es en la semana santa.

Por ahora la señora Francisca desea seguir trabajando como hasta ahora lo ha venido realizando para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, María Monserrate meets in the city of Montecristi, located 20 minutes from the capital Portoviejo. We traveled to speak to various members of the Espoir Foundation (Kiva’s field partner) and Mrs. Francisca L. told us about her work.

Mrs. Francisca is a single mother with 2 children. She is in the informal sector and sells glasses and hats in different beaches of the country. She has been in this business for 6 years, and buys her goods in the same city where she lives. Francisca very early in the morning works by going city to city to sell; she goes to the beaches mostly during the weekends since there are more tourists.

Sometimes she has to invest 1.000 dollars because there are times during the year that she sells more and she needs to stock her merchandize, she also tells us that the worse season for her sales is during holy week.

For now, Mrs. Francisca wishes to keep working as she has done to give her children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy glasses and hats.

loans.name: Maria Hermelinda

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín.
Maria es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Maria junto a su esposo tienen un taller de carpintería en su casa, sus productos los comercializa a las tiendas de muebles por mayor.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.
Maria sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Dolphin Communal Bank.

Maria is married, is 39 years old and has 2 children. She with her husband have a carpenter’s shop in their home, their products are sold to wholesale furniture stores.

Maria needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that will be used to buy lumber.

Maria dreams to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín.
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Vilma tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras. Además Vilma siembra papa que luego comercializa en la ciudad de Lima
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Vilma son construir su casa con material noble y tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Delfín communal bank. She is 31 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a small grocery and vegetable store out of her home. Vilma also raises potatoes which she sells in Lima. Vilma needs a loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) which she will invest in rice and sugar. She hopes to build her own house someday.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Fidel Salvador

texts.es:
El Señor Fidel Salvador Blandón Pinel, reside en una comunidad que se llama guayucali a unos 35 km de Condega, la actividad de trabajo de este cliente es la agricultura sembrando granos tales como frijol y maíz y cultivo de la papa, también  la ganadería mantiene su hato ganadero y también a la compra y venta de ganado. El crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar 4 toretes para desarrollo y después venderlos, ya que él quiere comprar estas 4 reses para  tener otros ingresos una vez venda estos animales. Este cliente comenzó esta actividad de trabajo cuando don Fidel Salvador después que terminaba la época de cosecha de granos comenzó a vender ganado para tener otra alternativa de trabajo y esto lo hizo primero vendiendo toretes que el sacaba de las vacas que él tiene, quedándose solamente  con el ganado hembra, al ver que esto le estaba dando resultado y mas ganancia fue ahí donde inicio a trabajar con apoyo financiero por parte nuestra para comprar más animales y tener mayores ganancias.
La actividad de trabajo de este cliente es netamente agropecuaria el siembra en épocas de cosecha en invierno granos básicos como frijol y maíz para comercializarlos, también siembra hortaliza cultivo de la papa con sistema de riego esto lo hace en verano, y también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad ganadera este cliente solamente se dedicaba a la siembra de granos básicos únicamente en épocas de invierno esto lo viene practicando  desde la infancia ya que se ha acostumbrado y criado en este  tipo de trabajo de campo. Ahora con esta otra actividad como es la compra y venta de ganado él espera seguir mejorando su operatividad de trabajo, aumentar la cantidad de novillos para la venta y de esta forma obtener mayores ingresos y tener  trabajo en todo el año, don Fidel tiene una esposa que le ayuda a los trabajos y quehacer del hogar como el cuidar de sus hijos y preparar los alimentos, también tiene 4 hijos que estudian y le ayudan a las labores  o trabajos de campo.
Este cliente tiene 9 años de trabajar con Ceprodel a recibido 12 créditos para esta misma actividades de trabajo de campo.
Don Fidel ha venido mejorando su actividad de trabajo y su nivel de vida esto se debe al impacto y beneficio que le han dado los financiamientos otorgados por Ceprodel, permitiéndole mejores condiciones básicas en su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Fidel Salvador Blandón Pinel lives in a community called Guayucali, some 35 km from Condega. He works in agriculture, growing crops such as beans, corn and potatoes. He also keeps livestock, taking care of his herd and buying and selling animals. He will use the loan to buy 4 steers to raise and sell. He will then put the income from these 4 animals to further use. Fidel Salvador began selling livestock after the harvest season for his crops ended, in order to have an additional type of work. At first, he sold calves that were born to his cows, keeping only one female. When he saw that this was going well and producing profits, he began to work with financial support from us to buy more animals and increase his income. Fidel Salvador dedicates himself full-time to agriculture. After the winter harvest, he plants staple crops such as beans and corn to sell. He also raises vegetables such as potatoes, using an irrigation system. He does this work in summer, and he also works buying and selling livestock. Before he started raising livestock, he worked exclusively raising staple crops in the winter season. He has done this work since his childhood, since he grew up in the countryside and was accustomed to this work. Now, with this additional livestock business, he hopes to continue improving the effectiveness of his work, increasing the number of cattle he sells and thus obtaining more income and having work throughout the year. Fidel has a wife who helps him in his work as well as with the household chores, such as preparing food and taking care of their children. He has 4 children who are in school and who also help him on the farm. Fidel has been a client of Ceprodel for 9 years and has received 12 loans to support his agricultural work. Fidel has constantly improved his farming and ranching business and his standard of living, thanks to the impact and benefits of the loans granted by Ceprodel, which have allowed him to raise the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 4 steers to raise

loans.name: Norma Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Norma del Socorro L. L., tiene 45 años vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es madre soltera de 4 hijos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, destazo de cerdo y res, y otros productos que comercializa.

Ella se siente agradecida con Kiva porque gracias a los prestamos,  ha podido invertir en su negocio en reiteradas ocaciones y mejorado  la infraestructura de su hogar, ahora ella solicita otro crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de ropa,  carne y productos domésticos, para aumentar el inventario de su negocio, debido a que ha observado, que su demanda se le ha incrementado, asi mismo quiere realizar unas reparaciones en la sala de su vivienda de tal manera que invertira en la comprad e materiales de construccion para dicho obra, agradece el apoyo brindado en los años pasados ya que a surgido un cambio en sus condiciones de vida, gracias a los prestamos que ha tenido con Afodenic.
texts.en:
Norma del Socorro L. L. is 45 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is the single mother of 4 grown children. She works selling American clothing, pieces of pork and beef, and other products. She is grateful to Kiva because thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to invest in her business on several occasions and also improve the infrastructure of her home. She is now requesting another loan which she will use to buy clothing, meat and household products, to increase the inventory of her business, since she has observed that customer demand has increased. At the same time, she would also like to carry out some repairs to the living room of her home; accordingly, she will invest in construction materials for this project. She is thankful for the support provided to her in previous years, since she has seen a positive change in her living conditions thanks to her loans with Afodenic.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her business and buying construction materials

loans.name: Galo Alfonso

texts.es:
María Monserrate banco comunal que pertenece al cantón Montecristi lugar donde se reúnen, Montecristi esta situada a pocos minutos de la capital Portoviejo es aquí no se elaboran los mejores muebles  y sombreros en fina paja toquilla.

El señor Galo es uno de los socios del  banco comunal  María Monserrate, el se dedica a la venta de artesanía de Paja Toquilla, con esta materia prima elabora muebles, carteras y accesorios para el hogar, desde que era un adolecente aprendió este oficio, trabajando en algunos talleres de la ciudad, y hasta que un día decidió casarse y empezar algo propio y armó un pequeño lugar para su taller, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y la esposa el se encarga también e viajar a comprar la materia prima  a los campos de la provincia. 

Sus ventas las realiza en ciudades como Quito y Guayaquil, el es quien se encarga de la mano de obra el acabado a cada obra que realiza es muy bueno tanto así que grande la demanda en ventas.
Con este nuevo préstamo Galo podrá invertir en materiales para elaborar varios perdidos que tiene, como juegos de salas y comedor, repisa, libreros entre otros, todos estos trabajos los realiza sobre pedido.
texts.en:
The María Monserrate Communal Bank is part of the canton of Montecristi, the place where the members meet. Montecristi is located a few minutes away from the capital of Portoviejo, where the best furniture and Panama hats are made from the fibers of the “toquilla” plant.

Sr. Galo is one of the members of the María Monserrate Communal Bank. He sells handicrafts made from the fibers of the toquilla plant, which is a primary material used for making furniture, handbags, and home accessories. Galo learned this trade as a teenager, working at a few shops around the city until one day he decided to get married and start something of his own. He prepared a small place for his workshop. Galo has the support of his wife and children. He also travels to buy toquilla fiber from farms across the province.

His sales are made in the cities, such as Quito and Guayaquil. Galo is the person in charge of all of the handwork needed to finish each piece. The completed work is very good and his sales reflect the high demand. With this new loan, he will invest in materials to make various items being requested such as living room and dining room sets, mantles, bookshelves, and other items. All of these items are made upon request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase "toquilla" fiber

loans.name: Sed

texts.es:
Sed es socio del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas.
Sed es soltero, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Sed estudia reparación de maquinaria pesada, tiene un mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte publico en la ciudad.
Sed necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su mototaxi.
Los sueños de Sed son mejorar la calidad de vida y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
Sed is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Margaritas”. He is 22 years old, single, and has one child. Sed studied heavy machinery repair and owns a motorcycle taxi with which he provides transportation services within the city.

He needs a loan of 1000 PEN to invest in repairs to his motorcycle taxi. Sed dreams of improving his quality of life and exercising his profession.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for repairs to his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Gregorio Arsenio

texts.es:
El señor Gregorio Arsenio A. R., tiene la edad de 41 años vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es casado y su esposa realiza los trabajos domésticos, él es albañil y tienen bajo su responsabilidad a 4 niños, son una familia de recursos muy escazos, que solicitan apoyo par mejorar dia a dia su estado social.

El lugar donde ellos habitan es muy humilde y reporta un alto índice de inseguridad social, dentro de los principales anhelos de la familia es el mejorar la infraestructura del hogar, es por esta razón que ellos solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción y de esta manera comnezar la edificación de un muro trasero en su hogar y de esta manera ofrecerle a su familia una mayor seguridad y la tranquilidad personal de ofrecerles a ellos mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Gregorio Arsenio A. R. is 41 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. He is married and his wife performs the domestic work. Gregoria works as a mason and is responsible for his four children. His family resources are very scarce, so the support he is requesting will improve his daily social status.

The place where they live is very modest and is situated in an area that reports a high rate of social insecurity. Improving the infrastructure of the home is the main desire of his family, which is why this loan is being requested. Gregorio will buy construction materials to begin building a wall behind his house to provide his family with better security and peace of mind, as well as offering better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security wall behind his house

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es: Dulce Maria tiene 40 años, por lo que su actividad económica es pulpería además de tener la pulpería se dedica a la venta de cerdos, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues sus inicios se dan como una alternativa de fuente de ingresos necesaria ya que tiene 2 hijos de los cuales tiene que hacerse cargo, todos los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda por lo que le dan el apoyo que necesitan. Actualmente solicitando para la compra de cerdos por lo que tiene varios encargos. Su deseo es lograr que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Dulce Maria is 40 years old and manages a grocery store. In addition, she has been selling pigs for more than five years. She started this business to provide an alternative source of needed income for her two dependent children. All of her loans have been a great help in providing the support that she needs.

This current loan she is requesting will be used to buy pigs because she has several orders. Her wish is for her children to complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy pigs

loans.name: Nanci Judith

texts.es:
El banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne en la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, 
La señora Nancy de 54 años  es casada con 4 hijos lleva 35 años de casada su esposo es chofer ella es profesora y  también dedica su tiempo al comercio informal, desde siempre le ha gustado el mundo de las ventas, por ello decidió un día invertir en ropa, ella empezó con la fundación con la suma de 500 dólares para la mercadería, y desde hace 10 años viene trabajando así,  y en los actuales momentos ella esta solicitando un monto mas alto, debido a que su negocio también ha ido creciendo.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Nancy invertirá todo en mercadería, como ropa, perfumes, shampoo, ropa interior, media y más, ella no pierde ni una sola oportunidad para trabajar por ahora  como es época de clases vende uniformes. 

La forma de trabajar de nuestra socia es dedicase en la mañana a la profesión de maestra y al mismo tiempo sus clientes son los compañeros de trabajo y amigos del sector donde vive, es así que puede mantener firme los dos trabajos, brindando facilidades de pagos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The María Monserrate Communal Bank meets in the city of Montecristi in the Province of Manabí.

Sra. Nancy is 54 years old and has four children. She has been married 35 years to her husband, who is a chauffeur. Nancy also devotes her time to an informal business, since she has always enjoyed the world of sales. For this reason, she decided one day to invest in clothing. When she started with the Foundation, she began with a total of $500 worth of merchandise and has been working ever since for the past ten years. At the moment, she is requesting a higher amount because her business has also grown.

With this new loan, Sra. Nancy will invest it all in merchandise such as clothing, perfumes, shampoo, undergarments, socks, and other items. She does not to miss a single opportunity to work because now is the school season when uniforms are sold.

Nancy works as a teacher in the mornings. At the same time, her customers are her co-workers and her friends from the area where she lives. She has a strong hold on both of her jobs and is able to provide payment options to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, perfumes, shampoo, undergarments, socks, and other items

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Don Reynaldo C. Dávila es un productor que reside en una comunidad a unos 30 km de Condega lugar conocido como san jerónimo, donde él tiene una finca y se dedica a las actividades de trabajo agrícolas al cultivo de granos básicos frijol y maíz para comercializarlos y al cultivo del café, este crédito lo utilizara para la compra de insumos agrícolas 6 quintales de abono y 6 quintales de urea, este cliente con este crédito quiere comprar estos insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos de café en lo que se refiere a aplicación de productos que sirven para darle y asegurar sus cosechas. Este productor comenzó esta actividad de trabajo cuando en la década de los ochenta el estado le dio dos manzanas de cultivo de café con el programa de la reforma agraria que se dio en esa década. Este cliente actualmente se dedica a las actividades de trabajo agrícolas y ganadera siendo la actividad agrícola su principal forma y rubro de trabajo el siembra 4 manzanas de frijol y dos de maíz en épocas de invierno,  y al cultivo del café una vez cada año,  ya que su finca esta ubicada en una zona montañosa y de altura con condiciones para este tipo de cultivo del café,  todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividades de trabajo ya que desde pequeño el realizaba este trabajo en una pequeña finca de sus padres a quien él les ayudaba. Don Reynaldo C. con este financiamiento el espera poder darle a sus cultivos la asistencia que necesitan y de esa forma poder cosechar más y de mejor calidad, con esto el obtendrá mejor oportunidad de vender sus productos a un mejor precio ya que estos cultivos sobre todo el grano del café es un rubro de mucha importancia de comercialización ya que es un producto de exportación. 
Don Reynaldo C. es casado y tiene tres hijos dos de ellos están en edad escolar y estudian la primaria. Desde el año 2005 a don Reynaldo se le han otorgado 6 créditos para esta actividad de trabajos de campo. El impacto y beneficio por cada financiamiento recibido  este cliente es importante porque le ha permitido incrementar su actividad de trabajo cosechando más y mejor mejorando su nivel de vida, en todo este tiempo el logro construir su casita, comprar 4 vacas paridas 2 toretes, y de igual forma ha venido comprando más terreno ahora el tiene 4 manzanas de café y 6 manzanas para la agricultura y 4 de bosques. De esta manera se puede ver el beneficio que ha tenido este cliente y el crecimiento de su actividad de trabajo.
texts.en:
Don Reynaldo C. Dávila is a farmer who lives in the community of San Jerónimo located about 30km from Condega. He owns a small farm there and grows crops such as beans, maize and coffee which he then sells. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy agricultural supplies such as 6 quintales (unit equal to 100lb) of fertilizer and 6 quintales of urea. Reynaldo will use these products on his coffee crops to ensure a good harvest. He began farming when, in the 1980s, the state gave him two manzanas (about 3.5 acres) of land on which to grow coffee as part of the agrarian reform program. Nowadays he raises animals as well as growing crops. He sows beans on 4 manzanas and maize on 2 manzanas in the winter. He also sows coffee beans once a year as his farm is located in a high mountainous area with appropriate conditions for growing coffee. Reynaldo has done this kind of work since he was small, starting out by helping his parents on their small farm. With the loan he hopes to use the products on his crops so he can get a bigger and better-quality harvest. Then he will get the chance to sell the products for a better price, especially the coffee which is very important since it is an export crop. Don Reynaldo is married and has three children, two of whom attend primary school. He has had six loans since 2005 and used the money for his farm. The impact and benefits have been important as they have allowed Reynaldo to expand his farm, increase the harvests, and improve his quality of life. During this period he has built a small house, bought four cows that had recently given birth, two bullocks, and also more land. He currently has 4 manzanas growing coffee, 6 manzanas growing other crops, and 4 manzanas of trees. It is very clear that this client has benefited greatly from the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es:
La señora Sixta D., tiene 51 años de edad es casada y con su familia, vive en el barrio Laureles Sur, ellos tiene 4 hijos de  los cuales el mayor vive independiente y los otros, tres trabajan en un mercado muy conocido de Managua vendiendo gallinas, de esta forma es que sobreviven día a día.

Ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de tortillas el cual se ha vuelto muy popular en el barrio, es por esta razón que ellos solicitan de un préstamo para agrandar el local de la venta, comprar materia prima  e instalar unas ventanas, que les  traerá mejor ventilación y le embellecerán su hogar, puesto que la venta la tiene en su casa, estas condiciones mejoraran su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Sixta D. is 51 years old, married, and lives with her family in the neighborhood of Laureles Sur. She has four adult children who live independently and three more who work at a well-known market in Managua selling chickens in order to survive each day.

Sixta has a small stand where she sells tortillas, which are very popular in her neighborhood. For this reason she is requesting a loan to enlarge her vending location, purchase raw materials, and install windows in her home to provide better ventilation and appearance. Since she sells her products from home, these conditions will improve the lifestyle for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for her business & install windows in her home

loans.name: Paulita Cándida

texts.es:
La señora  Paulita Cándida F. E., tiene la edad de 75 años, vive en el Barrio La Gloria, es casada y su esposo es contador,  tienen 3 hijos adultos y de estado civil casados, ellos tienen una pulpería desde hace 4 años, la cual es su fuente principal de ingresos.

Ella logro la apertura de su negocio, gracias al apoyo de su esposo, por lo cual ahora solicita de un préstamo,  para suplir el inventario del negocio en la compra de abarrotes, cosméticos y artículos de variedad, esto les permitiría, mejores condiciones económicas, e ingresos necesarios para la inversión a nuevas fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Paulita Cándida F. E. is 75 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of La Gloria. Her husband is an accountant. They have three adult children who are married. For the past four years, Paulita has been managing a store that serves as her main source of income.

She managed to open her business with the support of her husband. Paulita is now requesting a loan to restock her inventory. She plans to buy groceries, cosmetics, and a variety of other items that will allow her to improve her financial condition and generate the necessary income to invest in new sources of work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries, cosmetics, and variety of other items

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es:
La  alcancía comunal denominado “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS D. MICAELA BASTIDAS”  en el distrito D. Ate Vitarte, se encuentra  representado por la señora  Diana Lourdes y conformada por 10 socios que radican en dicha zona.
La señora Diana tiene 44 años D. edad, es soltera, tiene 1 hijo D. 23 años, quien en la actualidad trabaja para apoyar a su madre. El negocio al cual se dedica es el fotocopiado y tipeos en un local alquilado cerca a su vivienda, se inicio con una fotocopiadora desD. hace 13 años. Mujeres emprendedoras D. Micaela Bastidas; trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace 2 años, nuestros socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como la elaboración D. peluches y  el comercio minorista; con el reciente préstamo otorgado, por ejemplo la señora Diana, comprará mercadería para su negocio, todos los demás miembros incrementarán su capital para así obtener una mayor producción, mejor posesión en el mercado y captar mayor cantidad D. clientes. Los socios tienen grandes sueños y metas y se encuentran muy agradecidos con la institución por todo el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos y seguir trabajando para sus ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Mujeres Emprendedoras D. Micaela Bastidas” is in the District of Ate Vitarte. The group consists of ten members from this area and is represented by Sra. Diana Lourdes.

Sra. Diana is 44 years old, single, and has a 23 year old son who currently works with her. She manages a photocopy and typing center from a rented location near her home. Diana started her photocopy business thirteen years ago.

The “Mujeres Emprendedoras D. Micaela Bastidas” Communal Bank has been working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for two years. The members are involved in different activities, such as making plush toys and operating informal retail businesses. Sra. Diana, for example, will use this current loan to buy merchandise for her business. All of the other members need additional capital to achieve greater production, get a better share of the market, and attract more customers. They have great dreams and goals and are very grateful to the Institution for the support that has been provided. In addition, they commit to completing their payments and continuing their work toward their savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Carolina María

texts.es: La señora R. N., es una señora dedicada al trabajo, ya que de lunes a viernes se dedica a la costura, los fines de semana vende fritanga o comida en su casa, además tiene un Bixi que lo alquila diario que le genera ingresos adicionales. Tiene dos hijos uno está estudiando en la universidad y la hija menor que está en secundaria. El préstamo lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de verduras para la venta de comida y repuestos para el Bixi.
texts.en:
Sra. R. N. is woman who is dedicated to her work. She works Monday to Friday as a seamstress. On the weekends, she sells fried snacks and other foods from her home. Carolina also has a bicycle that she rents out to generate additional income. She has two children, one is studying at the university and her younger daughter is in high school.

This loan will used to purchase vegetables for her food business and spare parts for the rental bicycle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables for her food business & spare parts for her rental bicycle

loans.name: Humberto Pantaleón

texts.es: Es señor B. R. es de oficio mecánico, cuenta con un taller propio en su casa de habitación, la esposa trabaja en la elaboración de ropa y mochilas en una máquina de coser, tienen una hija menor de edad que está estudiando. Actualmente están viviendo en casa de un familiar, pero están finalizando la construcción de su casita propia, para trasladarse y por lo cual solicitan en CEPRODEL un segundo préstamo para finalizar la construcción y darle a su hija un hogar más estable para desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Mr. B. R. is a mechanic with his own workshop located in his house. His wife works making clothing and book bags with a sewing machine. They have a young daughter who is studying. At the moment, they are living in a relative’s house but they are finishing the construction of their own house, so they can move. For this reason, they are requesting a second loan with CEPRODEL in order to finish the construction of their house and give their daughter a more stable house to grow up in.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a house

loans.name: Henry Noel

texts.es:
El señor Henry S. tiene la edad de 52 años, casado y con un hijo mayor de edad, su esposa es Maestra de educación Primaria y su Hijo es Ing. Industrial trabajador de la Empresa Holcin. Don Henry es Contador y trabaja para una Empresa que distribuye desinfectantes y se desempeña como contador.
ÉL trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 2 años, tiempo en el que ha recibido 3 créditos, los dos primeros créditos fueron para mejoramiento de vivienda y este ultimo que es para comprar artículos del hogar.
texts.en:
Henry S. is 52 years old, is married, and has one adult son. His wife is an elementary school teacher and his son is an industrial engineer at the Holcin company. Henry is an accountant for a company that distributes disinfectants. He has worked with Ceprodel for two years, during which he has received three loans. The first two were for home improvement and this last one is to purchase household items.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of household items.

loans.name: Marlin Jony

texts.es: El cliente es de oficio comerciante, trabaja en coordinación con su esposo, en el negocio de compra y destace de cerdo. Vende en su casa la carne y los derivados del cedo como: chicharrón, frito, rebano, nacatamales y otros. El cliente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar de 11 y 7 años, de las utilidades del negocio mantienen la educación de ellos, y para los gastos de la casa. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos para mejorar sus ingresos o utilidades, ya que con el dinero en la mano pueden negociar mejor precio del cerdo.
texts.en:
The client works in sales with her husband, in a business selling and butchering pork. She sells the meat and products like: pork rinds, nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and other products at her house. The client has two school-aged children, ages 11 and 7. The profits from the business support the children’s education and the household expenses. The loan will be used to buy pigs to improve their profits, with the money, they can negotiate a better price for the pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de cerdos para destace to buy pigs to cut up/butcher

loans.name: Yorleny Fabiola

texts.es: La señora C. G., trabaja como ejecutivo de ventas para una empresa, el cual devenga un salario mensual, tiene una hija de menor de edad que está estudiando en primaria. Actualmente viven en casa de su mamá, pero está finalizando la construcción de su casa propia, por lo que acude a CEPRODEL para que le financien la compra del material que le hace falta, y de ese modo darle contar con un hogar estable para su hija.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. G. works as an account sales executive for a company, earning a monthly salary. She has a daughter who is a minor and goes to elementary school. She currently lives at her mother’s home but she is finishing the construction of her own house; for this reason she comes to CEPRODEL to get a loan to buy material that she needs and this way provide a stable home for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for her house

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who live in Ta Ou Kang Cheung village in the Takeo Province. Mrs. Chanthou S. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes.  

Mrs. Chanthou S. is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of land and cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vi Phan, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they cannot earn enough income. Thus, Mrs. Chanthou S. decided to seek a loan to buy some piglets and pig food for breeding. 

She is a mother of two children who are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding and pig food

loans.name: Sokroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokroeun S. was born in 1959. She is married to Mr. Soeurn Sem. They have five children, two of whom are construction workers, another does farming and the others are attending a local public school. This family lives in Thmei village in the Takeo Province. 

Mrs. Sokroeun S. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband is a cow middleman who can earn a little profit to support his children. However, he does not make enough to reinvest in his business. Thus, Mrs. Sokroeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for re-selling.

loans.use: To buy two cows for re-selling

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Mrs. Ren P. (pictured on the right) and Mr. Nak Mak (pictured on the left) are married with two young children. In fact, their children are too young to work or study. Their family resides in Thmei village in Takeo Province. Ren is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land on which she cultivates rice. By doing so, she is able to support her family. Her husband, meanwhile, is a palm juice collector who earns money by selling sugar palm. In addition, he works as a blacksmith.

Although they work extremely hard to better their lives, they have little to show for their hard work in the way of income. Thus, Mrs. Ren P. decided to apply for a loan to buy an ox for breeding purposes. She also plans to use the ox to plow her rice field.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing an ox for breeding and plowing purposes

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabián tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente hace 7 años, tiene un hijo de 6 años de 
edad. El vive en casa propia la cual es de adobe. El se dedica a brindar el servicio 
de transporte en su mototaxi, la cual adquirió con ahorros obtenidos de los años 
laborando como obrero de campo junto a su pareja. El se dedica a este servicio 
aproximadamente hace 3 años teniendo amplia experiencia en el servicio. Fabián destina 
todos los ingresos para la educación de su hijo, el cual se encuentra en edad escolar. 
fabian  sueña  ver su casa construida  ya que fue seriamente afectada por el terremoto 
y también que su menor hijo pueda estudiar y así poder brindarle seguridad y bienestar, solicita el credito para poder darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Fabián is 38 years old and has been in a common law marriage for seven years. He has a six year old son. Fabián lives in his own home, which is made of adobe. He provides transportation services using his motorcycle taxi, which he bought with the money he saved after years of working as a farm laborer with his partner. Fabián has been in the transportation sector for three years and has gained ample experience in providing this service. His earnings will go toward his son’s education since he is currently in school. Fabián dreams of seeing his house built since it was seriously impacted by the earthquake. He also wants to see his son study, so he will continue to provide for his security and well-being. The loan he is requesting will be used to provide maintenance to his motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeun N., who is a villager in Thmei village in Takeo Province, was born in 1964. To earn a living, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Thuon Chhou, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land on which he cultivates rice in order to support their family. As a side job, he is also a laborer. They have three children: one child is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are studying in the local public school.

Because her breeding business has been doing rather well, she is hoping to embark on a new business venture. Thus, in order to improve and expand her animal-breeding business, Mrs. Moeun N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.use: To improve and expand her breeding business by purchasing a cow

loans.name: Nocturnal Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Nocturnal. Está ubicado en la colonia el Deny, Jilotepec en el Estado de México, , México. El grupo está conformado  por 10 integrantes.

Eleuteria Martínez L. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 61 años, no tiene estudios, es ama de casa y campesina y tiene 7 hijos, 3 mujeres y 4 varones, los cuales ya son grandes pero ella se encarga de criar a sus dos nietos de 10 y 6 años.  Ella se dedica a la crianza de vacas, vende leche y hace queso, inició su negocio hace 4 años. Solicita el préstamo para la  compra de alimento y forrajes para sus vacas y también quiere comprar unos pollos para engordarlos y después venderlos, ya que suele dedicarse a la crianza de animales en general, pues comenta, todo es negocio y hay que aprovechar. Sus clientes y vecinos la consideran una mujer muy activa y trabajadora pues a pesar de no tener una preparación académica es una excelente administrador, quien además de atender su negocio y su hogar tiene bajo su cuidado a dos de sus nietecitos, a quienes desde ahora les inculca el amor al trabajo. 
Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente motivada  a seguir adelante y agradecida por la oportunidad que se le brinda de obtener un crédito sin tanto requisito. Espera poder conservar éste crédito para mantener su negocio y con ello poder dejarles un patrimonio a sus nietos. 

Irma O. V. es Presidenta de este grupo. Tiene 42 años, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, es casada y tiene  3 hijos, una mujer y 2 varones de 2, 4 y 5 años.  Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas hechas a mano que inició hace un año. Solicita el préstamo para iniciar su negocio de bisutería en el cual ya tiene experiencia,  y en su momento le fue muy bien, por lo que considera que es una muy buena opción para obtener mas ingresos para su hogar y poder brindar a sus hijos una  calidad de vida. Además tiene la ventaja de que podrá atender sus dos negocios a la vez pues mientras sus clientas compran tortillas, podrán ver su joyería y así poco a poco se irán animando a comprar alguna novedad. De esta manera con las ganancias que ambos le generen tendrá la oportunidad de establecer bien su negocio de tortillas ya que actualmente lo trabaja en un pequeño espacio de un local que le prestaron y para ella su sueño es tener su propio localito bien equipado y acondicionado para brindar mejor calidad y servicio a sus clientes. 
Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se muestra muy optimista porque para ella es muy importante que su negocio crezca y comenta ésta es una buena oportunidad con la que espera sacar adelante a su familia.  

Las demás integrantes del grupo son:
-	Gabriela M. S. (Venta de Sabanas)
-	Alejandra P. Martínez (Venta de Ropa y Zapato)
-	Juana Hernández Martínez (Venta de Lencería)
-	Sandra Hernández Martínez (Venta de zapato por catalogo)
-	Altagracia Martínez Hernández (Venta de Cosméticos)
-	Anayensi Sánchez Hernández (Venta de Lencería por catalogo)
-	Reyna Velázquez García (Venta de Frituras)
-	M. M. Geraldine Estefanía (Venta de ropa interior)
texts.en:
This group is called “Nocturnal”, which is located in the subdivision of Deny, Jilotepec in the State of México. There are ten members in the group.

Eleuteria Martínez L. is one of the group members. She is 61 years old and has no education. Eleuteria works as a homemaker and farmer. She has seven children, three daughters and four sons, who are all grown and care for her two grandchildren (ages 10 and 6). Eleuteria raises dairy cows, sells the milk, and produces cheese. She started this business four years ago. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy feed and fodder for her cows. She will also buy a few chickens to fatten for subsequent resale since she already raises animals. Eleuteria says her business is everything, so she has to make the most of it. Her customers and neighbors consider her to be an active and hardworking woman who is an excellent manager despite not having any academic training. In addition to tending to her business and household, she also looks after her two young grandchildren in whom she tries to instill a love of work. At the time of this loan request, Eleuteria felt motivated to press forward and was appreciative of this opportunity to obtain a loan with few requirements. She hopes to secure this loan so that she can maintain her business with which she will be able to leave an inheritance for her grandchildren.

Irma O. V. is the group president. She is 42 years old, married, and has a sixth grade education. Irma has three children, a daughter (age 2) and two sons (ages 4 and 5). A year ago, she started her business selling handmade tortillas. She is requesting a loan so that she can start a costume jewelry business since she already has experience. At the moment, Irma is doing very well but she believes this will be a better option to earn more household income to provide her children a higher quality of life. She will also have the advantage of running two businesses at the same time because customers who buy tortillas will be able to see her jewelry. Gradually they will be convinced to buy some of her novelties. With the earnings from both ventures, she will have the opportunity to improve her tortilla business since the location where she currently works is a small space. Her dream is to have a better location that is well-equipped and suited for providing a better quality of service to her customers. At the time of her loan request, Irma was very optimistic because she says growing her business is a good opportunity for her family to get ahead.

The other group members are as follows: - Gabriela M. S. (Bedding sales) - Alejandra P. Martínez (Clothing & Shoe Sales) - Juana Hernández Martínez (Lingerie Sales) - Sandra Hernández Martínez (Catalog Shoe Sales) - Altagracia Martínez Hernández (Cosmetic Sales) - Anayensi Sánchez Hernández (Catalog Lingerie Sales) - Reyna Velázquez García (Fried Food Sales) - M. M. Geraldine Estefanía (Undergarment Sales)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal feed & chickens for fattening

loans.name: Luz Gaby

texts.es:
Luz tiene 42 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, D. los cuales su 
hija mayor se encuentra en la Universidad y los otros 2 en edad escolar. Ella inicio 
el negocio hace 3 años con capital lo adquirio  a través D. un crédito obtenido en forma 
grupal y D. allí ha ido incrementando el negocio, hace 2 años inicio el negocio D. 
venta D. golosinas en el paradero D. los ómnibus que trasladan a las personas que 
trabajan en los fundos. Ella atienD. el negocio D. manera muy calida y amable ya que 
la gran mayoría D. sus clientes son sus vecinos D. la zona, el sueño D. Luz es 
incrementar poco a poco su negocio ya que con los ingresos obtenidos esta educando a 
sus hijos, y que D. esta manera ellos puedan tener un mejor futuro. Solicita el 
crédito para la compra D. mercadería y para gastos escolares.
texts.en:
Luz is 42 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and 3 children. Her oldest daughter is in University and her other children are school-aged. She began her business three years ago, having gotten her starting capital through a group loan and she has since been growing the business. Two years ago she began selling snacks at the bus stop to people who work nearby. She attends to her business in a very friendly and loving way, as most of her customers are also her neighbors. Luz hopes to grow her business little by little, now that she is able to pay for her children's education with her income. She wants them to have a better future. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more snacks and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Chhoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoy M. (pictured on the right) and Mr. Soeurn Khut (pictured left) are married and have three children. Two of their children are cleaners, while their other child is currently learning how to repair radios and telephones. The family resides in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo Province. To earn a living, Mrs. Chhoy M. is a noodle seller in the local village, while her husband is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land on which he cultivates rice in order to support the family.

Unfortunately, the family does not have enough money to pay for their child's repair school. Thus, Mrs. Chhoy M. decided to ask for a loan from AMK to pay for the school. With the remaining loan proceeds, she would like to buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.use: To pay for her child's school fees and to purchase a cow

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhuon S. is a villager of Andoung Samretth village in Takeo Province. She was born in 1963. She is a farmer who owns 2-hectares of land where she grows rice and vegetables to sell to support her family. Her husband (also in the photo), Mr. Chham Chea, is a construction worker who earns a low salary to support his family.

In the rice field, they have a big problem because their rice field is on time to do farming but they do not have some supplies they need to do so.

So, in order to improve their production of rice, Mrs. Chhuon S. decided to request a loan to buy a water machine, rice seed, and with the rest of the loan she would like to plow her field.

She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, another is a cleaner, and the other attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and rice seed.

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: This is Mr. Kung C., who is a villager living in Andoung Samretth in Takeo province.  Born in 1962, he is a widower who lives with three children: one  is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a driver who earns a low salary, and the third is a Khmer cake seller. Mr. Kung C. is a farmer who owns 2.5-hectares of land to cultivate rice to support his family. Although they try to work hard, the family earns little income.  Mr. Kung C. wants to start a new business, but the family does not have enough money. Thus, he decided to apply for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and to plow his field for farming.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mrs. Yin R., is 29 years old. She sells brooms that she buys in bulk from a broom-maker who lives near her house. She sells her products at retail in the local market and earns around $3 per day.

Her husband, Horm Vet, 34, is a motorbike taxi driver as well as a wooden house builder. Yin R. has two teenage children who are school age and depend on her income.

Yin R. planned to build a new house and has been saving up some housing tools for construction. But this process has still not started due to the need for more essential accessories. In order to start building, Yin R. is applying for a loan to buy the required articles.

loans.use: To buy the required articles to build their home.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap H., 44, lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo Province. She is a noodle seller in the local village and her husband, Mr. Noeurn Chear, is a farmer who owns 1.3-hectares of land to cultivate rice to support his family. Through these activities, the couple supports three children: one is a clothes seller who earns a small salary and the others attend school far from their home. In order to improve their children's education, Mrs. Pheap H. decided to seek a loan to buy a new motorbike. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to support their children's education

loans.name: Alondras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Alondras, porque en el momento en que se formo 2 D. las integrantes esperaban bebe y se llamarían Alondra cada bebe. Está ubicado en L. comunidad Barrio D. Jesús  2° Sección San Pablo Autopan  en el Estado D.  México.  El grupo está conformado por  8 integrantes.
Araceli A. F. es  L. presidenta del grupo. Tiene 32 estudió hasta una carrera técnica en secretariado es comerciante y no tiene hijos ElL. se dedica a atender su miscelánea que inició hace 4 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir mas en L. tienda como abarrotes, recaudo etc. Sus clientes son personas D. L. misma localidad, pues no hay muchas tiendas por L. zona además D. que sus clientes L. buscan y L. prefieren por que ahí encuentran D. todo, desD. recaudo, chiles secos, abarrotes entre otros productos.  Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta por que podrá tener más mercancía. Quiere este crédito para poder invertir más. También espera poder con el tiempo comprar un coche que le ayuD. a transportar su producto D. donD. se surte.
Esta foto fue tomada en L. tienda o miscelánea  D. L. Sra. Araceli, se ve como L. Sra. Araceli venD. varios productos en su tienda que inició hace 4 años.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
* R. M. JOSEFINA VENTA D. FRUTA
*P. M. JOSEFINA VENTA D. SERVILLETAS Y DULCES
*B. P. TERESA VENTA D. DULCES
*A. F. ALMA DELIA VENTA D. PANADERIA
*D. L. C. M. MARGARITA VENTA D. TELAS SERVILLETAS E HILOS
*R. H. SARA VENTA D. ZAPATO
*F. JIMENES MARIANA VENTA D. DULCES
texts.en:
The name of this group is “Alondras” (meaning larks, the songbirds) since when the group was formed two of the members were pregnant and the babies were going to be named “Alondra”. The group is based in the community of Barrio D. Jesús 2nd Section, San Pablo Autopan in the state of Mexico. The group has 8 members. Araceli A. F. is the groups’ President. She is 32 years old, she obtained a traD. degree as a secretary and has no children. She tends her general store that she started 4 years ago. She is requesting the loan to invest in the store and buy groceries, spices, condiments, etc. Her customers are people from the same community; there are not many stores in the area, and her customers seek her and prefer her because they can find everything they need such as spices, condiments, dry chiles, groceries, and other products. She is very happy requesting this loan because her store will have more merchandise. She wants this loan to invest even more. With time, she also hopes to buy a car so she can transport the products herself from her providers. This picture was taken at the store of Mrs. Araceli; it can be seen how Mrs. Araceli sells an assortment of products at the store she started 4 years ago. The other group members are: * Josefina R. M. sells fruit * Josefina P. M. sells napkins and candy * Teresa B. P. sells candy * Alma Delia A. F. sells bread * Margarita D. L. C. M. sells fabrics, napkins, and threads * Sara R. H. sells shoes * Mariana F. Jimenes sells candy

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest more in her store and buy groceries, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim T. is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to grow rice and vegetables to support her family. Her husband is a fisherman. Mrs. Yim T. and Mr. Sung Ouch are a couple who live with two children and two grandchildren: their children are laborers and their grandchildren are enrolled in the local public school. This family of six members lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. 

Although this family works hard, they do not earn enough income. Thus, Mrs. Yim T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov B., who lives in Roluos village in Takeo Province, was born in 1955. She is a duck breeder who earns money selling eggs. Her husband, Mr. Chhorn Nam, is a farmer who owns 3 hectares of land to cultivate rice to support the family. With the rice field, they have a problem because it's time to do the farming. Thus, in order to improve production of rice, Mrs. Nov B. decided to ask for a loan to plow the rice field. 

Nov B. is the mother of two children who help their parents do the farming and duck breeding. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To plow the rice field

loans.name: Chrorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chrorn H. is a villager in Roluos village in Takeo province. She was born in 1964. She is a farmer who owns 3 hectares of land to cultivate rice to support her family. In addition, she is a Khmer cake seller and her husband, Mrs. Yoem Hun, is a sailor. With the rice field, they have a problem because their field has infertile soil. Thus, in order to improve the production of rice, Mrs. Chrorn H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. With the rest of the loan she would like to plow the rice field. 

Chrorn H. is the mother of two children: one  is attending the local public school and the other is a motorbike taxi driver. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: H., 38, lives in Battambang province, where she earns her daily income by providing a tailoring service for her neighbors in the village. She has been married for a year and has six children: three are married and have already started new homes and the remaining three are school age. Usually, H. relies on her husband's income; he owns a car and operates a taxi service. H. will be using her first loan to construct a hedge around her house in order to protect her property. She would like to say thank you to the donors who make her loan possible.

loans.use: To construct a hedge around her house

loans.name: Koem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem K., 42, is the leader of a 4-member group loan offered by AMK, located in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. Each member of the group will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Koem K. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Khom Ouch, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. The couple has a 4-year-old child.
Mrs. Koem K. is requesting a loan of 400,000 Riels to buy fertilizers and to pay for pumping water to support her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to pay for pumping water

loans.name: Saveth

texts.en: Mrs. Saveth H. is the wife of Mr. Put Bey, and they are villagers in Poun village in Takeo province.  To support their family which includes three children who all attend the local public school, she farms rice on a plot of land that she owns, and he is a motorbike broker. Although this family works hard, they do not earn enough income to cover their family needs. Thus, in order to increase their income, Mrs. Saveth H. has decided to apply for a loan from AMK in order to buy two motorbikes for resale. Her husband is pictured on the right.

loans.use: To buy two motorbikes for resale.

loans.name: Luna Nueva I Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama LUNA NUEVA, porque comentan que a partir de este momento han comenzando un nuevo momento en su vida y, uno muy importante. Está ubicado en la comunidad de Zapotlan, perteneciente al municipio de Zapotlan de Juárez en Hidalgo y, es un grupo conformado por 10 integrantes.
María Esperanza Sánchez E.  es integrante del grupo, tiene 38 años y dos hijos de 3 y 4 años es casada y estudio la secundaria, se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos (chalupas, enchiladas, taquitos dorados, tostadas) desde hace dos años. Comenta que quiere su préstamo para comprar mesas para su negocio ya que por el momento cuenta con dos mesas y ya le son insuficientes para atender a sus clientes. Quiere que sus hijos crezcan y estudien una carrera con el objetivo de ser alguien importante en la vida.  
Ivonne M. Rodríguez es la presidenta del grupo, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 7 años, durante dos años se ha dedicado a la renta de videojuegos, es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a su familia y trabajo, es considerada por el reto del grupo como una buena líder. Requiere de su préstamo para comprar refacciones de los videojuegos y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a las personas que asisten a hacer uso de estos. Ella tiene muchos deseos de conocer el mar con su familia y por eso se esmera en su trabajo. 
Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la Sra. María Luisa Sánchez E.,  integrante del grupo LUNA NUEVA, que está ubicado en la cabecera municipal de Zapotlan de Juárez en el Estado de Hidalgo. Es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de 13 y 7 años, estudio la secundaria y, se dedica a su taller de costura que inició hace 22 años, hace pantalones y shorts dependiendo de la temporada. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilo y así poder atender los pedidos que tiene ya pactados con algunas maquilas cercanas a su domicilio. Tiene la inquietud de poder apoyar a las mujeres de su localidad, ofreciéndoles empleo para que tengan un mejor nivel de vida.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:

N. T. NEYDA ANGELICA	VENTA DE COSMETICOS

S. J. MARIA ELENA	VENTA DE COMIDA

P. S. BRISEIDA YEENIA	VENTA DE LENCERIA POR CATALOGO

E. C. NATALIA EDITH	VENTA DE CALZADO Y ROPA

V. A. PATRICIA	PAPELERIA Y MERCERIA

S. E. MA ADELAIDA	VENTA DE PERFUME Y LENCERIA

S. B. YESSICA MARLEN	VENTA DE ZAPATO POR CATALOGO
texts.en:
This group is called "LUNA NUEVA" (New Moon) because they say that from this point forward a new, very important, movement has begun in their lives. It is located in the Zapotlan community of Zapotlan de J. in Hidalgo. The group has ten members. Maria is a member of the group and is 38 years old, is married, and has two children, ages 3 and 4. She has a junior high school education, she sells Mexican food (chalupas, enchiladas, taquitos, tostadas), and has been doing so for the past two years. She tells us that she is requesting this loan in order to buy more tables for her business. At the moment she only has two and they are not enough to serve all of her customers. She wants her children to grow up and study a career that will make them important in life. Ivonne is the president of the group. She cohabitates and has three children, ages 14, 11, and 7. For the past two years she’s been in the business of renting video games. She is a very responsible person, dedicated to her work and family. The rest of the group considers her to be a good leader. She needs this loan in order to buy new video games to be able to offer better service to her customers. She has a great desire to see the ocean with her family some day. This is why she works so hard. This photograph was taken at María’s home, also a member of the “Luna Nueva” group. She is a single mother with two children, ages 13 and 7. She has a junior high school education and has a sewing shop that she started 22 years ago. She makes pants and shorts depending on the season. She is requesting this loan in order to buy thread, to be able to deliver her current orders. She really would like to help the ladies in her neighborhood, by offering them employment and giving them the opportunity to improve their lives. The other members are: Neyda – Cosmetic Sales Maria Elena – Food Sales Briseida – Catalog linen sales Ntalia Edith – Clothing and shoe sales Patricia – Paper goods Ma Adelaida – Perfume and linen goods Yessica – Shoe sales via catalog

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory and supplies

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en: Mrs. Simorn H. is 54 years old and she lives in Ruessei Srok village in Kandal province. She is a flower seller who earns a small income to help support her family. In order to increase her income and improve conditions for her family, Mrs. Simorn H. has decided to request a loan to grow an herb crop and also to buy a hose for pumping water to her herb crop.  Her husband, Mr. Synoeun Sok, is a soldier who receives a small income to help support the family. The couple has three children, one of whom lives at home and helps her mother with the business, and the other two are students who also help with the business at times. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To grow an herb crop and buy a hose.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Mrs. Nget K. lives in Prey Prum village in Takeo Province and she was born in 1958. She and her husband, Mr. Chheng Man, are farmers who own a plot of land for growing rice which is how they support their family.  They have some problems with the rice field because it is located far from an irrigation system. Thus, in order to improve their business, Mrs. Nget K. has decided to request a loan to buy a water machine. She will also buy a cow for breeding. This couple has a child who attends the local public school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena T. is from the village of Dicayo. She is 57 years old and married with 3 adult-aged children. To make a living Lucena bakes and sells a variety of staple products including bread in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lucena joined PMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase cooking ingredients.

Lucena is requesting her third loan from PMPC, for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase baking equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baking equipment.

loans.name: Thoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun P. lives in ChanLork village in Kandal province. The members of the village bank loan selected her as village bank president. This loan group offered by AMK consists of 18 members. Each member will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Thoeun P. is 55 years old and a single mother with three children -- two are members of staff in a hotel and one is a student in the local school. Mrs. Thoeun P. stays at home to cook and care for her children.

In order to support her children's work, she is seeking a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children's transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Nine people who all live in Kampong Pou village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Each member will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Pheap K. was selected village bank president by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. Mrs. Pheap K. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to support her farming crops.

Her husband, Mr. Vit Mouk, is a construction worker who earns a small income. The couple has four children; one is seamstress in the garment factory and the others attend the public school and also help their mother with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is 39 years old and lives with her two daughters in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city in Mongolia, and the capital city of the country. She and her family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest daughter is a college student and her youngest daughter is a secondary school student. During the day, she operates a grocery store and she has been doing so since July 2009 after working in well-known restaurants called Haan Buuz and Saran Buuz for eight years.  Before she she moved to Ulaanbaatar in 2001, she had worked as a hairdresser in a public service center in her home province of Bayanhongor since 1987. Bolormaa has been planning to expand her grocery store into a general store, and already has started the preparation. She is focused on the future and says, “I would like to create my own capital.”  She is requesting an 800,000 tugrug loan to increase her working capital and to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her store.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe B. is from the village of San Antonio. She is 29 years old and married with 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Phoebe runs a general store selling a variety of different products to the local community. Phoebe has been in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Phoebe joined PMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Phoebe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Phoebe is now requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to be used to purchase new items, expanding her product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Phoebe from PMPC and the second through KIVA.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the product offering in her store.

loans.name: Taem

texts.en: Mrs. Taem C. is 50 years old and she lives in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 3.50-hectare field where she grows rice and eggplant for selling to her support her family.  She has decided to request a loan in order to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to help farm her crops. Her husband, Mr. Sanh Sor is a construction worker who receives a small salary to help support his family. The couple has seven children, three of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory and another who is a construction worker.  The other three are students in the local school. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline for farming.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace F. is from the village of Barangay 1 in Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 33 years old and married with 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Grace runs a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Grace has owned her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Grace is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan which will be used to purchase new items, expanding her product offering. This loan will be the 2nd PMPC loan taken out by Grace. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the product offering in her store.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg is a 35 years old and lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her son live together in a small house which they own. Presently, she operates a secondhand handbag trading business at Narantuul, the largest and most crowded market. She sells a range of Korean secondhand handbags at her counter. Erdenechimeg has been operating this business since 2002, and has steadily expanded her business. Over the years, she has worked very hard and has gained a great deal of business experience. Furthermore, Erdenechimeg has been planning to grow her business and to open her own store in the future and wants to increase her working capital. Erdenechimeg has many plans for the future and says, “ I would like to create my own store.”  She is requesting a 1,600,000 tugrug loan to expand her production line and purchase a variety of secondhand handbags for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of secondhand handbags.

loans.name: Amilyn's Group

texts.en: Amilyn M. is from the village of Minanga Sur, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 27 years old and is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Amilyn is married and has two school-aged children. She is just starting a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Amilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Amilyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna M. is from the village of Banonong. She is 45 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a seafood stall selling products such as fish, crab, and prawn in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from PMPC. Myrna is now requesting a 10,000 PHP loan which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Myrna from PMPC.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs. Im M. is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in Phum Thom village in Kandal province. She is the mother of three children who all are students in the local school. Mrs. Im M. stays at home and cares for her children. Her husband, Mr. Sokha Khov, is a chef in a restaurant earning a small salary to support his family. 

With her husband's work place far from the house, Mrs. Im M. decided to ask for a loan from AMK to add to her savings to buy a motorcycle for husband's transportation. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon K. is a villager from Prachum Angk village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. For her farming, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine and hose. With the rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizer and pesticide and pay for a farm laborer. 

Mrs. Phon K. is a 66-year-old widow with four children: one of whom is an iron welder, another one is a construction worker, and the other two are students in the local school. They also help their mother with the farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine and hose as well as fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for a farm laborer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
