texts.en:
Alicia D. is from the village of Bandera. She is the leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is D. Group.
Alicia is 37 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP average per month from these activities.
In 2009, Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng K., 46, has an annual business planting rice crops, which she harvests and sells when the rice ripens. She has been farming for many years. Usually, she depends on income from her husband, who is a fisherman at the river.
Sreng K. has seven children, one of whom is married and lives separately while the others are single. To make a more comfortable life, one of her daughters works sewing clothes in the garment industry. Sreng K. will use her loan to purchase a pump to pump water for her crop.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to pump water for her crop

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden S. is 29 years old and married to a teacher. She has two school-aged children. She is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs such as rice, posho, beans etc. in her restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell in her restaurant. With the extra profits from her loan, S. hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Lorita

texts.en:
Lorita G. is from the village of Brgy. 1. She is 65 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Lorita owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lorita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Lorita joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lorita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Tupendane A Group

texts.en:
Zainabu H., age 53, is married with grown up kids.  She has a food vendor business, which she started in 2004.  She works from 5:30AM to 12:00PM daily, and she is able to make monthly profits of about $114.

This will be Zainabu’s tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start the business of darks and increase her food business volume.  She has paid back the loans successfully.  She hopes for a new loan to continue improving the stock and quality of her food, and to start selling fabrics and liquid soap.

Zainabu will share this loan with her subgroup, Tupendane A Group, which totals 5 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Zainabu is in a green and yellow dress.

loans.use: To improve stock and quality food, and start selling fabrics and liquid soap

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena F. is a married entrepreneur. She runs a Tailoring Mart shop business in Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. Helena designs and makes different types of clothing for women and men, plus children's school uniforms. She purchases her business materials from wholesale and retail shops at Kariakoo city market shopping center.
Helena has been in this business for four years and her business income enables her to meet her family's needs and put capital into her business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 TZS to buy more business materials.

loans.use: To buy more business materials

loans.name: Amartsetseg

texts.en:
Amartsetseg is 35 years old and lives with her two children in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest son, Baatarsuren, attends a local high school.
During the day, Amartsetseg operates a grocery store business in the Chingeltey district. She sells food, cosmetic products and meat at her grocery store, which she has been operating since 2009. Before this, between 2005 and 2009, she rented a counter for her meat-trading business at Huchit shonhor, the largest and most crowded food market in Mongolia. Generally, she has been operating a food-trading business for 18 years and has become an experienced trader. Currently, her daily revenue exceeds 300,000 MNT (~ 211 USD).
Amartsetseg has many plans for the future, and says “I would like to create my own store, which will be helpful to increase my business profit. Presently, I have been renting a place for my business.” She is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to increase her working capital and purchase more inventory for her grocery store.

loans.use: To increase working capital and purchase more inventory

loans.name: Asomidin

texts.ru: Хусаинов Асомидин проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Асомидин имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где сажает пшеницу и арбуз. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Asomidin H. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Asomidin has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years. He leases a plot of land, where he grows wheat and watermelons. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wilma's Group

texts.en: Wilma S.'s main source of income comes from providing general services to local community members. She is 59 years old, married and has three adult children. She is from the village of Cawa-cawa. Wilma has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC and her second with Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. Wilma is the leader of this two member group accessing a loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter and construct an animal pen

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en: Bayarmagnai lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They have been living in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a ger in a yard that belongs to her sibling. Currently, she operates a secondhand shoe trading business at Narantuul, the largest and most crowded market in Mongolia. She has been operating this business since 2003 and has gained much experience in the previous years. Bayarmagnai sells a range of Korean secondhand shoes and purchases her products from wholesalers who sell the secondhand shoes near from the Narantuul market. Bayarmagnai buys a package of shoes for 100,000 tugrugs (~ $70 US). There are 20-25 secondhand shoes per package. She sells the secondhand shoes at different prices depending on the shoes design and quality. Bayarmagnai is requesting a 630,000 tugrug loan to expand her product line and to increase the working capital of her business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mrs. Som S. has a life partner in her husband, who appears in the photo here. They both reside in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. The couple has one son, who is now a lovely baby, under their care.
S. is a local farmer, growing a variety of green vegetables on her own farmland. In addition, she also provides a tailoring service from her home. Her husband is a fisherman who depends on fishing around the ponds of their community, which is enough for both eating and selling. He is also a temporary worker on a construction project.
S. is requesting a loan to buy mature rice in bulk from other farmers to store in her home for a while before selling it to gain extra income. With any remaining cash, she will buy a piglet for her pig pen.

loans.use: To buy mature rice in bulk from other farmers

loans.name: Emelita Jamolod Group

texts.en:
Emelita J. is from the village of Taguilon. She is the leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Emelita is 32 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Emelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce M. makes palm kernel oil for sale at Elmina. Joyce has received junior high education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a welder. She helps her husband in taking care of her children. Her loan will be added to her income to buy more palm nuts to make the kernel oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house on an already bought piece of land. This picture was taken at the site where she makes the oil.

loans.use: Her loan will be added to her income to buy more palm nuts to make the kernel oil for sale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Despite failure in one of her previous businesses, a hog-fattening business, Erlinda M. has able to pay back the whole amount of the loan she received from Kiva through ASHI. Aside from her dreams for her children, Erlinda’s determination is to maintain a good performance in terms of repayment and attendance at the weekly center meeting of ASHI. This has inspired her to work harder at making money out of her other business which is the selling of nipa shingles (one of the most common and the cheapest roofing materials in the province). 

Anyhow, Erlinda has able to regain the capital she lost in her hog-fattening business through her 'nipa' shingles selling business. The profit she makes is enabling her to support the needs of her family especially of her children.

Now, she is again requesting a larger loan to be able to increase her capital for 'nipa' shingles sales. In this way, she will be able to expand her area of coverage for selling in partnership with her husband and she can meet the demand of her customers. Once this happens, her revenue will be increased and she will be a step further along toward achieving her goal of stabilizing the income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase nipa shingles to sell

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Every day, Mrs. S. goes to the market and buys ingredients that she uses to produce fritters to sell to her neighbors for daily profit, earning approximately US$ 2 a day. She has another breadwinner in her husband who drives a motor taxi. The couple is blessed with ten children; four of them are married and the others are single. Four of their daughters are employed at different tasks. To earn additional income, S. requests a loan to buy pigs to begin raising them in her stall. Mrs. S. was not available at the time when the photo was taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy pigs to begin raising them in her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy general grocery products

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort V. produces palm kernel oil for sale at Elmina. She is married and lives with her three children. She has received senior high education.  Comfort uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Comfort will use the loan to purchase palm nuts and a nut processor instead of having to pay for the nuts to be cracked. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to save to buy other equipment which will enable her to produce much palm kernel oil for sale.

To prepare her palm kernel oil she shells the palm nuts. The shelling used to be performed using two stones to crack each nut, separating the kernel and shell simultaneously. This manual operation has been largely superseded by the use of nut-cracking machines.

The traditional oil extraction method is to simply heat the dried nuts to release the palm kernel oil. The released oil is periodically skimmed from the top as heat is applied. This process is continued until almost all the oil is skimmed out of the palm kernels.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan to purchase palm nuts and a nut processor

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthy V., is 29 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Toun (they are pictured together), is 27 years old. They live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2004 and have 3 sons. One of them is in school and other two stay at home. 

Chanthy and his wife have been selling vegetables and fruit for four years. They buy the produce under contract from their village and transport it by cart to sell in Derm Kor market located in Phnom Penh City. But, their cart is old and breaks down, so Chanthy is asking for his first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a new cart to carry vegetables and fruit for sale. He also will use a part of the loan to buy fruit under contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a new cart and buy fruit under contract for resale

loans.name: Abdulmajid

texts.ru: Нормуродов Абдулмажид проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Абдулмажид более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует небольшой участок земли, где сажает пшеницу. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Это поможет ему получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Abdulmajid N. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 46 years old, married and has 6 children. His wife is a homemaker. Abdulmajid has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years. He leases a small plot of land, where he grows wheat. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers, which will help him get a good harvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more business materials

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza Mohammed, age 39, owns rental houses which she rents to the people of Kibera, a business she has engaged in since 1980. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that she lacks funds to build more rental houses. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to renovate her houses. In the future, she hopes to open a wholesale shop to increase her income. Her business is located at Kibera in Nairobi. 

Aziza is married and her husband works for Telkom Kenya. She is a very hardworking, honest, and trustworthy lady.

loans.use: To renovate rental houses

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en:
Genelita A. is from the village of Cawa-cawa. She is 43 years old. Genelita is married and has  school-aged children. To make a living, Genelita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Genelita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Genelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Genelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional variety of products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Genelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Buth

texts.en:
Mrs. Buth R. is a 31-year-old farmer who lives in Phnom Penh city. Buth R. is married to Heng Hun, age 28. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have given birth to four children: all of them are dependent on their income. In addition, Buth R.’s husband takes time to work in construction. 

In view of the coming farming season, Buth R. wants to grow a great amount of crops in order to sell them when they have matured. As she lacks money to make that possible, Buth R. has decided to request a loan from Kiva. Buth R. will use these funds to buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds to plant. (Buth R.’s husband is in the photo.)

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.name: Ubaydullo

texts.ru: Намозов Убайдулло проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 43 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Более 9 лет занимается растениеводством. Он берет в аренду землю, где выращивает овощи. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Ubaydullo N. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 43 years old, married and has 5 children. He has been involved in agriculture for over 9 years. Ubaydullo leases land, where he grows vegetables. His wife helps him with this business. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods to meet customer demand

loans.name: Jofely

texts.en:
Jofely is 38 years old and has been a member of Kiva partner, ASHI, since 2007. She actively participates in all ASHI activities, despite her busy schedule attending to the needs of her fruit and vegetable business and those of her family. For Jofely, a rest day or a day off is the time she spends with her ASHI co-members. Every second, minute and hour of it is her most treasured time because she can learn many things about different aspects of life from the sharing time they have together. For her, knowing and learning to communicate and connect to other people are the best ingredients in making a business, aside from having business capital and other financial services from ASHI. 
Jofely's husband’s support is also very important in making her fruit and vegetable farming and selling business grow. Without that, she would not have the courage to request a loan to expand the business. Her aspiration of supporting the education of her three children until college graduation has always been her top priority. Therefore, she really has to work hard at enhancing her business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old married man and father of one young child. In 2007, he opened a decoration shop where he sells decorative items, wood flooring, curtains, etc., after seeing a need for such services in the region. He has been involved in this occupation for the past 8 years.  He has been serving his small community during this period, and has found an opportunity to expand his business into other areas. 

In order to fulfill his projects and expand his business objectives, Ali is requesting $1,200 to buy more inventory: new wood flooring and new curtain designs that have recently become available in the market.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Muharamoy

texts.en: Muharamoy is a lovely 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children. She runs a small fabric business at the market where she offers a variety of fabrics for different tastes and ages. Muharamoy is asking for this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of goods. The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise and thus improve her business and increase her profits. Her dreams are to have her own large store one day but, most importantly, to enable her children to have a better future – one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals and lead healthy and comfortable lives. On behalf of Muharamoy and everyone at IMON International, thank you for your support! More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema A. is a married woman who runs a small business. She sells soft drinks and snacks at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the soft drinks from her suppliers and she prepares the snacks herself. She buys items needed for her business from retail shops. She has recently managed to add a new endeavor to her business, selling clothes, and she has employed one staff person to help her. 

She needs a loan of T.shs 1,500,000 to boost up the business.

loans.use: To boost up the business

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.en: Tchotcho D. lives and works in the Hédzranawoé neighborhood of Lomé, Togo. She is divorced and has two children. She works selling grains and local sodas and has been in this business since 2004. This will be her second loan with Kiva's partner WAGES, which she will use to resupply her stock of corn, beans, and various Togolese soft drinks. This loan will help her support both her business and her family.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, beans, and soft drinks

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph A. is married and has three children. He has no educational background.  Joseph goes fishing and sells his catch to the market women at Elmina, which he has been doing for some time now. His wife is a petty trader.  Joseph uses his income to educate his children and pay utility bills.  Joseph will add the loan to his income to purchase fishing equipment. With the new profits from his expanded business, Joseph plans to save to buy his own boat.

loans.use: Joseph will add the loan to his income to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Nurnisa

texts.en:
A. Nurnisa is 44 years old. She is a very active and passionate woman. She started her business in 1994 and since that time, she's become a well-experienced and skilled woman and many people of her village coming to ask her advice about keeping livestock. Her primary activity is selling milk and calves for meat production. 

Nurnisa, together with her son who helps her with the business,find themselves more dedicated to selling milk, and Nurnisa would like to expand her activity in this field. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of 5000 Somoni. She will use this loan to purchase a cow for milking. Let's help her reach her goals!   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a cow for milk production

loans.name: Togoohuu

texts.en:
Togoohuu is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a 'ger'. They  have been living together in their current home for three years. He operates a raw materials trading business with his wife. Togoohuu sells raw materials such as cashmere and leather. He has been operating his business since 1999, and has gained much experience in previous years. 

Togoohuu started up his business with a working capital of 1,000,000 tugrugs (~ 705 USD), and he earned a low profit at that time. Since receiving the loan, his profit has increased. He has been planning to grow his business and to build his own cellar. Togoohuu is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person. He says,“I will work hard to expand my business and to improve our family's quality of life”. Togoohuu is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1407 USD) loan to purchase more leather and cashmere for his business.

loans.use: To purchase leather and cashmere

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Ашурматов Шухрат проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 31 год. Женат, детей не имеет. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Шухрат, имеет среднее образование. Более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. Шухрат хочет получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Shuhrat A. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 31 years old, married and has no children. His wife is a homemaker. Shuhrat has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for over 6 years. He has a plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers. Shuhrat wants to get a good harvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Mrs. S. has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. She lives in the capital of Phnom Penh. Since 1992, S. has owned and operated her farm to cultivate a rice crop, from which she earns a daily income. S., 34, is married to Chanthoeun and they have four teenage children. S. wants to look for a new source of income by investing in a new business line. In order to make that possible, she needs to have capital. Because S. has no working capital yet, she decided to seek a loan of $450 to be used to buy rice in bulk from other cultivators to store in her home and resell to earn extra income.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk.

loans.name: Ismatulla

texts.en:
K. Ismatulla is 56 years old. He is married with two children. From the time he was young, Ismatulla was learning to work in a small business with his parents. With a lot of sacrifice, he became a main producer in agriculture in the area where he lived. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice and seeing his family progressing more and more. 

His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children; he hopes to see them as professional, ethical and hard-working. For this reason Ismatulla is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni. He wants this loan to buy additional livestock. Be an important part of the growth of Ismatulla’s business!   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing more livestock

loans.name: Kwame Senyemo

texts.en: Kwame Senyemo D. is a trained technician for Togo Telecom, one of the cell phone service providers in Togo. He is single and does not have children. Currently, he owns and operates a dry cleaning service. He is now asking for his first loan from WAGES to expand his dry cleaning service, which he has been running since 2008. His business is called “Shild Pressing” and is located in the Hédzranawoe district of Lomé. This loan will be used to open a second location to better serve his customers. With your help, Mr. D. will continue to be a successful and prosperous entrepreneur.

loans.use: To open a second dry cleaning location

loans.name: Andre

texts.en:
Andre is a 49-year-old married man. He has two dependent children. He has been working for the past 10 years as a builder doing home projects. He works on a freelance basis and through some entrepreneurs. He also offers painting services to his customers. He has a good demand for his work because over the years, he earned a good reputation. 

Today Andre is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more construction supplies and purchase bigger and more technically advanced tools to pursue more projects and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies and tools

loans.name: Burkhon

texts.en: Burkhon M. is married with five children. His wife is a teacher at a well-known religious middle school. Burkhon has a business of selling women's clothing and towels. He starts his work day in the early hours of the morning by receiving vendors, verifying orders and checking the quality of the products. He is very demanding when it comes to the merchandise he will sell as he does not want his clients to receive defective or unsuitable products. During the day Burkhon receives several orders and attends to his business. His children help their father in their spare time. He wants to instill in them a work ethic from a young age. Burkhon also helps them with their homework as he knows that the most important thing in this stage of their life is an education. This man loves his family and wishes all the best for them; he is a responsible father and a dedicated husband. Burkhon wants to keep succeeding in his business by expanding his stock. He wants to stock a greater variety of products so that his clients do not have to go to other businesses to buy what he does not have in stock. That is the reason that he applied to IMON for a loan of 4800 Somoni. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy wooden planks

loans.name: Kholboy

texts.en:
H. Kholboy is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young, Kholboy has been surrounded by people raising animals and, thanks to the knowledge he has gained from them, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. 

The desire that Kholboy harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. With these, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children, who support him unconditionally in his daily work. 

Kholboy requests a loan of 5,000 Somoni. Let’s get together behind this devoted father to help him keep bring wellbeing and security to the members of his family.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the location of the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Known for its epic mountain passes, the country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent of arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en: M. Hafiza is 45 years old, is married, and is the mother of five adorable children. Hafiza has a grocery store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her family and her home. She began her small business five years ago with financial support from her husband who is an entrepreneur. The reason for starting the business was to increase her large family’s income and the business has been gradually growing ever since. In order to grow her business further, she requests a loan of 8,900 Somoni. She is planning to spend the loan on purchasing more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of her goods. She thanks everyone who decides to support her. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 30-year-old entrepreneur who is married and is the mother of three children. She is originally from Siaya Nyanza province but moved to this coastal area with her husband to look for a job. Francisca and her family live in Likoni, Mombasa.

Francisca was originally a housewife until 2007 when she initiated her own salon. Her business has not done well due to limited funds to purchase cosmetics and the necessary equipment and machines. She needs Ksh 20,000 to buy the most essential materials so as to be able to provide quality services.

Francisca’s dream is to start more salons within the expanded Likoni region.

loans.use: To purchase essentials materials for her business

loans.name: Datchi Ami Holassé

texts.en:
Datchi Ami Holassé K. is 28 years old. She began selling fabrics in 2003 and works as a roaming saleswoman in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo.

Ms. K. purchases her stock from the Grand Market of Lomé and is now seeking to resupply her products. She is asking for her second loan from WAGES, which she will use primarily to purchase more fabrics to sell as well as any other items she may need to keep her business running smoothly.

As a single mother, this loan will help Ms. K. to support her business and her one child.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics to sell

loans.name: Lochin

texts.ru: Ашурматов Лочин проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Лочин более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует землю, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Lochin A. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker. Lochin has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years. He leases land, where he grows vegetables. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is a single parent with two children. She has received junior high education.

Georgina prepares millet porridge locally called ”kooko” which she sells at Elmina. Millet is a commonly cultivated cereal found in the Northern part of Ghana. She uses her income to take care of her two children.

Georgina will use the loan to purchase more millet which will enable her increase the quantity of porridge she prepares for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to use it to improve upon the quality of education of her children.

To prepare “kooko”, Georgina buys the millet from the market, soaks it in plenty of water and allows it to stand overnight. She then mills it with pepper and sweet-scented local spices. She mixes the powdered millet with water to form dough, after which it is then left for about eight hours.

She then takes some of it and makes it into a mixture. Water is heated to the boiling point and she then she pours the mixture gradually into the very hot water, stirring gently to prevent lumps from forming. After stirring for five minutes the porridge is ready to be served with sugar, bread, biscuits or anything you wish to eat it with.

loans.use: To purchase more millet to increase the quantity of porridge she prepares

loans.name: Benso. Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benso sont essentiellement de  femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant dans des familles monogames à Noumousso, un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire, tous les précédents se sont  bien dénoués. 
Elles font la  la vente d’habits, de beurre de karité, de gingembre, la fabrication des boissons non alcoolisées, d’encens etc.
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 douzaines d’habits pour  enfants, 85kg de beurre de karité, 20kg de sucre, 5 types d’encens, 3kg de tamarin, 10 paquets de sachet en plastique. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent au marché, à domicile et  de façon ambulante, au comptant  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 22.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un coin de vente.
texts.en:
The members of the Benso group are for the most part married women. On average they are 32 years old, have three children and live in monogamous families in the Noumousso neighborhood of Kadiolo, in the third administrative region of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customer needs and are requesting a fifth group loan, all preceding loans having been reimbursed in full. They retail clothes, shea butter, ginger, incense, produce non-alcoholic beverages, etc. With their new loan they want to buy three dozen sets of children’s clothes, 85 kilos of shea butter, 20 kilos of sugar, 5 sorts of incense, 3 kilos of tamarind, 10 packages of plastic bags. They get their supplies from the main market in Kadiolo and from neighboring villages. They resell in the market, as itinerant vendors or by home delivery, for cash but often on credit, to a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach an average monthly income of 22,500 FCFA each, of which part will go into savings and answer family needs, and the remainder will be reinvested in the business activities. They are counting on an increase in their working capital to better satisfy customer demand and to set up a stall for their sales activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia S. is happy for having five children whose age range is from 4 to 17 years. However, because of her small income from selling fruits and vegetables raised by her husband, who is a farmer, she feels guilty sometimes because she can’t give her children things they need. But despite that, she still feels privileged because her husband and children are all loving and understanding.

In 2007, Sonia joined ASHI in order to have the opportunity of obtaining a loan to finance her business growth. Since then she has also been able to receive loans which support her husband’s business. With that, the volume of fruits and vegetables she sells has increased a bit as well as her profit.

With the hope that, by making her business profitable and sustainable, she will  be able to reach her dream of graduating her five children from college, Sonia is requesting a larger loan from ASHI.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide for her husband's farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost his businesses

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 40-year-old married mother of two children. She currently lives in Likoni, Mombasa region, but is originally from Nyanza province.

Pamela, who initially owned a secondhand clothes and fish business, now owns a nursery school. This she initiated from her small savings in 2000 after many years of hard work and personal sacrifices. Her business is currently doing well with the number of pupils increasing day by day.

Pamela has applied for Ksh 40,000 to put up more classrooms. She has big plans and hope that her business will transform itself into a high school in future.

loans.use: To build more classrooms

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Galdaansuren

texts.en:
Galdaansuren is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a “ger”. They have been living together in their current home for three years. His two sons haven't yet reached school age and they stay at home.

Currently, Galdaansuren operates a flour and rice trading business with his wife in her home province. He started his business in 2007 with a working capital of 1,000,000 tugrugs.

Galdaansuren purchases flour and rice at wholesale prices from local salespeople and resell them for a profit from the shipping container that he owns. He has been planning to purchase the products that he sells from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to save the transportation cost. Thus, he has been planning to purchase his own truck which will help him to increase the business profit.

Galdaansuren and his wife work very hard and they are quite enthusiastic about their future. They have many plans for the future and Galdaansuren says, “I would like to expand my business and to purchase a truck. In addition, I would like to bring up my children in the right way and to be financially able to support their education.”

Galdaansuren is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more flour and rice for his trading business.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Makhmasharif

texts.en: R. Makhmasharif is 54 years old and sells household goods such as kettles, pails, basins and other items. He has been in this business for more than thirty years. Having a rich experience, Makhmasharif is able to choose such goods as meet the requirements of clients whose tastes differ. The business is quite successful and generates a stable income that allows Makhmasharif to improve the living condition of his family and make his kids happy. Makhmasharif has been provided with several loans by IMON during almost four years. He had shown himself to be an accurate client having a positive credit history. Today Makhmasharif requests 5,000 Somoni which he is planning to spend on purchasing new household goods to sell, thus enlarging his range of goods. With your help, this will be possible. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new household goods to sell

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djantoyerela sont toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 29ans, 2 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Noumousso un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo une préfecture de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de fruits et légumes,  de condiments alimentaires, de pâte d’arachide, des céréales etc.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 4 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 8 à 15 paniers de fruits et légumes, 2sacs de 100kg de graine d’arachide et pour en faire la pâte d’arachide. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Kadiolo ville et les localités avoisinantes.  Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Kadiolo ville et souvent en famille à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins quotidiens, l’épargne et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Djantoyerela are all married.  They average 29 years of age and two children each living for the most part in monogamous families in Noumouss, a district of Kadiolo City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are on their fifth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  All their previous loans have been repaid. The group members have a diversity of businesses, including the sale of fruit and vegetables, condiments, peanut butter, grains, etc.  With this new loan, they intend to buy 4 packets of condiments, 8 to 15 baskets of fruit and vegetables, and two 100-kg sacks of peanuts for making peanut butter. They get their supplies at the big market of Kadiolo City and from neighboring towns.  The merchandise is sold mostly for cash at the Kadiolo City market and often together as a family.  The customer base is composed of women. The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 18,500 francs CFA.  Part of it will be used for day-to-day needs and savings.  The other part will be invested into the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying food items

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira is married and is the mother of three children. For more than ten years she has been running a grocery store business. Nazira sells delicious baked cookies and cakes as well as a variety of candy. Some of her inventory spoils quickly so she has to buy fresh merchandise every two days. She has a nice big vending spot in the market and offers a huge variety of fresh cookies, pastries, cakes and candy to please many different customers’ tastes. Last year Nazira used profits generated from her business to remodel her entire apartment. She is very cheerful and open-hearted, which always attracts many potential clients to her vending kiosk. She is requesting a loan of 9,500 Somoni to increase her assorted inventory, continue to grow as an entrepreneur, and possibly open a new vending facility in the near future. loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of televisions

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 35 year old mother of two school-aged children. She lives with her family in Likoni but originally is from Nyakach in Nyanza province. 

Catherine is the proprietor of a cereal store in Mwembe Tayari in Mombasa. She started this store in 2005. She used to help her family run a charcoal business. Catherine often travels as far as Meru and Busia once or twice in a week to get her stock due to the high demand for her products.

Her future dream is to expand her store to a wholesale store with the 40,000 KES she has applied for.

loans.use: To expand her store

loans.name: Inaya

texts.en:
Inaya is a 47-year-old married woman. A mother of one dependent child, she opened a small business in the agriculture sector to help her husband with the family's income and to pay for her child's schooling. She works hard with her husband to make profits to be able to finalize the construction and preparations related to their home. She cultivates all types of vegetables according to the season. She also sells plants. 

Today, Inaya is requesting to borrow $1,200 to prepare an agriculture tent to increase her cultivation and be able to make more agriculture products to increase both her sales and income.

loans.use: To prepare an agriculture tent

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en: S. Farzona is married and has a little kid. For almost three years Farzona has spent a great part of her time working and managing her grocery store. She has always looked for a way to generate income for her home, which is why her grocery store is not her first job. Previously, Farzona worked at a traveling fruit stand. However, she thinks that maintaining her store is a more secure job. She plans to continue improving her grocery store in order to have a diversity of goods and to be able to increase her sales. For now, Farzona feels happy to have helped her husband with their family expenses. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase goods to increase the range of items for sale.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Soutoura, toutes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et 3 enfants vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Noumousso un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo préfecture de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents se sont  bien dénoués. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de fruits et légumes, de condiments,  de pâte d’arachide et d’huile alimentaire.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 colis de condiments, 10 paniers de fruits et légumes, 2 sacs de 100kg de graine d’arachide (pour en faire la pâte d’arachide) et 4 bidons de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Kadiolo ville et les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Kadiolo ville et souvent en famille à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins quotidiens, l’épargne et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Soutoura group are all married, average 29 years old and have an average of three children. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Noumousso, one of the districts of the town of Kadiolo in the prefecture of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their fourth collaboration with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, and all the previous loans have been repaid without problem. They have various activities which include the sale of fruit and vegetables, condiments, peanut butter and (edible) oil.With this new loan they are planning to buy five parcels of condiments, ten baskets of fruit and vegetables, two 100kg bags of peanut seeds (to make peanut butter) and four 20 liter cans of oil. They get their supplies at the large market in Kadiolo town and the neighboring towns. The goods are sold on the market at Kadiolo town and often in the family to a customer base made up essentially of women; the majority of sales are made for cash. They envisage making an average monthly profit of 18,500 FCFA each, of which part will be used for daily needs and savings, while the rest will be reinvested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Kpatagno

texts.en:
Kpatagno M. is 26 years old, married to a house painter, and has one child. She lives and works in the Hédzranawoé district of Lomé selling shoes and purses. She sells her products in the Grand Marché of Hédzranawoé, a popular spot for consumers in the area.

This will be her third loan with WAGES, which she will use to resupply her stock. She will spend the majority of this loan on shoes and the remainder on purses and any other items needed. Thank you for contributing to Mrs. M.’s continued success.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and purses for resale

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman with four children who attend school. She owns a two-room house where she lives with five people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. She takes care of additional family members. The family gets three meals per day. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees. 

Charity owns a restaurant where she works seven days per week. She would like to purchase food items like bananas, rice, Irish potatoes and utensils for her restaurant with the Ush 1,500,000 loan from MCDT. She owns the space for her business, which she has been running for 12 years.  She has at least 20 customers a day. Her greatest challenges are transportation and seasonality. Charity has worked with MCDT for seven years and chose the organization because they are easy and considerate. Charity hopes to open another branch

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like bananas, rice, Irish potatoes and utensils

loans.name: Kobil

texts.ru: Оев Кобил проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 20 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребёнка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Кобил имеет средне- специальное образование. Кроме того занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он продает каляски и детские игрушки. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Kobil O. lives in the Vahdat district. He is 20 years old, married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. Kobil has a secondary-specialized education. He is involved in retail sales and has a store, where he sells baby strollers and children's toys. Kobil is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Zarafo

texts.en:
T. Zarafo, 30, runs a beauty salon offering hair styling, haircutting, manicure, and cosmetology. She also rents out wedding dresses and accessories for decorating wedding cars. The salon is successful and generates a stable income for the family. Zarafo is planning to remodel her salon and requests $1125 US Dollars. Zarafo thanks all those supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.
